title: Great Cinatown Location
desc: When I booked in March , I became aware that the 5 days I needed to stay in Singapore was durng F1 week which explained the high hotel rates even 6 months out, and the limited availability. At the time of booking, all that was available was an interior room (without window). On arrival, I was very happy to be allocated a room with a very small balcony and windows. Pros: * Location is in Chatatown, directly opposite the new Maxwell MRT * Within short walking distance to Maxwell, Amoy & Chinatown Food Centres, and within 5 minutes of Amoy Street where there are many restaurants (should you tire of food centres) * Hotel room has a small refidgerator with free beverages (soft drinks, Coconut water, and Tiger beers), These are topped up daily as are te chocolate bars and packets of

title: 4 night break for Singapore GP
desc: Stayed for 4 nights for the Singapore Formula 1 race, it was great. Really friendly, helpful staff, room ideal with good amenities, bed very comfortable and hotel in excellent position for MRT and Chinatown.

title: Great location
desc: I recently stayed at the Scarlet Hotel, on the very edge of Chinatown. There are many things that make this hotel a great place to stay. First and foremost is it's incredible location, being right next to Chinatown, and also Club Street, which is packed with cosy bars and restaurants and has a quaint old colonial street appeal. The interior decor of the hotel is loaded with character, and my room was very comfortable and clean. It's worth choosing a premier room as you have windows that open onto a tiny balcony, and this lends a sense of a bit more space than the other smaller rooms. The staff are delightful and extremely helpful. You cannot fault the service here. My main complaint, if anything, was the quality of the breakfast provided, which costs around $30 but is absolutely

title: Excellent location!
desc: Excellent location, just take less than 1 minutes to go to famous food court - Maxwell and take around 2-3 minutes to go to China Town. But some of the facilities are not in good condition, for example the bath room door, the shower and tv.

title: Good hotel with great staff
desc: We found the Scarlet a really good hotel. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The bed was very comfortable and the amenities were good. We had a small issue with the sink and they organised maintenance to attend within 30 minutes. Don’t let that concern you, the hotel is good.

title: Unique Stay!
desc: Perfect location in Chinatown, close to all the good eats and Hawker Food Stalls. One con is we wish the room had windows. We honestly didn't use any other amenities, like the spa or step foot in the restaurant.

title: A Small Luxury Hotel Indeed!
desc: As part of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World portfolio, the Scarlet has lived up to its expectations. The room was small but cozy, and had all the amenities you would actually find in most luxury hotels. The gym was surprisingly well equipped, but the outdoor jacuzzi could only accommodate 4 people at the most. The breakfast was fine, but a bigger selection of hot food would have been much appreciated. I was very pleased with my stay!

title: My Favourite Quirky Hotel Singapore
desc: We stayed one night before flying out of Singapore. This gorgeous hotel in a row of heritage converted shophouses has a sloping hallway, half floors and a roof top terrace. The staff and service are lovely, breakfast was nice and the room whilst very small, was comfortable and clean, the bathroom is large and lovely. I know that the rooms are all different. Location is fabulous, across the road from genuine Singapore Hawkers market, end of the street is Chinatown. Only downside is the build occurring mext door for a new MRT station, not a pretty view and noisy during the day, was fine overnight though - request a back of hotel room is my suggestion. Love the Scarlet Hotel.

title: Really nice :)
desc: We have been there for 3 nights and everything has been as expected, nice staff and polite, clean room and nice breakfast:) And a big point more is for the position,perfect! Near to all the best points

title: Location & Price equals value.
desc: What was I worried about before booking at the Scarlett? The location was right side of city for cruise port and within Chinatown where we hadn't been before. We had secured early a good price on Wotif. We liked the idea of the heritage of the converted shop houses. Some reviews mentioned lack of a window. So we asked by email before arriving and were granted one. If we weren't granted one, multiple lights on dimmer switches. Some reviews how small the standard room. There was a trestle for one suitcase and I stored mine in the dead space between front door and bathroom door. Mention of a tired bathroom. Sure some mildew on grout and sealant, but a good shower with good volume of flow. I liked the bathroom, compact and functional. It rained the first morning. You can

title: ATTENTION, rip-off, not recommended !!
desc: This is not a boutique hotel and does not meet the promised SLH (Small Luxury Hotels of the World) standard at all. I can only agree with the previous reviews, the Scarlet hotel does not meets international standards and also not the promised category. It is also not a boutique hotel at all in my point of view. The service is extremely bad and poor. And as other guests already stated in their ratings here before. When you complain, you actually get silly and cheeky answers. 1.) The booking process was very complicated. First there were rooms available, then suddenly not anymore. Since SLH friends absolutely recommended this hotel to me, I wrote to the hotel the night before and inquired. There was no answer, so I asked again the next day, after I had landed in Singapore

title: Nice hotel, but the beds must be improved
desc: The staff, the location and the hotel itself is quite nice. The rooms are very clean, which I always value the most. Some maintenance regarding the bathroom could be done, it could be renewed. The room we had was quite small, which we find not according to what we paid for. One major issue is the bed. The mattress is extremely hard. After having complained after the first night, they placed an extra top on it, but this was so thin, that no difference is noticeable. This would be a reason for me not to go back again, which is a pity, because itself the hotel is very nice.

title: My Stay
desc: The room was quite small for two person. Really thought that it would have a larger room for two person. Also, usually during my stay in Singapore, they will tidy up the room everyday even when I am not around as when I came back from work/meeting, the room is clean and the bed is already made but at Scarlet, they did not do this.

title: Older hotel with limited services. Not a 24hr service Hotel. Roof top terrace is seperate business and only accessible
desc: Older hotel with limited services. Not a 24hr service Hotel. Roof top terrace is seperate business and only accessible Limited hours. Restaurant is also a separate business. Quality of food in breakfast buffet is quite poor with limited selection. No 24hr room service. Close to restaurants and bar a few min walk around the corner. It’s a novelty character hotel created from connected street houses so corridors slope with the street (feels the the house that jack built). Pictures on website make it look better than it is. A pretty basic hotel with limited services with a novel character feel.

title: Comfortable stay and friendly staff
desc: Stayed at this hotel for three nights and must say that the beds are most comfortable. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean. The gym is small, but has all equipment needed for a workout. The location of the hotel is good. I would recommend this hotel to future travellers and would come back here the next time I visit Singapore.

title: top boutique hotel
desc: The Scarlet is a sassy hotel in a great location on the edge of China town. Lovely, modern, luxurious room, great bathrooms and very comfortable beds. There's also a hawker food market just over the road for high quality, low-cost food local as well.

title: Brilliant hotel
desc: First time in this hotel in heart of Chinatown. Best welcome with complimentary drink and cold towel in lobby. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Room small but well equipped. Good buffet breakfast. Nearby food market great.

title: Fine hotel
desc: A very comfortable hotel whether for an overnight or longer stay. Room and facilities were terrific, especially ones with small balcony and doors to open. The staff were very good.i welcomed being able to use the meeting room after checkout and before a late flight. And there’s a great Chinese food street down and around the corner. Perfect for a solo traveller.

title: A great boutique hotel ! Well situated on edge of china town
desc: Delighted with this hotel ! Beds comfortable sheets and pillows delightful ! Good breakfast ! Nice shower ! Jaded decor ! Staff friendly and helpful ! Note that if you are arriving from UK and have been up all night , you need to request that room be available early , or you will have to fall asleep in lobby , waiting fir room to be available at 2.00 pm ! Secondly this hotel appears not to be serviced by the airport shuttle which is not good news !! Alternative is a very costly taxi !! Despite odd and funny rules about booking airport shuttle and trying to plan two days in advance , and some 2 am phone calls ; which is apparently the time to book the airport shuttle ??; the shuttle did not wish to pick me up for my return to the airport !! Only offering me a 5 am

title: Disappointed.
desc: On our previous stay we enjoyed the Executive Room with Balcony; especially the balcony were we sat evenings absorbing the sounds, scents and sensations of Singapore. That is why I chose to re-book the same accommodation, well in advance. We arrived at the Scarlet mid-afternoon, tired, having travelled since the previous morning, and were asked to wait. Eventually I made enquiries and was told that we had been up-graded to the Suite which was being prepared. So we waited some more. Our suite was large, comfortable, over-looking an intersection and more stylish (to the point of being almost garish). But NO balcony. The only alternative to enjoying the sentience of Singapore was to go down into the streets. I was surprised and disappointed that an establishment of the repute of

title: Sleek, wonderful boutique hotel!
desc: The hotel is charming and classy, very unique in its nature. You feel a mix of colonial old style and Chinese vibe, the mood is extravagant yet cozy. The staff is very helpful and professional. The location is simply perfect for a stay in Singapore, whether it’s business or leisure, because it’s close to Marina Bay and to Chinatown too.

title: Don’t get the room like a prison cell
desc: I really like this property but unfortunately this time I was placed in a room with no external light from the sun. I could never tell the t8me of day and when you combine this with jet lag. Well it makes your stay more difficult. Maybe I didn’t pay enough and was therefore allocated a bad room. I’m sure they must know. I regularly stay at this hotel must be my 5th visit.

title: Great location. Neat and tidy hotel.
desc: A small room but neat and tidy. The ocation is this hotel's selling point. It's close to China Town and 5 minutes walk from an underground station so easy access to the rest of Singapore. Staff helpful.

title: Lovely staff, but the hotel needs a refurbishment
desc: Great location and Staff, however the room product was lacking, there was significant mould to the walls which is just not acceptable at the price I paid. Breakfast is also disappointing. However dinner was very good.

title: Brilliant
desc: We stayed here for 4 days on our way to Thailand. A beautiful hotel, immaculately clean throughout, my wife has a little OCD around this so it says a lot. Bathrobes and slippers provided, guest umbrellas in your room, ( not needed thankfully!) Staff very courteous and helpful, one member in particular who really helped to arrange a special evening at 1 Altitude for my wife's birthday. A real experience and a great location in Chinatown. This area being perfect as a base to get out and see the fantastic sights. A last mention for the breakfast at the hotel, freshly prepared food replenished often, looked great and tasted even better. All in all a great experience :)

title: Beautiful furnishings
desc: This boutique hotel was a spot on as I love independent shops & they have a couple of shops within walking distance. The check in was prompt & efficient. The room was very beautifully decorated and romantic. Chinatown is just a stu

title: Boutique hotel conveniently located in China Town
desc: We enjoyed a 2 night stay here in the heart of China Town - within easy walk of Club Street so very easy to find nearby bars and restaurants in the evening. As SLH indulged me beers breakfast was included in our package, and was a continental style buffet. Our room was a long way from the lobby, but a reasonable size with ensuite shower. The bed was a little hard for our liking and the mattress needed replacing, but otherwise we enjoyed our stay here. The staff were very accommodating and made our stay more special. Recommend this hotel if you want a more traditional experience.

title: Chic, eclectic decor in a great location---kind staff
desc: We arrived a 7:30 am after a 17 hour flight and went to the hotel to leave our bags. The staff allowed us to change and shower in the Jacuzzi area, and that made a huge difference in hot, sweaty Singapore. They provide free newspapers (including the New York Times) in an air conditioned lobby and gave us many extra bottles of cold water. They were very gracious and accommodating. The room was way in the back along long hallways but clean, well designed and comfortable.

title: Very good location near China town
desc: Very good location, near to everything starting from food and bar and nice aria to explore. China town is a nice and live place till late night. The hotel rooms are not too big but enough. Breakfast is also nice (Italian style)

title: Great hotel that's not a box
desc: The Scarlet is in a very good location (walking distance to lots of stores and restaurants), has all the amenities (except for one: they have no business center/printers), and is refreshingly different - a smaller, older, charming boutique hotel. Nice change of pace from your standard business hotel.

title: Inspired!
desc: The Scarlet is a quirky boutique gem a stones throw from the hussle and bussle of Chinatown. It's an old shophouse that's been converted so no two rooms are exactly alike in size. Best for couples! The decor is awesome and harks to another era and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Excellent value for money and it's my go to when in Singapore.

title: Great Hotel
desc: This is a great hotel in a superb location, and good value. It's quirky and comfortable and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a little on the small side.

title: Did the job
desc: Good location for visiting China town and good value for money, room was clean and had everything but was small and very noisy throughout the night from inside and outside the hotel. We got woken up by housekeeping at 11pm, again at 8am and again at 10am which left us a little frustrated however the staff in reception were friendly and helpful.

title: Great Design, great team, a few details
desc: The Scarlett is greatly located close to Chinatown. This stylish place welcomes you with its design and a posh look. The lobby, the people you simply feel the difference. The rooms are in different sizes and some may find them to small or will be bothered by not having a nice view. If you like to have that, you have to stay at the Marina. This place is for individuals, who like the design and the little details. Cookies as a welcome, a personal mobile travel guide called Handy and other little things. The only reason why this place is not a 5 star for me : the luck of maintaining the details. Lose power sockets, molded silicon in the bathroom. This is not necessary and even bothered me. Breakfast is great, the Yacuzzi on the roof top is great, too. A cool place, wish they would

title: Unbelievable!
desc: Landing early morning I arrived at this hotel by 7:50am and of course the room I booked was not ready. But I was offered a Deluxe one (room 105), costing more 75$ (++, being in Singapore), promptly available. I accepted, rushed in, freshed up, changed and rushed out to attend a meeting by 9am. I came back to my room only at late evening, to discover it has NO WINDOW!!! When I pulled open the existing curtains, I faced a wall!!! With only small glasses at the upper end. Not to mention the broken tapestry or the rusty (and as aged as myself) safety locker at the door. And from a drawer I saw this hotel is supposed to belong to the Small Luxury Hotels Chain!!!!

title: Singapore chill out
desc: Wonderful hotel Great friendly staff All one wants for a wind down for en extensive time away traveling Highly recommend The Scarlet I certainly will be returning Attached restaurant serves the best Italian cuisine

title: Asian Bohemian Fusion
desc: Not your average hotel - very quirky and enjoyable. Location is probably its best feature, close to lots of really laid back bars & restaurants with a bit Bohemian Asian fusion going on. Would highly recommend it if you're looking for something less

title: overall good
desc: did not drive, so wouldn't know the parking space if any. Breakfast was good, wifi was good, room was clean and location in chinatown. And this review should not require minimum 200 words. Sometimes there is not much to be said.

title: Room (without) a View
desc: Most aspects of the hotel were fine, particularly the location, but we made the mistake of booking a room without a window. The Hotel's design incorporates long winding (windowless) corridors to these rooms, which makes it difficult to judge time, is unnerving and detracts from the experience. It would also create a deathtrap in the case of a fire.

title: Great hotel
desc: Very friendly staff, great hotel with rooms very comfortable and clean. Hotel is situated in a great spot,very convenient to Chinatown. Breakfast very good, afternoon drinks on the rooftop was nice looking out over China town.

title: lovely hotel
desc: Just look at the photographs on the website, you will not be disappointed. The room was very clean and quiet, and the staff are very helpful. I sent an email requesting a room with a window after reading another review, the reply was quick, and although the room could not be guaranteed, I did get one. The hotel is in an excellent location and within a short walking distance to the food hall and Chinatown. We only stayed there for 3 nights before moving on, but would definitely stay there again.

title: great value and location
desc: great hotel for the price and great location in china town. the perfect hotel if you're not interested in hotel pools, etc and actually want to go see singapore. room was a good size, modern, very clean and the staff very helpful.

title: Great Experience
desc: This Scarlet has the authentic and a very vibrant environment, Surrounded by clubs, lounge, pub and great historical area in Singapore. By day its a formal corner, by night its a great place to have your intimate moment. Suitable for couple, solo and backpacker. You are able to rest, to explore the natural environment there. So, head up to road again. GO!!!

title: Good Location
desc: Hotel is in a great location close to Chinatown and the Maxwell food centre. Plenty of restaurants and bars close by. The rooms are small and a little dark so it was nice to have a balcony to sit outside.

title: Visit July 2018
desc: Very friendly staff and very clean throughout. Easy to make fittings such as shower and lighting/ air conditioning work well. Would have preferred light breakfast to be available before 7 am if necessary via room service.

title: July visit
desc: The room was smaller for two person. Also the bathroom. Price per that room was too high. Smartphone service available in the room is a very good idea. We used to go around the city, using maps and app.

title: Great hotel, location and heplful staff
desc: We arrived at 2:30am and were speedily checked in, the room was a LOT bigger than we expected and even had a little terrace (we had not booked a balcony room), the room was clean, comfortable and had all the amenities needed. It is located near to Club Street, two Hawker centres and several MRT stops but is still very quiet. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to others!

title: Average premium room but pricey
desc: Experienced some overflowing of water while draining from bathtub which causes flooding in the toilet. Staffs were nice and polite. Provided good service (: Overall was okay but kinda pricey for the premium room if there’s no promotion.

title: Good room
desc: Location Near maxwell /chaina town /7-11/ club street, not far MRT chainatown Room Big room / very clean / good amenities / Underground room does not have window Service Nice receptionist / Free WIFI/

title: Nice motel
desc: We stayed here on a 3 day stopover from Thailand back to Australia. We had a room that had no windows (why). They should just make it a storage closet. It is good value& Handy to downtown Singapore, trains, buses. Must see Gardens by the Bay. Night zoo was ok, we did the tram ride which was disappointing, better walking around.

title: Boutique Hotel
desc: Our stay at this hotel was very comfortable since it is walking distance to Chinatown. The Maxwell Food Center was just in front where you could enjoy various affordable food. The room we had was cozy and elegant, the balcony as well as lobby is picture perfect. I enjoyed their free breakfast since its set up is just like your own kitchen and dining at home plus the food was sumptous. Will definitely recommend this place....

title: Great location but small rooms
desc: Great location, friendly staff however the rooms are very small especially if travelling with a Baby. Very convenient location to get to most attractions in this fantastic city. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. Walking distance to China Town.

title: Spot in the Center of the City
desc: The room with a window was super tiny. The room without window was bigger but not having a window is kind of weird. I loved the furnishing as well as the colorful style of the place and the staff was super nice! It's practical to be able to walk to Marina as well as discovering other areas of Singapore by foot!

title: Chinatown Favourite
desc: Cleaning 10/10 no dust anywhere ! Our room old but exceptionally clean. The hallway colour scheme still shocked me every day. Firm but comfortable bed The staff very accommodating. Great shower water pressure. Underground Rail 5 min slow walk. Easy to access everything. Taxi $13SGD to airport. 5 min walk to China Town and restaurants everywhere. Loved our 5 nights here and in this area

title: Decent hotel but not worth the price
desc: Hotel and room’s interior are special and the ambience is not bad. However, size of room and the bed is surprisingly small for a premium suite. Rather disappointed because it’s below my expectations from the photos I’ve seen online.

title: stylish oasis
desc: From the moment you walk through the foyer you know you are somewhere special. It's cool, has a water feature, smells like incense and has fantasy furniture. The Scarlet is in a series of renovated old shophouses so has an old world vibe. The rooms are quite small but clean, comfortable and cool. The hotel is quiet, the staff friendly and the location excellent. Just across the road from the Maxwell food centre, a 2 minute walk to Chinatown

title: Funky hotel in Chinatown
desc: Great little hotel we stayed at for stopover on way home. We arrived early in morning and as our room was ready we were able to get in to room straight away. Staff were super friendly, efficient and helpful. Our room was small but was clean and fine for short stay. Jacuzzi was great to refresh in after long flight.

title: Very good
desc: Very good location, right next to the Maxwell Hawker Center and Chinatown. An easy walk to the Chinatown underground station, and there was a bus stop just around the corner..The hotel is old but has been refurbished.

title: Great location for young travelers
desc: Location: The hotel is located at a great location with plenty of great bars and eateries within a stone's throw. The Maxwell Food Centre is also just a 3 minutes walk away which offers a great variety of local food. Interior: Superbly designed with a tinge of vintage cabaret opulence. The lobby, corridors and room were beautifully designed and decorated. The toilet pales in comparison though. Room: Clean and bed was very comfortable! The air condition was a bit wonky, it was too cold so I turned it warmed and when I tired turning down the temperature again, it didn't go down, so I had a warm night's sleep. Staff: The bellboy was attentive and helpful with getting the door for me, handling my luggage all the way from the front desk to my room and when I checked-out, he

title: Good all round hotel
desc: Well located hotel to see the sights of Singapore Clean, well run hotel Couple of drawbacks were a glass toilet door which obviously didn't give too much privacy A shower head which was blocked(although quickly rectified by staff once informed) It was our honeymoon & although they were notified a couple of times this wasn't acknowledged But apart from these small gripes it was an enjoyable stay at the scarlet

title: A touch of luxury at a reasonable price
desc: Hotel Scarlet is ideally located just a few minutes walk from Chinatown and about five minutes from Chinatown MRT Station. This puts one within easy reach of Singapore's main attractions via the very efficient MRT network. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and well appointed. Staff are most pleasant and helpful in every way.

title: OK.
desc: Hotel needs to credit back reservations kept for mini bar before the guest leaves hotel. They kept S$ 100 from my credit card during check in. Confirmed at the check out that I do not have any additional payments. Still my money is not given back. It shows as a payment in my credit card balance and therefore, I cannot use that money yet.

title: Holiday stop over
desc: A great hotel that was different to the main stream and well worth staying at as the staff were great as was the location. The only draw back for us was when we bookies we booked as a family of 3 but on arrival we’re told the room had one king size bed so would be worth double checking they have.kids beds if traveling as a family

title: Great boutique hotel
desc: Built in a number of old houses in the outskirts of Chinatown. Stylish, good service. Be aware not to book the cheapest rooms. These have no windows! Unbelievable in this level of a hotel. The test was really up to high standards

title: A nice surprise!
desc: The Scarlet was really unexpected. Don’t be fooled by the unassuming exterior. It’s a lovely place and once you step in, it’s like walking into a different era. Reminding me of a time when it’s all about decadence. Lovely staff who were extremely helpful from the moment you check in. The room was really great. I was upgraded to the Executive Room which was nice. Love the amenities provided as well. Great location as there are good places to eat within walking distance like Chinatown and Maxwell Food Centre. Definitely a place I will come back to.

title: Nice hotel good location to Chinatown.
desc: The hotel is good great location to Chinatown. Needs an update in the rooms as feels old. Beds are comfortable and the pillows. Need to go a bigger room as they are very small not enough room for suitcases. Shower pressure great. It’s a good base just for a few days not for a long time the staff are lovely.

title: Great environment!!!
desc: Spent a great night with my GF for holiday! love the location most. Can walk directly to Chinatown and enjoy all kinds of impressive food! Can score 99/100! 1 point less is because the lobby entrance is not so obvious to find :)

title: Singapore stopover on way homefrom rivercruise
desc: small boutique hotel with rooms to match. Be careful of room styles and sizes to suit your needs.. Ours was too small for our requirements, but our son in the room next store was more than happy. Overall I loved the hotels ambience, Breakfast was good, not great but did the job. Value for money and I like the location.

title: Stop off on way home to UK
desc: Found this hotel on the tripadvisor web site. Liked the idea of it being close to Chinatown and other central locations, 10 mins taxi to centre. Also the fact it was an historic building and not a generic multi national hotel. Lived up to expectations! Pictures give good images of the interior. Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean, tidy and well equipped rooms. No windows not really an issue when you consider the original use and sympathetic reuse of the buildings Roof top bar was a bonus. The restaurant had substantial breakfast options. Air con certailny needed. Recommend this hotel to fellow travellers..

title: It is what it is!?
desc: The Scarlet is a great location and central to most of the places you want to see in Singapore, close to China Town and a small and friendly property. I do feel it could do with a refurb as the gothic look/feel just seems dated and dark now. The house keeping was an issue as myself and colleagues were left with dirty coffee cups in the room or sink, towels not replaced and gowns left where they lay. The staff were mixed between friendly, helpful and the scary,with a strange uniform and contacts was a little unnerving. However, big spacious bathroom and for work was absolutely fine and is nice not to be in the big high rises around Marina Bay

title: Still an interesting hotel but off its game, and got a WINDOWLESS ROOM
desc: I liked the Scarlet when it first opened more than a decade ago, stayed a couple of times: it was lush, decadent and polished. I stayed again for 2 nights recently and it's still got great bones but it doesn't seem as tightly run, or polished, and the rates, and the operation itself, have drifted downmarket a bit. I would have given it 3.5 or 4 stars but the hotel committed the cardinal sin of putting me in a windowless room (contrary to my expectations). That's just not on. Let me be clear: there's nothing wrong with a hotel offering windowless rooms, but they need to match them to guests who are happy to stay in them (perhaps for a lower price). It's about disclosure. Springing a windowless room on a guest is highly risky and I can't believe the Scarlet is still doing this

title: Disappointing
desc: Not what I'd expect of a 5* ... no assistance to my room on arrival, had to ask for my room to be serviced, mouldy shower cubicle, shower leaked, complimentary mini bar comprised of 4 items & wasn't restocked during my visit, Jacuzzi was great however maintenance had to be called on both occasions I used it to get it started. Staff not interested when I checked out stating my visit hadnt been comfortable.

title: Business stopover
desc: Great little hotel, trying not to use the word boutique but that is what the hotel truly is. Felt like a nice small hotel professionally ran. In what is a very big fairly sterile city with plenty of sterile hotels this was a pleasant change and one I will definitely use again for short business trips in the future.

title: Cool Boutique hotel
desc: Cool boutique hotel converted from a conservation shophouse. They are conveniently located (walking distance to central business districts and to nearby pubs and restaurants in Club Street). However the rooms are rather dark and smallish and they vary from room to room (so any review depends on the room in nature).

title: Singapore
desc: Historical building in China town close to all the tourist attractions. Beautiful view from the top of the building. Nice and comfortable room. You get a mobile phone with internet connection and free international and local calls. Lovely experience

title: Average at best
desc: There were a few things about this hotel that was not as expected, firstly check in and out was not as good as it could be, on check out we just got a "your all set" no thank you for your stay or even was it a good stay. I also noticed that the guest checking in next to us were given a cold towel and drink, which we didn't get offered. The location of the hotel is central, although what you don't see in the pictures is that the opposite side of the street is under construction and not the prettiest to look at. We had a executive room with balcony, it was VERY small, best for one person, you cannot pass at the same time at the end of the bed easily and the balcony you're pretty much sitting next to your neighbour, the other downside is the noise that you get from the road behind

title: Center of china town in singapore
desc: This place is good location to walk around china town. Many restaurant include Max well near this hotel. There are many good bars around hotel and can walk. The nearest MRT (chinatown) can walk about 500 metre. This place is noisy from car but easily to find this hotel.

title: Lovely hidden gem
desc: The Scarlett is a lovely refurbished boutique hotel. It's a 2 minute walk to Ann Siang Road and Club Street where there is an abundance of bars and restaurants. The rooms are lovely and the staff friendly and helpful.

title: Really unique atmosphere.
desc: I have spent 5 nights by myself on a business trip. The hotel is really particular and probably it is what you are expecting to find in an exotic city like Singapore. My room did not have a proper window but I have paid really a cheap price so I am ok, on the other side it was really clean and spacious.. Breakfast to be improved: really few choices if you are looking for sweets. Cable tv was not offering anything nice but a great wifi was in place so it was good, plus the hotel offer a mobile phone with unlimited international calls and data that was really useful. The location is great, close to many clubs and restaurants and a few steps from China Town and a couple of metro stations. Staff was friendly and nice.

title: Restful sleep
desc: Did one day there after touring Japan. I originally booked the trip to see the nightlife in Chinatown but ended up sleeping the entire time. I recommend it to anyone looking for a good waypoint with options for play. It was perfect.

title: Standard as dropped
desc: I have stayed at the Scarlet quite a few times in the past but it had been over 4 years since my last visit. I expected the quirkiness, and the limited size of the rooms (even though I selected an executive room) but I think the service has dropped. No longer are the drinks in the mini bar included, the cotton towels in the public toilets are gone and the front desk staff not as friendly. The tie up with Small Luxury Hotels also seems to be a confused mess requiring you to book through the SLH web site in order to receive credit/benefits. I also had to follow up with the hotel to ensure that they got my booking, through their web site, as there was no confirmation email.

title: Brilliant location - great value
desc: Brilliant location for China town (including MTR) as well as bars around Club Street). Higgledy piggedly corridor to rooms added character. Do up grade to a bigger room. Very attentive staff who really did try that little bit extra

title: Perfect hotel, perfect location.
desc: We spent two separate nights here, Monday 30th April 2018 and Wednesday 2nd May. Location: for us, absolutely perfect. 30 minutes taxi from Changi Airport (S$35). 150M one direction to The main Chinatown area with all its shops, bars and street food, plus the main Chinatown MRT Station to get you all over this island city fast and cheap. 150M another direction to the main bar, club and restaurant area of club street and Ann siang road, and a further 100M to the more upscale bar and restaurant area of Duxton Road. Plus the added benefit of being directly opposite Maxwell Hawker food court. If you want to travel to Marina Bay, which we did, that's less than 10 minutes and (S$12) by taxi. Hotel: we were in room 123, then second night 301. Both were premier rooms which were

title: Great service, pretty decor
desc: The service was great. The room come with a mobile device you could take out with you that gave discount tickets, directions and suggestions. The decor was very nice. My only negatives were the room was small, there was mound from the humidity around the aircon vent and the bed was harder than I’m use to.

title: Well located, cute decoration, high price for non window room
desc: Well located, cute decoration, high price for non window room. Breakfast is disappointing, no chinese items such as dim sum or congee although located in Chinatown. The price of the room could remain the same if breakfast really improves in quality.

title: The worst hotel I’ve stayed in
desc: Stayed at the Scarlett Hotel in Erskine Rd. Initially, a friend booked us into a ‘deluxe’ room. We upgraded to an ‘executive’ room when we found out the deluxe room had no window. The executive room did have a window (it cost about an extra $40/night for a very small one facing onto a wall and roof). But, it was about the same size: 20sqm. The bathroom was even smaller. One had to walk into the shower to be able to close the door! No room service after the associated restaurant closed (at 9:45pm). The desk staff have no knowledge of any events such as the Rugby Sevens. No concierge; basically, no service. The hotel corridors are dark and dingy. The rooms are terrible. The cost is exorbitant for what you get, which is not much. Recommendation: stay anywhere else but

title: A real surprise!
desc: This hotel, which is right in Chinatown, is a treasure. From the time we arrived, exhausted from over 24 hours of flying, when we received a cold cloth and drink to fresh before checking in, until we checked out, it was a wonderful home away from home. My husband loved the reading room with its books and daily newspapers. The location was very handy for public transportation but we also enjoyed walking around.

title: Convenience to China Town MRT
desc: It is walking distant to the chain town mrt station. I stayed for 3 nights, and I commuted around using 3 days pass, it is convenience if you know the buses number and station to stop and go. For me, foods around china town are edible. Not very suitable for Muslim. Hotel main lobby is a bit confusing. I do not know when I first arrived at dining hall thinking it was the main lobby. Funny shape. It was a bit noisy at night at I think the hotel is underneath or nearby to some bars. I am early sleeper, is you are late sleeper should be fine. I sleep at 9 pm and I found although going around is convenience with walking distant, but I dislike the noise. That the tread-off I guessed. Overall, the hotel facilities are alright. They provide you a 10 minutes free spa, but close at 7

title: Great location 1 block from Chinatown
desc: Excellent for walking all of Chinatown. We also walked to the river which is a few blocks but a pleasant walk in the evening. Our room was spacious. The bed was very comfortable with the white linen I love. The shower was wonderful with loads of water pressure and a rainfall shower head. Clean, convenient, everything we were looking for.

title: Top spot in Chinatown
desc: Really interesting boutique hotel with wonderful decor. Located in Chinatown where you can walk around the area or jump on a bus or the MRT with stops located nearby to the rest of Singapore. Really helpful staff. The Scarlet was recommended to me and I am very happy to recommend it to you.

title: Amazing Hotel.
desc: The decor is fantastic. The staff amazingly helpful. Great location in Chinatown. I didn’t try try the restaurant as i was looking for local food. The staff had great uniforms and the night staff truly amazing characters.

title: Nice experience but room VERY small
desc: Overall we had a great three-night experience at this one-of-a-kind boutique hotel. The converted shophouse format is really unique and the location excellent for Chinatown and the Colonial area. The breakfast spread was pretty decent and good quality at the associated cafe downstairs, complete with choices such as oatmeal, Asian noodle dishes, bacon, scrambled eggs and an assortment of Italian cheeses. I loved the background to this Italianate cafe, which is owned by a Singapore-Italian couple (she-he) – there are pretty pics on the wall of them on truffle hunts in Italy, and so on ... very personable and charming. The main downside to report is how small the room was (by any standard), despite paying for the top-category room and requesting a good size by email. It was also

title: Charming place in Chinatown
desc: Really liked the Scarlet. Full of historic charm. The breakfasts, including made to order eggs, were delicious and relaxing in the charming ground floor restaurant. Great coffee and friendly waiter. The location near the subway and Chinatown sites made sightseeing easy. Had a second floor room which oozed charm and had a view of the Buddhist temple.

title: Good Hotel- Balcony not worth it
desc: I just returned from a 2-night stay at the Scarlet. I selected this hotel for it's proximity to Chinatown attractions that I was interested in. Pros: - Someone else has mentioned it- but this hotel smells very nice. It's silly to say, but it is nice to walk into. - LOCATION. If you're interested in Chinatown market, Buddha Tooth Museum, or Sri Mariamman Temple, this is a great spot. It's also just a block from the bus stop (even the hop-on bus). - Feels safe - Quirky and unique vibe - Comfortable bed and nice room -Pool and spa have great views - Staff were quick to bring me an iron Not-so-Greats: - I booked a balcony room, which was useless. The balcony has absolutely no view down the street. You can only see the parking garage across the street- literally. Don't waste the

title: Fun well located hotel
desc: Friendly staff, cosy hotel in perfect location right in the heart of china town and local bars . Highly recommend as a change to the normal business hotels . Also well priced in a normally expensive city .

title: Offbeat, Funky & Fun
desc: Interesting boutique hotel in the heart of Singapore’s Chinatown. A row of old chop houses have been renovated and upgraded into a brightly decorated and cheeky place that evokes old an bordello. The rooms are small but comfortable and well fitted out with new marble baths. Within easy walk of many of Singapore’s best restaurants. On a quiet street with minimal traffic noise. Highly recommend

title: Excellent hotel
desc: My wife and I just spent 5 nights here. The experience was superb from start to finish. Our room was not massive but perfect for our needs. The hotel like our room was in tip top condition, and the level of service offered was faultless. We had breakfast every day and were more than satisfied with the choice. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, and a special mention must go to front desk staff Jenny, Joel and Peter, and also Arun at breakfast.All in all the Scarlet was a joy to stay in

title: How’d they get it to smell so nice?
desc: The Scarlet is a real gem. Located next to Chinatown it’s a lovely hotel with friendly staff, hip vibe and cool decor. And it smells amazing, even from down the street. Staff are friendly though strangely they didn’t really have recommendations on places to eat, or know which malls would be open over the Chinese New Year. They were similarly stymied with questions like how much a taxi would cost to get to the airport. But you know what? If you know how to Google and you’re not a hotel reviewer for the Michelin guide it shouldn’t really bother you. Because the Scarlet was a fun hotel with fun staff in a fun neighborhood. There is also a rooftop bar (which I didn’t know about because you don’t see it - not even notices for it - when you enter the lobby). I equally didn’t know

title: A colorful hotel
desc: We spent 2 nights in this small colorful hotel. We took the executive room, as the others are too small. It was nice and spacious, but it doesn't have a window, just a curtain to have the feeling of a window. We had no breakfast, but as the hotel is next to the China town it was plenty of options to eat. Don't miss the food-hall on the corner which is one of the best in Singapore. First and last the hotel is OK, it has a charm from the previous century, but nothing extraordinary. A bit overpriced as everything is Singapore.

title: Very close to the Maxwell hawker centre.
desc: The Scarlet was a small hotel with only one floor of rooms as I could see. The rooms are above very nice shops. Very friendly staff. The breakfast is very good, they will cook eggs to order, also there is homemade cake for breakfast. It is close to the Maxwell hawker centre, which is buzzing in the evening and the food (depending which stall you buy from) is very good and cheap. We stayed here for 3 nights and could have probably stayed another night. Close to China Town and temple. Very handy for the buses although my husband and I walked back from the Marina Bay Hotel after seeing the light show in the Marina Bay gardens, which are well worth seeing. It took around 30/40 mins depending how fast you walk and of course the heat. Lots to see so I would advise a 2 day ticket for

title: Historic building, great location & very friendly and helpful staff
desc: We stayed in room 232 on the second floor. Our room had access to a roof terrace which we didn't use as it was so humid. Although small, we had enough storage space and a lovely shower room with a large, walk in shower. The location is excellent - on the edge of China Town and close to a couple of metro stations. We were only here for 3 nights and made the most of the hop on hop off bus to give us a general overview of the city. We spent a day at Gardens by the Bay which was great. You only pay for entry to two glass domes. The rest of the outside space and access to the eateries is free. If you go in the evening you can take advantage of a fantastic laser light show - which again is free. A taxi costs 10 dollars from the hotel to the Gardens. We used the hop on bus to get there

title: GREAT LOCATION
desc: The Scarlet Hotel is in the heart of Chinatown, in a collection of renovated old, but very attractive, Shophouses. The location is superb for visiting the many interesting Temples etc in Chinatown, and also the fun shopping for bargains in Chinatown. The Hotel has been lovingly restored and the interior design and decoration quite amazing. The service was good, our room was nice and also clean. My only disappointment was that our room wasn't quite as nice as expected. An excellent hotel but we probably wouldn't stay here again, simply because there are many other interesting hotel's in Singapore.

title: Stayed Here 3 Times and Will Keep Going Back
desc: My husband and I have stayed here the last 3 times we traveled to Singapore. We like that it's located in Chinatown and is next door to the Maxwell Road Hawker Centre, which has some of our favorite stalls. We enjoy going there or to other local hawker centers for breakfast and lunch and going out someplace night for dinner. It's also a quick walk to the subway, but a new station will be opening up soon right across the street! It's a smaller boutique hotel, so some of the rooms have no windows, which is fine because you are just there to sleep anyways. But, we do prefer their rooms with windows, which always cost more. All the rooms have everything you need and the beds are comfortable. I would definitely recommend to others...and of course, return in the future.

title: Great location, good rooms
desc: Spent two nights in this hotel. The service at the reception desk was interesting... During our stay we met four different receptionists. One very helpful lady, a couple of helpful guys and another receptionist lady that was clearly not enjoying her job. The first impressions matter, I mean! All in all, we received good service anyway. The rooms were quite cosy. Nothing special, though. The location is absolutely great! The hotel seems slightly over priced.

title: Lovely find
desc: The room itself was lovely and big, with a bathroom and shower room. The only let down for me was the lack of windows meaning no natural light in the room so we had to have the lights on most of the time. The hotel is located in China Town so great for places to eat and explore, just wish I was well enough to have seen more of the city whilst I was there. All the staff where friendly and helped get taxis to the airport and places within the city, can't fault at all!

title: Gone down hill
desc: We are staying here for the third time, but after the current experience it was also the last time. On arrival with massive luggage they just watched us battling with doors and suitcases instead of helping. The wear and tear of the hotel is visible everywhere (faded colours, sink chipped etc.). A moment ago our room key stopped working so back down to reception. They updated the key, but no apologies were made, not even a smile. Since we got to the hotel we feel treated like a paying burden and compared to the 2 previous stays it feels as they have undergone a massive austerity plan at the expense of customer service. In the good old days they had at least 2 people at reception. There are many nice boutique hotels in Singapore, this is not on my list anymore.

title: Very Obliging
desc: We stayed here for two nights. Hotel is 10 minutes walk from Chinatown metro of S$10 Taxi from downtown. Very obliging Reception staff and bellboy. Lena the receptionist provides service with smile and very obliging when we requested a change of room. Room was well furnished with tea and coffee making facilities but quite small with no space for two suitcases. The double bed was comfortable but too narrow. Bathroom was modern and large enough to store a suitcase. We had breakfast and dinner on the on-site restaurants and were quite satisfied with the standard. Overall we found the hotel convenient and comfortable for a short stay.

title: Nice place, nice stay
desc: The hotel is located on a quiet street near the China Town. When I set my foot into the hotel, the beautiful decoration caught my eyes. Nicely decorated room and well equipped facilities. Close to Maxwell Food Centre which provides good local food. Nice place for a nice stay!

title: Small but good
desc: We stayed here for two nights after disembarking from our cruise ship.The hotel is situated in Chinatown and is within easy reach of the underground. Our room (although we were upgraded to an executive one)was very small especially as we had lots of baggage! The bed was a standard size but comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and had an excellent shower. We were provided with tea/coffee and mineral water which was appreciated. Breakfast was available at a cost,downstairs. There was a good choice and the service was excellent. In the evening we had dinner on the roof in a Italian themed restaurant which was equally enjoyable. All the staff were pleasant and obliging and despite the small bed we enjoyed our stay.

title: Quirky and beautiful little gem.
desc: The Scarlet is definitely a place I would stay at again. It smelt gorgeous in the lobby. We were greeted nicely and treated very well. It was just a shame we only had one and a half days there. A really nice plac to stay. Check out the rooftop bar.

title: Best hotel
desc: Scarlett is one of the best hotel in Singapore - all in all I loved everything about this hotel , staff were very helpful - would definitely love to come back again , keep it up. Highly Recommended, breakfast is nice and you can find great restaurants and bars near by.

title: Qwerky Hotel in the Centre of Chinatown
desc: If you want to stay in the heart of Chinatown this is it. Within walking distance to everything.and a hive of activity.. Great local shops and food outlets. I would recommend it for location alone.. The Scarlet is a converted "shop house". The ground level runs downhill and the rooms have no windows. Upper lever rooms have windows, some with balconies but rooms are small. Our experience was disappointing for a Small Luxury Hotel.property. Room are so small there is no room for two suitcases., Bed linen was past its use by date with holes in bed covers. Tea and coffee making facilities were in the clothes hanging cupboard (how crazy is that). Room service had to be contacted every day for an ice bucket which was delivered without ice tongs. The room card rarely worked.

title: Great location
desc: This nice hotel is very well located in Singapore close to Chinatown. It is well furnished but the rooms are quiet small even with the executive room. We can recommend the nearby PS Cafe for cake and coffee.

title: Always a pleasure to return to
desc: Another lovely stay at The Scarlet. The hotel location is hard to beat but the service is what makes this place an easy repeat! Room at decidedly 'boutique' in size but extremelly well appointed with generous ammenities. The shower is excellent. Staff are impecable: efficient, kind and always ready to go the extra mile. On this stay, the air freshener in the lobby was a bit too strong for my taste... But that probably comes down to personal preference.

title: Very nice atmosphere in China Town
desc: Very nice location close to Ann Siang Club street with lot's of restaurants and bars. The better rooms with windows are more expensive but very nice furnished. The rooms are clean and the service is very friendly. Take a room to the back yard.I had one with a small balcony, that was very nice :-) Minibar was included. I was the second time here and will come again.

title: Absolutely Charming!
desc: We stayed at this hotel for one night before leaving on a cruise and I wished we had have had longer. We had a balcony room with a good sized bathroom. The hotel is in a fantastic location being only a short walk from Chinatown and plenty of restaurants and bars. There was also a rooftop bar which was lovely to relax and enjoy a drink. Would definitely stay here again when back in Singapore.

title: Lovely, quirky hotel in a great location.
desc: This hotel is a little gem. I wasn't sure what to expect when I booked it. A lovely boutique hotel with a lush elegant feel. The rooms and bathrooms are large, clean and have everything you could need. A great location with some really good restaurant and bar strips within 5 minutes walk. We were only here for 1 night, though wish we were staying longer.

title: a boutique hotel in a good location
desc: The location was good, because 2 metro stations are reachable on foot, and close to food market, China town. The building is clean and looks good. The service was also good. Free smartphone, which only enables maps and search, was super helpful. You don't have to buy local usim if you stay here.

title: Nice stay - but no view
desc: We stayed there for a night. It was a pleasant stay. The room was basic and what we wanted. Do note that there are no windows - not to our room anyway so no natural light. It was close to Chinatown and the distance to the MRT station wasn't too far - 10 - 15 minutes walk depending on how fast you walk. When I arrived at the MRT station from the airport, it was raining so we had to take a taxi to the hotel. There is a food court near the hotel where there are plenty of things to eat. Walk further and you can find more options.

title: Fuss free and a pleasant experience
desc: Smooth and efficient check-in. There are 3 room types: window, daylight and balcony. Requested for the window room, however, all window rooms were full and we got the daylight room instead. The room is located at the ground level and is pretty dark. Big comfortable beds and lovely bathtub perfect for 2 people. Overall, a pleasant and relaxing experience.

title: Affordable, perfect location
desc: Area is one of the few in Singapore with lots of charm. You can eat every meal in Maxwell’s or the Chinatown hawker centers. That alone makes it one of the best places to visit in the world. Rooms are small, but so are most in Singapore. Walking distance (if you can bare the heat) to lots of interesting spots in the city. Stayed for over a week and always felt I was in the center of everything.

title: Elegant Chinatown
desc: First Impression It’s we small but elegant hotel. Common impressions of Chinatowns are always cheap food and dodgy hostels but Singapore has totally upmarket it’s Chinatown. The hotel is a row of beautifully converted shophouses. Rooms are small but has character. Parting Impressions The hotel is perfectly located, close to the main attractions in Chinatown and the MRT. Lots of good eating places walking distance too. If you wake up early enough visit the Buddhist and Hindu temple close by and without the chaos of the usual hours it’s serene and peaceful. Only thing is the robotic staff you get but it’s not uncommon in Singapore ...

title: A Major Letdown
desc: Stayed here on our wedding anniversary and the front desk was informed abt it in advance. Booked the premium room and was given the room on the first floor with no windows. Requested for a room change as we hated the natural sunlight coming from the roof but was turned down. The hotel staff should be more proactive to give us an alternative and offer us another room to match our room preference at least than to decline us completely. We did not have a good rest as we were awakened by the noise outside and the natural sunlight coming through the roof window. Truly regret choosing Scarlet Hotel!

title: interesting difference for a Hotel near Chinatown (The Main attraction) ..
desc: Different atmosphere - Good Breakfast and near to the main attractions I wanted to visit in the Temple Area ,, The Hotel is perhaps a little quiet for the main stream traveller but that is what I wanted .. Five mins walk from Terranganu Street and the busier side of town ..

title: Perfect location!
desc: I stayed in Scarlet Hotel for 5 nights together with my family. The location of the hotel could not be better! Hawker center just in front, cafe's around the corner and all the sights in China town just there! Also this hotel is very clean and comfortable. Our room with balcony was pleasant and beautiful. Only minus in the room was lack of towel hangers. On friday night there were a lot of noise coming from the street, luckily we were so tired we felt aspleep despite that.

title: boutique means small..
desc: Small rooms, difficult to find, breakfast is nothing special, too expencive for what you get, Breakfast room seems to be open to anybody and that 's what you get, nothing special. The lacation is ok, just above China Town, but who needs that?

title: Good Hotel!
desc: I stayed at this hotel as a walk in guest reservation. It’s quite expensive but its comfortable! Very close to MRT station and near with lots of food streets. Overall, it just good! I decided to stayed at this hotel because there is no room available in any chinatown hotels. So, I am exhausted and found this one after a long walk. Thankfully, the staff is very nice and friendly. I am so glad they offered me a cold face towel. It’s very welcoming.

title: Classy and Unique Hotel
desc: This is a classy boutique hotel in a great location. It has a rooftop bar/restaurant and is located close to Chinatown. It's also a 3 minute walk to the Maxwell Street food center. The room was a bit small and the bathroom door was glass, so light from the morning made it into the room and brightened up the room. But I would stay again, the location alone was enough for me. A bit of walk from MTR but Uber and taxis were super easy.

title: Very comfortable and excellent location
desc: We loved the scented water feature as you enter the air-conditioned lobby. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean, comfortable (especially the bed) and luxuriously furnished. It was weird not having a window (apart from a narrow skylight high-up) but we had been warned about that: I’m not sure there would have been much of a view anyway. It was great being close to so many Chinatown hawker stalls for meals. For breakfast we used a local bakery. The walk to the underground station took about 10 minutes. When we returned one afternoon to find our room had not been serviced (probably our fault for having messed with the door sign - not sure), this was remedied within five minutes. We'd definitely return.

title: great position but not compfy
desc: we stayed 3 nights and found the position great, near everything we wanted and not too far from others. rooms were smaller than we expected, but very clean and well stocked for our stay and breakfast not that great. front desk were very friendly and helpful. next time will probably look elsewhere.

title: Wonderful, Idiosyncratic
desc: Bizarre decor but comfortable room with nice bathroom (full toiletries). Very quiet, very friendly, great location. Nice light and bathroom controls. Controlled, focussed lights for reading which don't light up the whole room (unlike in many 4 or 5 star hotels); simple bath and shower controls - hot/cold, on/off. Lots of space. Balcony. Nice breakfast.

title: Do yourself a favour Perth travellers!
desc: After finding this little gem I just had to share! Absolutely top class service in wonderful surroundings. Just a short distance from the Chinatown MRT through colourful streets full of trinkets and yummy food. The room, an executive suite with balcony, was perfect for our 3 night stay. Very clean and nicely decorated. The rooftop bar was beautiful; I only wish we had the strength after each busy day to sample their wares. Perth visitors to Singapore should take a chance, as we did, and enjoy the delights of the Scarlet Singapore!

title: The Sexy Scarlet
desc: The Scarlet Hotel is one of the sexy romantic hotel in Singapore. 1 min walk to Ann Siang Road and Club Street road. 5 min walk to Chinatown Foodie. 10 min walk to Chinatown MRT. We stayed at The Passion Suite. Room is cozy. The them member of The Scarlet Hotel was very helpful and friendly. Thank You The Scarlet Hotel Singapore. See you again.

title: Get your company to pay up and stay somewhere else.
desc: I thought we were staying at a lovely hotel by the harbour. Then our boss found this place. I thought I had experienced horrible hotels. How this has won awards is beyond me. Hotel stinks of damp. Bathroom is damp and feels dirty. Everything in the room is sticky to touch. Phone, handles on cupboards and paper even had some sort of sticky black thing on it. No outside window just a piece of wood blocking the window. Wallpaper hanging off and some tacky ‘do not disturb sign’ which implies this hotel is for hour stays not overnight stays. Everything is dated and pics on website are very deceiving. Singapore is so lovely don’t waste a second here.

title: Great hotel close to Chinatown
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights, and once upon arrival you will be met by an elegant lobby and friendly staff, and of course a welcome drink. The check in went smoothly. They will hold a deposit, but it's not a big amount, but good to know beforehand. The Wi-Fi is working throughout the property. The rooms aren't the most spacious, but they are nicely decorated, and all guests have access to a public jacuzzi. Breakfast is not included but can be had at Casa Tartufo which is connected with the hotel. However, the breakfast will be my only negative aspect of this hotel. For a luxury hotel of this caliber with a great cultural setting, I was a bit disappointed with the quite dull and small range in the breakfast buffet. Despite that, I would recommend others to stay here if you

title: Great Location!
desc: The location of the hotel is great. Closed to Maxwell Food Market and Chinatown. We caught the train to the hotel as the Tanjong Pagar MRT station is a direct line from the airport. You can travel to the Orchard area, Sentosa and Marina Bay Sands via Chinatown MRT station. Thanks to the upgrade of our room, it was spacious and clean. The beds and pillows were comfy. Have to get used to no windows which is no big deal. However, we did get a bit of the reverberating noise from loud motorbike during early morning hours and also we could hear the hairdryer going from another room one early morning. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as the Maxwell Food Market offers lots of choices for local breakfast and also for lunch, dinner and late night supper. The only dislike I have

title: don't do it.
desc: this hotel had grime inside the windows and in the showers.. felt like a bordello that started renting rooms overnight. the "do not disturb" sign in the room showed high heels and handcuffs and read "i'm being naughty!" -- what kind of hotel is this!??! Felt extremely sleazy. Also smelled moldy in the hallways- and service was non-existent. supposed to stay for a week and checked out after a day. Just awful.

title: Lovely Hotel
desc: Lovely hotel, great location for Restaurants, Bars and MRT. Staff are friendly and efficient. Room was clean and very comfortable bed. Would definitely return to the Scarlet Hotel if in Singapore again.

title: Excellent Hotel will definitely go back
desc: Stayed 3 nights at this perfect , cute boutique hotel , in a fabulous location in China town , close to two MRT stations ( one to the Airport , the other downtown ) . Really nice “home made” style breakfast .Very friendly staff . Cant wait to go back !

title: Good quiet hotel in a nice area
desc: Close to the shops, bars, restaurants of Chinatown. The room is quiet, clean and a decent amount of space. The design and layout of the rooms are a little bit older but are well maintained and charming. The staff was very nice and friendly.

title: Interesting hotel, missed the intended mark
desc: Great location, great concept, interesting design, lots of character, reminiscing of old colonial opium dens. Nice rooms, great housekeeping. Poor front desk, unfortunately. A/c system needs modern upgrading.

title: Perfect Location, Comfy Stay
desc: Scarlet is conveniently located along Erskine Road in Chinatown (if you’re a foodie, Chinatown’s one of the best places to be in SG). There’s a lot of places around to grab grub (i.e. along Southbridge Bridge Rd). Scarlet is just across Maxwell Hawker Center where you’d find quite a few of the best tasting hainanese chicken rice in SG. It’s also less than five-minute walk to Chinatown Food Street. There’s a 7/11 and other establishments along the hotel complex. Transportation wise, it’s less than 10 minute walk to the nearest train station (Chinatown Station, Pagoda St entrance). But the hotel staff’s ready to get you a cab anytime. But what we really loved about this hotel is that while it’s just nearby busy food centers, it’s perfectly located away from the hustle and

title: Filthy Hotel
desc: Stayed only one night and happy didn't have to stay longer because the hotel is dingy filthy and cramped. The bathroom was disgusting hair everywhere, soap scum, mildew grout with 1/4inch build up of mold. Rooms are tiny constantly hitting my shin on the bed ends so left with some bruise souvenirs. Noise level was bad where the french doors to the outside we're not even close to being sound proofing in any way which also limited the ability of the Air-conditioning in 90+ weather. The bar tender is super rude, Italian lady just the worse never went back for a drink actually ordered drinks planing on taking a seat but instead ran and ducked for cover in my room with two drinks. Pool, is a fountain converted into a pool...appears was to be a hot tub but the water was cold so

title: Wonderful stay at a heritage building
desc: Nice heritage building other than the normal hotels. Excellent location with 3 food centres nearby (Maxwell, Amoy and Chinatown) as well as 3 MRT lines in walking distance. Nothing to complaint except my room is located at ground floor without a window. Nice bed and pillow.

title: What a great choice from a big bunch!
desc: If you are looking for a big chain where your only remembered until you walk out of sight then this is not for you . But if you want a hotel where from the minute you walk in your treated like a guest to a home then book it ! The surrounding area on maps looks a little tatty but don’t let that put you off ,the hotel is pristine and very well maintained, the decor is wow and makes you take photos to remember your stay . We were met with a warm welcome from reception, the lady went trough our booking to confirm everything was correct. She gave us all the information on room directions,breakfast location,and facilities. We booked a bigger room with window , as some rooms don’t have windows . I think by doing that it also gave us a bit more space , as some friends and other reviews

title: Breakfast - A Disaster !!
desc: I am my partner Paul have been staying at this hotel for year s on our trips to and from the UK. EXPENSIVE but what is not in Singapore ? It is well located. Sadly in recent time the food and bar have been let out with a stupid system of dual vouchers - one for the hotel account and the other for the lessee. Breakfast is expensive at 26 Sdollars, plus, for a buffet of watered flavourless juices and a large display of uninteresting food. Eggs have to be ordered seperately. There is little fresh fruit, no tea pots etc etc the most appalling dry white bread to toast , no croissants or containers to take jam from the bulk jam jars and the yogurt is far too funny - no body :-( The hotel rooms are quite pleasant and roomy. If we stay again we shall avoid breakfast there.

title: Beautiful hotel
desc: Definitely a small luxury hotel in Singapore, stayed two night here, from check in till the day I left , friendly and attentive staffs, quick respond to our request. No complaint, no complaint on the deluxe room with the balcony we stayed, clean n comfy bed, definitely will come back for our future stay.

title: I loved it
desc: It was the 3rd hotel I 've stayed in Singapore. Although it was not 5 stars just like the previous, it was the best of all. Cozy, clean, with atmosphere. Great beds and pillows, rish breakfast and a cute Jacuzzi. It was very near to the night life street and the restaurants and that was fantastic,without to be influenced by the noice. Just great. I will come back for sure.

title: Quirky place, with a lot of personality. Won't suit everyone though
desc: So I stayed at the Scarlet as I had a few extra days in Singapore recently, and it was conveniently located for my trip. It's definitely a funky place, with an interesting vibe. Staff were very friendly and chatty, and quick to help. Decor is 'quirky' - this is a boutique hotel in a heritage building and it's full of little flourishes of decoration / art pieces. Not the rooms are cozy, and windows are not available in many of them. Something to bear in mind. But they are clean and the beds comfortable. It was also pretty good value - considering Singapore prices. I was pleasantly surprised by how little a night here actually was.

title: Funky, great location hip hotel
desc: I've stayed here twice for work as it's very conveniently located to my office. I love the eclectic decorations and hippness at a very reasonable rate. The rooms are very small, but it's fine if you're solo. However, the hotel has a fun lascivious vibe should you want to take a partner there for "whatever". Good amenities in the rooms including a free hand phone for foreign travellers who need a communication device without spending on international roaming.

title: Great boutique stay
desc: Lovely little hotel! Fantastic location (30 second walk to one hawker centre, then 10 mins to another) Quiet and safe street. Friendly and helpful reception. Good facilities (especially the Handee phone with unlimited calls and data). The room we booked was smaller than what we thought and the wardrobe door was jammed, but we will definitely stay again there next time we go to Singapore.

title: Worth the money.
desc: Hotel Scarlet Singapore is definitely worth the money if you want to stay central in Singapore. You are mostly within walking distance of the most, and if you like a party and visit pubs, it is only 100 meters to Singapore's best pub street. The rooms are a little small but quite ok and quiet, we heard nothing from the street. A small bubble pool at the back is a good visit after shopping in Chinatown, which is also only 100 meters from the hotel. Quick check-in and check-out, friendly staff.

title: Simply one of the best for a boutique hotel
desc: The staff were professional and friendly, and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. love the theme and set up of the entire hotel..just as its name, so Scarlet. Requested for a quiet side, and was given one. Is a row of old shop houses in China town, so if you are coming with an expectation of great view, then wrong hotel, appreciate the interior design and comfort with details, then this is the hotel. Checking in was smooth and professionally handle, except towels was forgotten, as I noticed previous two guests was all given. Room was not too small as claimed by some of the review here. You are supply with almost all the amenities that you can get in a five stars hotels, clean linens and towels, except the bathrobe is a big tight for me. Cozy rooms and comfy bed, is not a new

title: 24 stopover in Singapore
desc: Scarlet is in a great location, a minutes stroll from Chinatown markets & restaurants. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. Room was small but clean and lovely. Leaking shower, staff welcomed the feedback so hopefully that got fixed.

title: Singapore fling in Chinatown
desc: I stayed for five nights in a Deluxe room at The Scarlet, Singapore. The hotel is a charming converted row of shop-houses, rather than a high-rise. I stayed here about 20 years ago but it has been given a serious revamp since then. The foyer is lovely and cool and the front desk staff are efficient and welcoming. The room itself is very comfortable, if a little on the small size. I had only one suitcase but would have struggled to find room to put another. The bed and linens are very nice, the room is lovely and clean and the bathroom is of a high standard. The breakfast is very ordinary and unremarkable and does not represent good value unfortunately. After the second day I ventured out to find local cafes (with great success). The location of the hotel is very good -

title: Italian style close to Chinatown
desc: We stayed in this hotel to have a good starting point for exploring Singapore. The service is great and the bar on the top roof is a pleasant experience. Public transport is at walking distance. We've enjoyed shopping and dining in Chinatown almost every day. The Scarlet offers happy hour every day as well and I can recommend the famous italian beer Peroni together with a pleasant chat with the bartender...

title: My Sanctuary
desc: Scarlet is a sexy & flirtatious place to stay in. Can't complain about view but interior is cozy. Located opposite Maxwell food court with variety of food to choose from. Club street is a walking distance for a good drink and dance. The staff are very friendly and reliable for request within their means. It's a good and affordable stay for any occasions or just chilin.

title: Love this Hotel
desc: As a constant traveller to Singapore this is my go to place over so many years. Great location - great service. Right in the centre of Chinatown, Maxwell Food Centre is right next door. Rooms are small but individual. Definitely a great place to stay if you are looking to explore Singapore.

title: Location, location, location!!!
desc: I booked this hotel for our stay in Singapore due to reviews of it being in a central location. Maxwell Hawker is right next door and the entire Chinatown is within steps away. We were able to easily venture out from The Scarlet to explore different parts of Singapore. The hotel provided us with a handheld mobile device equipped with internet so it was very easy to get around without getting lost. Taking the bus was a breeze. Our room was small but it was OK for us because we were mainly there just to sleep. I emailed the hotel ahead of time and requested a room with windows and they were able to honor my request. The hotel employees were all very nice and pleasant to deal with. Since we were there for a special occasion, we arrived to some gifts on our bed from the hotel

title: Lovely Place - great for drinks, relaxing
desc: I've always liked the Scarlet Hotel. Been here for drinks and eats. Decided to do a weekend stay. Good decision too. check in was fast and efficient. Had a very nice cool cranberry mango drink. the corridor to the rooms are so cool. i love the decor of the deluxe room even though it was not big, the decor is very nice. the bathroom is small and compact with lovely towels, amenities, bathroom, slippers. i had the deluxe room with the balcony with overlooks the car park of the next building. however, the heavy curtains in the bedroom blocked off the lights. it was not as noisy as i thought it would be. check out was equally efficient. the staff are really pleasant and i would certainly return for another stay. the location is really good - near to lots of eating places,

title: A thoroughly enjoyable stay
desc: Characterful and elegant hotel, located in the historic low-rise Chinatown district, convenient for local amenities, nightlife and the MRT. The deluxe room with window to the rear of the building was relatively small, but well equipped and quiet, with an exceptionally comfortable bed. The room was clean with everything in working order, though water flowing out under the shower was a slight irritation. Breakfast was excellent, and both reception and restaurant staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Superb Service, excellent location
desc: This Hotel is located in China Town, downtown Singapore. Mosque, Hindu Mandir, Buddha Temple, Decent Restaurants, Halal Restaurants, Shoppig Malls, China Town, Public Transport, Subway Train, Hop-on Hop-off buses etc are within five minutes walk. Hotel is immaculately clean and the hotel staff makes you feel like, at home. Our bed was comfortable and bath supplies were adequate. Room size is relatively smaller, may be because it is a tiny country. We surely enjoyed our stay. You can exchange currency at a great Ann's uniform rate everywhere. Most places accept credit cards, with the exception of smaller shops. The country is clean with law abiding people. We did not see a single policeman, wherever we went. There is no price gouging and no bargaining. We had a wonderful

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel Near Singapore Chinatown
desc: I find Chinatown to be one of the most vibrant neighborhoods of Singapore and also the location of my favorite Hawker facility at Maxwell Road.
