The Scarlet Hotel is located on Erskine Road, right around the corner from the Maxwell Road Hawker facility and just down the street from the Buddhist Tooth Relic Temple. A great spot, but on a quiet street. The hotel itself is inside a series of the classic colonial buildings found in this neighborhood. Inside the buildings have been modified to create a very ornate and nicely furbished series of rooms. I found my room to be very comfortable with a King size bed, and generous sized bathroom, all well furnished and very clean.

title: Perfectly boutique hotel
desc: Stayed 2 nights in The Scarlet. I like the way the rooms are designed. Decntly sized but everything you need can be found in your room. The bed is really comfortable and the toilet is extremely clean. There is a very small and functional gym that has view that overseas the street. Location wise is abour a 8 minutes wlalk from Chinatown MRT station. There is a 7-11 just beside the hotel and plently of hawker centers are available within the vincinitiy.

title: Nice hotel in the center of Singapore!
desc: Stayed 3 nights in The Scarlet, with my family. The Deluxe rooms with windows are really nice! The location is perfect, close to metro and some things to do walking distance. The staff is really nice, and the hotel pretty quite during the night!

title: Enjoyable!
desc: We recently visited The Scarlet for 6 nights in August. Have to say the location of the hotel is great, right near Chinatown. Where to start, probably the positives, the location and staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. They provided a phone for you to use whilst in Singapore which was a lovely touch! On the down side, we requested a Executive Balcony room (room 304) paid a considerable sum for it, was not worth the additional money, it looked onto the back of a laneway/road and a carpark, didn't even bother sitting out there. The music from the upstairs bar was quite noisy of a night time, no wonder they left earplugs next to the bed! We also did not have a good start when we arrived, as the lift was broken and where our room was located there were no

title: Great overall stay
desc: We traded our noisy street-side room for a premium room with a window. It made our stay. It was very quiet and spacious and the Reception arranged for us to have a late check-out. Great stay overall and we will be back. It is also in our favourite area of Singapore.

title: Nice room without a view
desc: There was no view, we were literally in the underground and this was supposed to be a superior room. Felt very claustrophobic. Staff Jenny is very helpful and extremely courteous she also helped us to carry our luggages with her big tummy.

title: An interesting option
desc: I stayed here 2 nights recently. I chose the hotel based on the area, as I walked around the area when I was last here and found it interesting, full of heritage sights, bars and cafes. The room was small but more than sufficient for a solo traveller. The bed was comfortable and the shower hot and strong, although the small handheld shower was slightly annoying in terms of the limited surface it covered (problem if you are a larger individual). The staff was pleasant and helpful. The highlight was the area - Chinatown across the road, Club St with numerous food and beverage options just one road behind, and a few rooftop bars and restaurants to boot. Boat Quay and Clarke Quay were a 15 minute walk away. I would stay here again if I was travelling solo. For a couple the rooms

title: My second home in Singapore
desc: Looking for a boutique hotel in Singapore? Look no further! I am a most frequent visitor of The Scarlet Hotel, and in my honest opinion, it is one the best boutique hotels I have ever stayed in! The hotel is in a gorgeous corner set art deco building, with window shutters, balconies, and a chic interior. It is classy. It is quirky! Its is luxurious. It's location rocks and the staff... ARE THE BEST! Staff make or break a place, and when you are in a small hotel, you need to have great staff, and The Scarlet team are the best. Friendly, courteous, helpful and they always remember you! Now for the rooms.. They are stunning, cosy, classy and luxurious! The towels are lush, the beds and heavenly, the room furnishings are far from the usual hotel. The rooms are sexy and seductive.

title: Centrally located heritage boutique hotel, room a bit too small though
desc: Stayed in Scarlet as it is centrally located boutique hotel converted from a row of 1920 shophouses, and right next door to China Town and close to the MRT stations. Read some of the review here and notice that there are rooms without a window thus I booked an Executive Room with window facings the main street. To my surprise when I checked in this Executive Room is really small, with on about 2 feet of space around a queen size bed. I could hardly walk after putting down my luggage. I asked if they have bigger rooms which I can upgrade. The reception was kindly enough to show my a few Suites which they can offer me a discount for the upgrade. Though the suite eventually I chose is a so-called suite, it is in face a Junior Suite without separated bedroom and sitting area;

title: Impressive service by some staff. Clean and beautifully arranged room.
desc: The reception that we first met when we arrived earlier was impressively kind, sweet, and helpful. The location of the hotel is perfectly good for a Chinatown tour, though, you may need to spare some energy to walk up and down the slope between MRT to/from the hotel. The room is clean and beautiful but there was no window and comparing to the price we paid, we expected more. The room's cleanliness, bar varieties and all amenities are superb, but a little touch of clothes softener to the towels, bathrobes and blankets would be perfect. And we didn't have the chance to use the Jacuzzi as we weren't informed that they have a closing time at 21.00 hr.

title: nice change from the usual hotel chains
desc: hotel is very close to Chinatown and is in an old shop building or something like that. Rooms are not big but are beautifully decorated and we had a little balcony with French doors out (although not much room to open the door). It's great as a place to sleep but not good if you want somewhere to laze around during the day. the lift was out while we were there which meant we had to use the fire escape spiral staircase to our room. No good if you had any issues walking and even we let someone else take the cases up and down. Good service and nice staff. there are hawker markets right opposite which are fantastic for breakfast or lunch (fresh juices very very cheap) but closed at night.

title: Great staycation
desc: The room was clean. The staff was very helpful and polite. It is very convenient to travel around the town and near Chinatown with great food. The Maxwell market is very nearby just 5 minutes walk. it is also centralised to travel around the area and local food just around the corner.

title: Excellent hotel for a getaway in Singapore
desc: Boutique hotel with a rich and cosy set up. The rooms are on the smaller side, but comfortable and functional. Perfect for couples or as a solo traveller. The hotel layout can be challanging initially but that adds to the charm. The staffs were friendly and helpful during my stay. The hotel location is almost perfect. Close to Maxwell Rd and Amoy St food centres. Next to Ann Siang Hill and Chinatown. Walking distance to MRT stations. Perfect as a getaway hotel for dining and a good night out. Room rates are reasonable. I highly recommend giving The Scarlet instead of the bigger hotel chains.

title: Hidden Gem in Chinatown
desc: Found this little gem and booked direct with the hotel. Mano was very courteous and prompt with his replies, and on check-in, the concierge staff were very friendly and gave great tips and advice. The way to the room took us down a labyrinth of hallways, deeply coloured in rich red walls and black timber edgings. The room (executive) was roomy (for Singapore) and styled beautifully. Metallic gold upholstered bed head, beautiful large mirrors, black timber side tables, even the drawers were lined with snakeskin print leather. Bathroom was modern and clean, lovely amenities and toiletries. Shower was large. Little rooftop balcony added to the romance. Attention to detail was spot on. It was our honeymoon and we were gifted from the hotel with a card signed by he staff wishing our

title: Noisy room
desc: At first the hotel looked quite nice: great location, close to Chinatown, boutique style hotel, renovated old building, not too pricy,... At a second glance: the rooms are really tiny but of course that is mostly due to the old renovated structure. The service was very nice and friendly, however when you return around 5 pm and your room still hasn't been cleaned that can be very annoying The rooms looked a bit wornt out, especially the shower where some joints were simply missings However the worst thing was the constant high noice level, especially at night. Most rooms are just above a very busy secondary street. Since the windows don't have proper joints, every single car racing was filling the room with a lot of noise... We spent there 4 nights and I definetly wouldn't

title: Disappointed
desc: Had high hopes for this hotel, as boutique hotels usually provide more personalized service. Booked this through Agoda, and I mistakenly booked the wrong dates, so we arrived a day earlier than expected. Sought for help from the reception on how to work out a solution, as I had a baby in tow. Jenny, one of the front desk staff, didnt seem interested in helping us and even looked irritated at our screw-up. She had that "its your fault you didnt get your booking right" look the whole time we were talking to her. I do know that we should be coordinating with Agoda on our own, but after travelling for hours with a baby, it would have been very appreciated if the hotel would show any concern at all on how to help us. We ended up booking in SO Sofitel Hotel (which was just so awesome

title: Boutique hotel
desc: The ambience of this boutique hotel is great, nicely decorated lobby and room. Nice bathroom come with a bathtub. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel for couple. It situated at a perfect location, 3 minutes walk to maxwell hawker food center and 5 min walk to China town.

title: Unique charm
desc: The decor of the Scarlet might take you by surprise, but the room was very comfortable and had all the typical amenities you would like, especially for business travel. The one caveat I would offer is that at least for the near future, you might find the noise of construction work outside to be a bit much early in the morning, but the hotel offers complimentary earplugs at bedside.

title: Not Sure......
desc: I'm finding this hotel a difficult one to give a higher rating for!!! Yes the location is fantastic. Right next to Chinatown in the old part of Singapore, with restaurants and shopping everywhere. Full of character as we anticipated. Very funky. The staff are lovely and very helpful and attentive. So what's wrong??? Our room with a balcony was tiny. I mean small for two people with a couple of bags. It felt like one of those Paris or Rome rooms where you cannot swing a cat. I had to sit sideways on the WC because the wall got in the way....Any more than one night and things just cluttered up this small room to a point where we were keeping things on the giant king bed. For this reason i cannot give the hotel anymore than an average.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel
desc: The scarlet is a great little hotel. Rooms are well kept, and the restaurant is great. Highly recommended. The location, close to Chinatown and Robinson road makes it a convenient location for those in the area for work, and the hotel is opulent enough to make it a great choice for honeymooners and vacationers alike.

title: Very good service
desc: The staff are friendly and very helpful. They helped with a lot of things. They looked after my luggage after checking out. And also helped arranging taxes to the airport. A+ ! The room is very comfortable.

title: Boutique Hotel, fantastic location!
desc: The Scarlet is a boutique hotel behind a heritage listed shophouse facade. It is well located, within 7 mins walk to Telok Ayer MRT and Chinatown MRT stations. Maxwell Food Centre (Tian Tian chicken rice), Amoy St Food Centre, and Chinatown Food Complex (Liao Fan HK Soya Sauce Roast Chicken of 1 Michelin star fame) are also located nearby in similar walking distances, so you will be spoiled for choices for hawker food. Additionally, there are also a quite a number bars, cafes, and restaurants in the vicinity ranging from casual to highly acclaimed (Burnt Ends & Restaurant Andre). While the inhouse facilities are probably less extensive compared to major chain hotels (no business centre, no pool, but has a jacuzzi), I found I hardly missed it. Perfect for leisure

title: Compact and comfortable hotel.
desc: The staff is cheerful and kind. The room is comfortable. A hotel is near Chinatown and the subway(MRT) station. It was very effective for us and convenient for sightseeing. The alert tone from the parking around here was noisy early in the morning. It was only the day, but it was unpleasant.

title: What a beauty!
desc: My friends came to visit and stayed here, I crashed. Traditional, historical shophouses in Chinatown renovated to become this artistic piece of boutique. Very impressed by the interior decor. Would recommend all my friends visiting Singapore to stay here.

title: Great small hotel
desc: This is a really nice alternative to a big and busy hotel. Great staff, clean rooms and a fantastic location. There is a small gym too. Free water in the room each day and some snacks too. Kept luggage on the last day after checking out, and allowed use of a shower in the evening before heading off to the airport.

title: An 11 Year Favourite Since Opening, Recently Disappointing
desc: We've been using this property since its opening in 2006 and have always found the location stunning, the deco nostalgic/unusual and the rooms well executed. Front desk staff had that RARE quality of remembering their clients and even recalling the people we refer to the hotel, ensuring that the referred parties always received a warm welcome likewise. To be remembered by hotel staff is a rarity these days, and we treasure it. This recent stay earlier this week was disappointing in that this element was missing - staff was clueless (with the exception of the lovely chaps that man the porter station). Some of it was plain rude, ie., ringing 3 times between 12N and 12:15 on my checkout day persistently asking when I'd vacate the room. As if I didn't KNOW the ruddy checkout time

title: Great location, right on edge of Chinatown and walking distance to Boat Quay
desc: Good quality hotel that offers a boutique experience. Rooms are compact, but have all you need....quiet, comfortable, and with each access to/from airport plus access to Chinatown region. We loved our stay.

title: First but not last visit
desc: The hotel is in a great location, short stroll to the nearest MRT which is cheap and and efficient method to exploring Singapore. There are many great little places to eat and drink near the hotel, and a few gay venues also. Staff were great and polite, rooms were very clean and everything worked efficiently. See you on my next visit, thanks guys

title: Wonderful gem
desc: This is a truly delightful hotel a mere stones throw from China town. The staff were most welcoming and our room wonderful. To come into the reception and be handed an ice cold flannel and an ice cold glass of juice was pure indulgence. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

title: My third time to stay at the Scarlet hotel.
desc: This time I travelled alone so I chose a double bedroom without window. This room was not big but clean and comfortable. I chose this hotel because of location and hotel staff. I feel that most of them have a good service mind, I can see it from my clean and neat room everyday. And some of front staff is friendly and helpful. I checked out on 3 July around 11:30am, a front staff who was on duty was very nice and friendly girl. She served me with her smile and chatted with me nicely. If I have a chance to visit Singapore next time, I will choose to stay at the Scarlet hotel again. And the best thing that will be soon is Maxwell MRT station where is next to this hotel.

title: Room with no window put a damper on things
desc: I love the ambiance of the Scarlet hotel, and the location is wonderful. But I was given a Premium room with a skylight (on the first floor) that felt a lot like being in a basement - and for the price of the room it did not feel like I was getting the full value of what I paid. When I was choosing which room to book I decided to book the room with the skylight since it looked very nice in the photos and I figured that although the room did not have a regular window, the skylight would provide enough natural light. I was wrong. The "skylight" was really just a small slit in the ceiling that barely let enough light in. Even during the midday hours I still had to use the lights in the room. When I went to the front desk to ask to be switched to another room with a window,

title: Short stay at the Scarlet
desc: It's a short few days at Singapore. The hotel is clean, cozy and with friendly staffs. It's right next to the Chinatown food street, which makes food hunting really simple and nice. There is a really nice egg tart shop in the corner. Also, the mtr is only a few minutes walk away. The room is a bit small for two people, but it is clean and comfy. The beds were firm and fluffy pillows which offer a really good night sleep. The first floor room feels like room in a basement. Overall, an enjoyable stay and would recommend others to go.

We booked the premium room for a night for the long weekend. I emailed them asking if they could offer us early check-in/late check-out, and was told that they would "try their best". We decided to try luck, and thankfully, we were able to check in at around 12.30. They processed us, and we were told that we had "one of the better rooms". It was actually a room on the 2nd floor, right next to the road. I wasn't expecting a view, given that it was the 2nd floor, but I wasn't told that there would be construction going on, so one would be able to guess the amount of noise from the contruction and the road, which was just next to it. The premium room supposedly comes with a bath tub. So after lunch, I decided to take a soak in the tub, but found out that the drainage couldn't

title: The staff are lovely and so helpful
desc: This is a very comfortable, modern hotel - I highly recommend it. The staff are lovely and seem to genuinely want to help and make your stay enjoyable. The location is good as is the breakfast. There's free wifi and a jacuzzi (no swimming pool unfortunately). But overall a very good experience I recommend to anyone travelling to Singapore.

title: What a lovely hotel!
desc: This is a great boutique hotel with a wonderful breakfast and in a great location. Staff was wonderful and friendly - and the rooms are very nice. Clean, great air conditioning - great experience! The value for the money is terrific!

title: Great hotel in fabulous location
desc: Loved staying here. Close to both Chinatown and Telok Ayer MRT and soon there will be a new station almost outside the door. Maxwell food court is across the road for cheap and tasty eats and there is plenty to do and see in the precinct There is a phone you can take with you from the room and minibar is included in your room. My only dislike was there was s bit of early morning and late night street noise but it wouldn't stop me staying again.

title: Fabulous Hotel within walking distance of rooftop bars (inc its own!) and great restaurants
desc: Hotel Scarlet is a lovely, welcoming hotel. The room was great, sizeable enough. Modern bathroom with range of complimentary toiletries. Complimentary water was another welcome touch. We arrived early off a very long flight and all staff including reception and concierge were polite and helpful and looked after our cases until we could check in later. The rooftop bar was a great facility to have close at hand with stunning skyline views. Didn't use the jacuzzi but it's slightly odd location didn't entice.

title: Short break Singapore
desc: Lovely clean hotel with exceptionally friendly staff. Hotel was stunningly beautiful. Convenient location for Chinatown and 3 local MRT stations to choose from. Nice rooftop restaurant and bar. Quirky boutique hotel highly recommended

title: Great stay in fun hotel
desc: Recently stayed at the Scarlet for a business trip. Amazing service with friendly staff always at hand to help. Hotel is boutique and funky with some fun additions to it (check out your do not disturb door hanger!!). Location is amazing for great bars and restaurants. Look forward to returning.

title: Delightful hotel well situated near Chinatown
desc: We spent several days at The Scarlet. The staff were very helpful. We asked to move to a room with a window on the front of the hotel, which was a little smaller but still comfortable with everything we needed. Great shower and effective AC.

title: Good option overall, but...
desc: I spent here 4n on a biz trip. Fancy/classy decoration, fast and friendly check in, nice and comfy room, nice bathroom too. However, I was given a room which is basically a basement. This means no windows at all, if you're ok with this (I was) then you will probably like it, a bit pricey though. It's located in a nice area plenty of bars/restaurants just 2mins away, Chinatown is around the corner.

title: Spent 5 days for your honeymoon Bliss
desc: The hotel is in Chinatown so we ate most nights at Hawker Markets nice and cheap. The hotel is a bit quirky, very clean,very helpful, delightful and welcoming staff. It was our little oasis at the end of our very full busy days sightseeing. Rooms were big enough to feel comfortable with high ceilings and mirrors it felt spacious. A small gesture of a signed card from the staff congratulations on our honeymoon was a lovely touch.

title: Great Find
desc: What a welcome! We were nervous of returning to Singapore because of cost as it is very expensive . When we arrived here we were bowled over. This redefines Boutique hotel, very comfortable, immaculately clean, friendly service and China Town is just around the corner. The Handy mobile phone is just fantastic. I will return here and this hotel has restored my faith in finding good value in Singapore .

title: A Little Gem Discovered!
desc: The Hotel Scarlet is beautiful! We were greeted warmly by the Front Desk staff as we approached to check in. The cool moist towel provided was a welcome treat to freshen up from the super hot weather outside. The decor was bold and nicely done. The suite we stayed in was roomy with a sitting room and a big bathroom. I was soooo happy that they provided us with our very own android phone with unlimited data, talk, text to the US (with more countries on the list) during our stay. Did I mention it was free for the duration of our stay? And yes, all the numbers you'll ever need to call in an emergency are all pre programmed!! How cool is that! The Scarlet is located down the street to a Hindu and Buddhist temple. It's only a few meters away to the Maxwell Hawker Center, Chinatown

title: This Boutique hotel is a beauty.
desc: We have just enjoyed six days in Singapore staying at the Scarlet, a quaint boutique hotel situated in a great location in the heart of Chinatown. We opted for a themed suite which gave us plenty of room to relax and unwind. The suite was great value when compared to other hotels in Singapore. If you prefer smaller hotels without a myriad of tourists lounging around the lobby then you will love this place. The smiling helpful staff were always attentive to all our needs and were always on hand to give me a refreshing complimentary bottle of water after venturing into Singapores humidity. This hotel will now be my base whenever I travel back. And if you do take my advice and stay here make sure you try the hotels Italian restaurant "Casa Tartufo" see my separate review for

title: Fabulous Hotel
desc: Gorgeous boutique hotel with sumptuous decor. Located in a quiet street in vibrant Chinatown and close to transport links, making exploring the city so easy Really couldn't fault our room - we were upgraded to a Premiere with balcony. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful. They really went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable (and it was!) Highly recommended

title: Great little hotel in Singapore's China Town
desc: Bearing in mind that this is a small boutique hotel in the heart of Singapore's China Town which is ideal for couples and honeymooners. Facilities are limited but it is ideal for a short stay. The décor is outstanding and the whole place is based on a similar boutique hotel in San Francisco's gay quarter.

title: A pleasant boutique hotel in good location.
desc: It is in the heart of China Town with various restaurants nearby. The hotel staff is friendly and service is superb. The room is comfortable and mine had a balcony. There is a roof garden called the Breeze from where you can enjoy a rooftop view of China Town. This is my home in Singapore for a number of years now.

title: No window!!
desc: The location is convenient for what I had to do. Also for walking around. I love the surroundings. I find the decoration overall pleasant. The staff I met is just fantastic. But, .. my room had no window. This as such for me is just not acceptable, period! Even more from a hotel supposedly 4 stars at a price of 200 $ per night. I had a deluxe room. There is a lower category, the standard room. What is the special touch there?

title: Boutique hotel with a great location
desc: We stayed at The Scarlet, passion room for a day for our wedding night. The room was beautiful and the jacuzzi was great. What actually was great was the service level of the staff. Not only they are very helpful, they are very thoughtful and go an extra mile. The service staff waited at the door just to make sure that our taxi was arriving while we rested in the lobby.

title: A wonderful experience at the Scarlet!
desc: My wife and I spent 4 memorable days at this classy boutique hotel, and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The room, which had a veranda overlooking Erskine Road, was nicely furnished and offered us plenty of space. Service was 5-star all the way, from front desk personnel to the cleaning staff, and we found the location of the hotel (near Chinatown) to be quite convenient. If you're heading for Singapore, try and reserve a room at the Scarlet, where guest comfort and services are a priority!

title: Great everything bar my room
desc: Like everyone else I cannot fault the staff here. They are all very friendly and willing to help, whatever the issue. The location is also fabulous ('though the new transit scheme across the road was being built when I was there - it was very noisy). It is in the heart of Chinatown and backs on to Ann Siang Road full of expensive bars and restaurants. It has a restaurant but I thought that it was overpriced. My biggest gripe is about my room. It was billed as "deluxe". It was not. It was nearly at the end of a very long corridor (no problem with that) but it had almost zero natural light - no windows at all. The wallpaper was hanging off one wall and the carpet had dubious stains over it. I see from some pictures that some rooms do have natural light. Check before you stay. In

title: lovely stay
desc: staff very helpful lost my phone in a taxi on the way to the airport they found it for me and made sure it got back to Australia big effort, right in the heart of Chinatown 200m walk to markets and more importantly a lovely place to stay

title: nearby the sightseeing location, ok to go
desc: the room is within standard level but small, the toilet is ok and clear people is nice and there are free beauty message offer during my visit but the time is not okay for me. So it is better provide in advance for my selection

title: Scarlet Hotel
desc: Staff are fantastic location is great, facilities at hotel are limited. You feel really enclosed in the room, minibar top up is hit & miss. More than 2 days you get bored, expensive food, in fact it's ridiculous at the bar. Would recommend crossing the road to the hawker market.

title: A unique place to stay in Singapore's Chinatown
desc: This is a very cool hotel, with a unique, eclectic style. The staff were really welcoming and super helpful. We liked the location, walking distance to so many good places in Chinatown including The Screening Room, another unique place. We would like to come back and stay in the Passion suite. Cannot recommend this place enough.

title: holiday stop from oz
desc: excellent hotel.staff very friendly room clean and everything we needed the only thing our room only had a shower would have liked a bath.Also wish the breakfast had more choice same every day.go visist gardens by the bay and the zoo and sentosa island.

title: The Scarlet Singapore
desc: My friend & I stayed at the The Scarlet Hotel for our 10 night stay in Singapore. The team were lovely, very accommodating & friendly. The hotel was clean,the decor was very beautiful & nicely air conditioned. The hotel also provided complimentary water bottles daily, which was handy when venturing out. I can not comment on the meals as only ate there once for breakfast (which was pricey as we didn't not get it included). The hotel also had a small gym which had two cardio equipments, free weights, weight machine & a couple of fit balls. Suited me just fine, although air conditioned also can get quite stuffy. There was also an outdoor Jacuzzi available. The location was ideal for us. We found that most of the places we wanted to explore where close to Chinatown, such as

title: The Most Beautiful Hotel I've Ever Stayed In!!!
desc: Oh my god! I have stayed in a LOT of hotels over the years but this is by far the BEST one yet! The decor is amazing. So much thought has gone into the furnishings, the layout and the colour scheme. It's far from just another sterile hotel, it's got charisma, personality and class. It oozes an ambience like no other. It's an experience just to stay there to say the least. Not only is it gorgeous, the service is AMAZING! The staff go above and beyond. The cleaners are there everyday putting your room back together like it was the very first day. The reception staff are very accomodating, professional and friendly. Nothing is too much trouble for them. And then there's the facilities and amenity packs. They have absolutely everything you'll need from your standard shampoo and

title: Close to Maxwell Rd Hawker Stalls
desc: Wow. Refresher towel and cold bottle of water on arrival. A mobile phone in each room is available to use for free for calls anywhere in the world and to take out with you to help navigate Singapore. And of course Social Media

title: Excellent Service
desc: I stayed in the Scarlet for three nights. I arrived and realised that I messed up my reservation. Jenny went out of her way to help me get sorted even when the hotel was very busy. I was handed a drink and a cold towel. Throughout the stay I was treated with kindness and a smile, Will stay again!

title: Wonderful.
desc: Such a fabulous, comfortable, quirky place to stay. Loved the premium room with stand up balcony overlooking tin roof as I could hear the rain on the tin roof and I love the rain! spacious and nice bath. Service was fabulous and food at the restaurant and coffee was great! perfect location. Rooms are clean and wifi is excellent - beds were initially quite hard but I asked for extra softening which was fine. :-) Ill def stay here again.

title: Nice place except for the ambiance
desc: It's good overall but the ambiance is ruined by the carpet smell. It could be the types of detergent they use. Overall service was great. The distance to the metro station isn't as close as expected given that the short cut shown on the map is not feasible as there's no crosswalk to the other side and you'll still need to take a detour to the farther intersection to cross.

title: Great character, very comfortable, and decent value for the city
desc: Singapore is not a cheap place to stay no matter where you go. The Scarlet is in a wonderful location, is very comfortable, and given the cost of the city as a whole it is good value for the money. You are right in the middle of Chinatown, and are steps away from the Maxwell Road food court, which is arguably one of the best (or at least most famous) Hawker Courts in Singapore. It is a short 5-10 minute walk to the Chinatown, Telok Ayer and Tanjong Pagar tube stations, and those three stations allow you easy access to practically all of the other major destinations in Singapore (If you are staying for a few days - Make sure to stop by one of the offices in a station and buy a travel pass which is well worth the price and gives unlimited travel through the tube network for a set

title: Gorgeous hotel with character and great location.
desc: Staying here was almost like stepping into Alice in Wonderland. I half expected to turn a corner and find a Cheshire Cat grinning at me, or a Mad Hatter dashing through the Lobby. The corridor was like a roller coast track, gently undulating up and down. I love the quirky decor, but I also,loved the great location. Right across the road from Chinatown, close to three MRT stations, next door to the Maxwell Centre, and yet still quiet and peaceful. I almost stayed in Club Street next door, but am so glad I didn't. Staff here are delightful: greeting me with a cold, lemongrass scented face cloth and cold water, helping me with questions and directions, and generally just being lovely. My room was gorgeous, quiet, spotlessly clean, and well appointed. The shower head was tricky as

title: Good place to stay but a bit pricey
desc: I stayed at the Scarlet, Singapore for 2 days during a business trip. The staff were really friendly and helpful. After making the payment online I was informed at the hotel that I would have to put down a deposit of 100 SGD, which would be returned after I checked out and they did. As far as the room is concerned, they upgraded me from the standard to the Deluxe room. Although the bathroom was spacious the sleeping area was small. This room also did not have any windows and I couldn't make out whether it was sunny outside or not. The room though had a smartphone called Handy which you could use to make free unlimited local calls and free unlimited international calls to 8 countries (Canada, USA, Australia, India, China and three more). This phone also had a free data plan which

title: Perfect Location
desc: We just stayed the one night but found it to be a very comforting place with friendly staff and a clean, quiet room. Great location with lots to do near by. Just a short walk to Chinatown and we also walked up to the Merlion Park which is a must see. Would definitely stay here again.

title: kind people, great location, nice amenities
desc: Great boutique hotel in a nice area. Just a block from Chinatown and the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple, 3 blocks from nearest MRT, Maxwell Hawker centre across the street, and around the corner from many great restaurants & bars. The room was quiet, temperature comfortable, bathroom very nice with a stand up shower with great water pressure. We enjoyed the extras like bathrobe & slippers, complimentary bottled water every day, and the free use of a mobile phone/internet to take around with us. The room also had a mini-fridge, but it wasn't cold. We enjoyed the rooftop bar very much. My only complaint is the bed was a little too firm for me, so sleep quality was not great (unless you prefer a firm bed). Pillows were fantastic. Hotel staff were always so kind and helpful.

title: Great place to stay in Singapore
desc: I stayed four nights April 7 - 11. The hotel is across the street from the Maxwell Food Court and where they are building the new Maxwell metro stop - yet I never heard any noise from either activity. It is one block from China Town and is within easy walking distance of four metro stations: Tangong Pajar on the green line; China Town on the purple line; Raffles Place on the red line; and Telok Ayer on the blue line. Room 113 did not have a window but that may have added to the quietness of the room. Excellent bed, shower, small mini fridge, coffee in room. Will definitely stay again.

title: Wonderful Hotel in a great location
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. The location is great with two underground train stations close by. Chinatown is a perfect location as you can get cheap meals and drinks too. We had a room with a balcony which suited us. You need to ask for these rooms a I believe they have rooms without a window in them. The room was clean and very nice although small and really nowhere to put your luggage but we made it work fine. The room has everything you need with a multi style power outlet. They also give you a mobile phone to use which we used for navigation and internet, very handy indeed. The bathroom is very nice and functional but is also small but the shower is large. They also have an outdoor spa area which we had a few drinks in on sunset, really nice too. The overall

title: Great, characterful hotel, not to be missed!
desc: We had three nights in the Scarlet in Singapore, 1-3 April 2017. This hotel is in Chinatown - by far and away the most interesting part of Singapore. The hotel itself is great fun, it's a 'luxury, boutique hotel', with lavish, slightly bohemian decor (all deep reds, blacks and greys, slightly reminiscent of an old French bordello, as as might be portrayed by Hollywood). The staff are super-friendly and helpful, and really do go out of their way to great you, give you advice, etc. There's a bar and restaurant on the roof - nice views, and breakfast in the first floor restaurant is good. Our room was a reasonable size (we went for a Premium Room), and did have a window, albeit one that was high on the wall! There was a free mini-bar (soft drinks only), and the wi-fi was

title: Boutique hotel
desc: Stayed one night. Great location for china town. Room small with no window. Ok for a night but maybe not much more. Didn't bother with breakfast as quite expensive. Very clean room with all extras required. Just lacking something. Eg no one to show us to room and help with bags.

title: nice hotel with a "Great Gatsby" vibe
desc: loved the decor of the place, and was really surprised how the long row of shophouses could have contained this unique hotel housing so many rooms. rooms were big, with nice natural lighting, and standard 5 star hotel features. location was very near the CBD and popular dining options and attractions. a little pricey but worth it. a very lovely stay

title: Great stay
desc: Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are small, but they have everything you need and more. They even come with a handheld with internet and free phone calls to take with you. Highly recommend.

title: Even Premium Room (top category apart from the suites) has NO WINDOW and NO SKYLIGHT. A cell, basically.
desc: Be warned, you cannot avoid the dreaded windowless rooms by booking into the premium category, the top non-suite category in the hotel. Others have discussed skylights and small high windows but premium room 122 has NO natural light whatsoever. Fully enclosed interior room. I think the hotel must have been full to put me in this room, so I didn't bother to request a change. And if it wasn't full then I have no idea why they would allocate this room to a guest who requested the top room category. As I was there for business and wasn't gonna spend much time at the hotel (the office is 2min walk away) I wasn't all that bothered. And to be fair, the room is otherwise spacious and comfortable, apart from a slightly leaking shower that leaves a small but annoying pool of water on

title: Lovely Stay!
desc: The Scarlet hotel is the kind of hotel that makes you feel discovering something new even in a city that you already know. I had the chance to stay there and I've been seduced by the atmosphere, you really feel good here. The location is in Chinatown, perfect for me. You don't feel rush, stressed, but relaxed and it starts straight from the checkin with a nice welcome.

title: I Loved This Hotel
desc: We had one of the standard "windowless" rooms. At first no window felt strange but we adjusted to it. The room was small but exceptionally comfortable. Bathroom huge, bedding sooo comfortable and we had no noise. The lighting is dull if need a bright light and we resorted to the torch in the cupboard a couple of times. The roof top bar is just lovely although they only had two types of beer, one of which was a "fruit" beer and tasted more like fizzy fruit drink - the other an American one which was heavy on the malt. If they had a real beer like Tiger, we would have used the bar more often but tended to going elsewhere. Found a great little café which opened early around the corner for a great, cheap breakfast. Great location and charming but unusual décor.

title: Quirky
desc: We loved this hotel, but not sure it would be to everyone's taste. The decoration is beautiful, the staff helpful, the room small but very comfortable with lots of extras. Only tried the rooftop bar and the staff were delightful, definitely recommend the limoncello. It was our anniversary and we got a lovely card and present. One of the positives of this hotel is its location. China town, Maxwell Food court all on its doorstep. If you like large hotels don't go but if you like somewhere different to go try here. We will definitely visit again. Thank you.

title: Nestled in Chinatown, vintage cool hide away is quaint & noisy
desc: Nestled in Chinatown, vintage cool hide away is quaint & noisy. Erskine Road is one of a dozen protected streets in the centre of the mega glass skyline. These road are full of character and hint towards yesteryear before the explosion of modernity that is Singapore. As you check into the hotel, you're struck by the burlesque decor, water fountains and decadent lobby. No expense has been spared with chairs too cool to sit on and the glass chandelier hanging between the mirrored circle that delights and confuses in equal measure. The front desk staff are welcoming. Good start. At 9.30pm and a long flight, the room service was meant to be open until 10. After a quick call where I was told the kitchens had closed, i persuaded them to rustle up a sandwhich which when it

title: Small and cozy
desc: The Scarlet is certainly one of a kind. Has its own flare and karma. The staff are EXTREMELY helpful and nice. A smile for everyone. The rooms are small (2 adults with luggage was a bit of a challenge), but has everything you need. (We had an executive room). The breakfast was basic, but enough. The absolute best thing, besides to awesome staff, is location, location, location.

title: Quaint Boutique Hotel
desc: This defines Boutique hotel combining affordability with comfort and style. It reminds me of an Ian Schraeger property in New York City ( the Paramont). First, my booking was last minute which made the price seem like a bargain especially for Singapore. That's how come I ended up with a windowless room which I don't necessarily recommend unless your nocturnal. The room was bigger than average size for Asia. But most important to me was the bed was comfortable. I find in Asia the beds to be too firm but not here. I understand that they even have a special bed in the more expensive rooms. All the staff was great and I maybe spelling his name wrong but Tofeez stood out. He made sure he greeted me every time i walked in the lobby and call me by my name. His recommendations were

title: Fabulous hotel in a great location
desc: Stayed here for two nights recently with my sister. Reception area is beautifully decorated and staff were efficient and always friendly. Our room was located on the second floor and was beautifully decorated with a small balcony. Room size was small but given you are in a converted shophouse, this is is to be expected. Little touches such as the earplugs & mobile phone were fabulous. I was concerned by other posts regarding noise but neither of us needed to use the ear plugs. Hotel location is fabulous, 30 second walk to Maxwell Road Food Centre and close to Chinatown Food St. The only consideration would be if you were a larger sized person - the bathroom was very small and the using the toilet would be difficult as you need to go in on an angle. I would definitely stay here

title: Brilliant ambience and location
desc: After reading several reviews of the hotel we had some reservation about noise, size of room and the lack of a swimming pool. We were pleasantly surprised: the noise was no issue and the room was spacious and comfortable. Luckily, we had also requested a balcony. This was a good size and we spent many evenings there. Although the balcony overlooked a multi-storey car park, it was actually interesting to watch the coming and goings throughout the day. The car park was in fact part of the URA building, the Urban Redevelopment Authority. This motivated us to visit the free URA exhibition. I cannot here go into detail, but it was fascinating and well worth a visit. The rooftop bar of the hotel is incredibly popular, but spacious enough to accommodate a large number of guests. We

title: THREE WONDERFUL NIGHTS SPENT AT THIS HOTEL
desc: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel for three nights, from Jan 7-9, 2017. The standard of cleanliness at the hotel and the rooms is very good, Our room was very comfy. The quality of food was exceptionally good, In room service was also too good. The staff at the reception, especially to mention two names, one of Ms. Jenny and secondly Mr. Hafiz (not sure if I am naming correct) were very polite, courteous and professional in their job. The house-keeping staff, especially to mention Mr. Raghavendran and the person attending us on Jan 9, 2017 morning were very exteremeluy courteous and helpful. We thank the hotel management for a very comfortable stay and hope to stay again if opportunity permits.

title: not worth it
desc: We stayed at the hotel from 13 feb to 16 feb decorated like a brothel hence the name scarlet they try to cover the smell of the damp musty carpets with alot of air fresher we had to stay another night most hotels in singapore booked out was quoted $270 dollars when we confirmed the next day we were charged $370 for 1 extra night was told $26 for breakfast when husband asked for a extra egg was told he would have to pay extra $10 staff are not friendly or welcoming at front desk abrupt and cold on arrival was told we have been upgraded room very basic singapore is a beautiful city but found people very curt railway system great people working at the rail stations very helpful

title: Quirky , top location but smal rooms
desc: We stayed four nights. As can be seen from the photos this is not your ordinary, non descript type of hotel.....it most definitely has character, staff is very helpful and the location is as good as it gets, 2 minutes stroll from Chinatown eat street. A minus is the small rooms. If you travel lightly, this is not a problem, but if you have a bit more luggage, it can be a struggle. There is a comfortable meeting room/library for use of guests. We didn't try the restaurant, as there were so many eateries so close by. There are numerous wine bars in the laneways behind the hotel, all of a good standard, by the looks of it. The MRT station is 10 minutes walk away, but a new one is being built almost across the street. We didn't experience any noise problems, though. I don't like

title: Birthday Celebration at Scarlet
desc: I visited the Scarlet on my birthday eve, I was caught by surprise that I got free upgrade by the staff name Hafeez. He is very friendly and helpful. I didnt know that my friends already contacted him to make the surprise celebration for me. Hafeez helped my friends to cater to their needs to make it a successful birthday surprise. I am very happy that when I got into the room, Scarlet Singapore gave a complimentary birthday goodies and also birthday card! (how sweet!) I totally love the ambiance there. Staff are very friendly and helpful! Never regret spending my birthday over at the Scarlet Singapore. Thank you Hafeez and team for making my birthday a memorable one! KUDOS!

title: Fantastic boutique hotel
desc: Great hotel, right near Chinatown. Many sights in walking distance, and much choice of restaurants nearby. The staff is fantastic, rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff were so accommodating, helped with everything.

title: Nice location with regular service
desc: If you expect over the top Asian service, don't go to the Scarlet although the hotel is nice and the location is fantastic the service attitude leaves much to desire. No help with luggage (arrival and departure), no interaction with reception not even a smile, small rooms, average breakfast and only the roof top restaurant went a bit out of its way in service attitude. Not sure how this property passed the strict SLH quality assurance tests.

title: Fun little hotel in Chinatown
desc: We checked in about 11:00 p.m. and were sent in the wrong direction - please note that the hotel has an "Alice in Wonderland on crack" feel and the rooms are not arranged in traditional format. The clerk realized her mistake and found us wandering and took us to the OTHER third floor, accessible through a different elevator. Our room was through what looked like a fire escape door and overlooked a small rooftop hot tub. We were prepared for a micro-room and were not disappointed. However, if I had not seen photos beforehand, I would have been. We had a balcony room with two twin beds, with less than a foot in between them. There is a large wardrobe you will need to use to put any luggage in as there is not much room elsewhere. The balcony doors open inward and brush

title: Lovely staycation
desc: We had the opportunity to stay at the Splendour Suite, and It was indeed a splendid stay. The room was very comfortable and spacious, and the bathroom had a bathtub (with Jacuzzi facilities), which made the stay even better. The rain shower in the bathroom also added comfort to the stay, and it is definitely a boutique hotel I would recommend to friends. The staff was very friendly, and the check-in was smooth. The hotel is also near to many amenities, such as the Maxwell Food Market, the Korean-area in Tanjong Pagar, the Duxton Hill café/food area, etc.. The only gripe we had was the outdoor Jacuzzi pool - it was not heated, and was not an enjoyable experience as the view was rather limited and the water was cold.

title: Great stay.
desc: Very clean, good check in service (late at night). Room was quiet. Close to Chinatown and River Quay section. Would stay again. Excellent front desk staff. Room had mobile smartphone to use for street walking.

title: An oasis amongst the sky scrapers
desc: This delightful hotel situated on the edge of Chinatown in Singapore is in a great location. It is just a minute walking distance from Chinatown and near to the bus routes etc. It is in a small side road off the main drags and reasonably quiet. However there is a major building project across the road but this did not have a detrimental effect on us. Maxwells Food Hall is also across the road and a great place to eat. The hotel is beautifully decorated and is a Heritage building. The staff were very helpful and efficient. The breakfast was okay but get down reasonably early. The room was small but bearing in mind the size of the building well designed and had everything we needed. We were very happy with our stay at the Scarlet and the city of Singapore.

title: Lovely niche hotel, very comfortable.
desc: They have everything you need, soft towels, comfy bed, even a spare umbrella for those stormy days in the rainy season so you don't get caught in the rain. Staff were all very nice. Newly decorated. Beautiful building, I love the old style. And inside it's fun, very nicely done rooms. Would definitely go back again.

title: Decline
desc: I stayed at the Scarlet in Singapore twice before. This time I was quite disappointed in the overall level of service. The room was ok, except the shower door could not shut properly, so the bathroom floor got wet every time I took a shower. The bedding leaves much to be desired. Clean but very thin bedcovers. I had to ask for additional bedding to have a good night's rest. Breakfast was bad. I only went for breakfast at the hotel on the first day. Although they said breakfast starts at 7, the door to the restaurant was still locked at 7. SGD26 not worth the trouble. I walked 50m around the corner to the Club Hotel. Friendly professional staff and an a la carte menu . The restaurant at the Scarlet does a better job at dinner, even though service was very slow. Best part of

title: Great stay and a real gem in Chinatown.
desc: Stayed here for 2 nights. We choose the cheapest option with a room with no window. Was above our expectations in every way. First off with the no window it was a positive as it was darker (for great sleeping and quieter) I dont know why you would want a window unless your looking over a great harbour or great view. Why look at another brick wall or building site. The bed was super comfy, Pillows and sheets were of great quality and bathroom shower was large (Compared to most of Singapore) The layout of the hotel is a whole row of houses joined so bit quirky but thats what make it unique. The fit out of the room was nice, Free phone to use around Singapore,Bathrobes in the room,Safe,Umbrella and good tv stations. The checkin and checkout was quick and the Wifi worked great

title: Classy in a great location
desc: We were only there for one night in transit but would have loved to have used this as my base in Singapore a couple of weeks earlier. Very quirky but in a very interesting and classy way. Good size room with loads of free extras in room- like tea, coffee, water, safe, "handy" mobile phone, robes slippers etc. Regret not seeing this on my outward journey. Paralell with a street called "Club Street" which is full of western style bars and restaurants. But its also only yards away from Chinatown and its temples and food halls.

title: An opulent period conversion
desc: Genuinely surprised by this gem of a shop house conversion that exudes some old world charm . Be it the plush , well appointed rooms , service , the rooftop bar / restaurant, quality of food etc. Well positioned behind Maxwell Centre, just off Club Street and Duxton Hill to offer a plethora of restaurants , hawker fare and bars . Loved it and will be back

title: Stop over on the way to Australia.
desc: Stayed in the Scarlet as a stop off on the way to Australia. Hotel is located on the edge of Chinatown in what used to be the red light district, hence the risque name. Room we had was a standard double on the side, view a bit poor as we overlooked a car park. Room was very good with nice bed, plenty of wardrobe space, good bathroom with nice toiletries, safe, mini bar, and free wifi. Air conditioning was fine if very noisy, which a call to reception, ensured it was fixed when we went out for a meal. Down side to hotel was cost of the extras, food and drink were very expensive, eat out with the locals and bring your own booze in from the local shops. Hotel is not cheap but is good value if you eat out. Singapore I regret to advise is one massive building site, you could be in

title: Fun, original, beautifully tacky, great service
desc: Right in Chinatown, so well located. We booked a suite on 3rd floor - extremely well maintained with a delightful layout even though a bit small (big for S'pore!); my wife loved every bit of it! Front Desk staff couldn't be more helpful, housekeeping was spotless & amenities were top grade. Intimate rooftop bar with top Martinis & superb Italian truffle inspired restaurant - we did indulge in the master's recommendation for a Barolo - and did right! Will be back...

title: helpful
desc: really great location, just by china town and financial district, chick hotel, incredibly helpful staff esp. Hafeez, clean and stylish, rather small room but very accommodating,great value for money , will stay there again

title: Quaint and Querky
desc: I was looking for somewhere with character to stay in when in Singapore. The Scarlet looked to fit the bill and we were not disappointed. The Scarlet is a period building in Chinatown. Handy for walking the Chinatown district but also within easy reach of the CBD and the tourist spots of the city. Although the rooms are cramped they are well appointed and comfortable. The hotel has a rooftop bar and a main restaurant which serves higher end food specialising in truffle. Both have an Italian theme. The staff are friendly and efficient. A good and reasonably priced place to stay when in Singapore.

title: Great choice for a stopover
desc: Stayed at the Scarlet for just one night as I had a stopover in Singapore and, much preferring a boutique hotel to a corporate chain, it ticked all the right boxes: quirky charm, stylish, great location and excellent value for money. It's beautifully decorated (the Christmas decorations were fab throughout, given a big helping hand in that they so complemented the general decor) and the slight nod to the salacious is humorously carried through to the room do not disturb/make up my room signs. I met up with some friends who, it turned out, worked very close by and although we'd intended to just meet at the hotel rooftop bar before moving on, we simply stayed there for the evening. The bar was nice enough but nothing to write home about really. (Wine was horribly expensive,

title: Good location but average stay
desc: i have heard rave reviews about the Scarlet Hotel thus we opted to stay here over the rest of the hotels in Singapore for our staycation. However, i wasn't too impressed with the stay here. 1. They offered a 10 mins treatment at the Beauty Empire - but it wasn't open throughout our stay. Worst of all, it wasn't properly communicated to the front desk, and we woke up on the day of check out expecting that it was open and we should be going for our treatment. Front desk checked on the website and it was supposed to be opened on the 3rd day of CNY. Just ridiculous when you offer something that was free, and then in the end we don't get it and it leaves a bad taste. 2. The room - really nothing fancy. It feels like a stay in your own home, and i kind of regretted opting to stay

title: Beautiful Boutique hotel in central Singapore
desc: Loved this place. It is very well decorated, centrally located. A little noisy as some rooms are overlooking the street but it's part of the charm. This is a good romantic spot or even business hotel.

title: Nice location and hotel but... ehy, a room without window?
desc: I have been there for a couple of night. Great location just beside Club st., a lovely old time building and efficient staff. I had only a problem... a room without window, looking more like a closet than a room.. I asked for a change and I got a new room but it seems standard room with window are subject to availability so you don't know when you book if you are going to stay in a room or in a closet. I have to say that it happened quite often in Singapore when I was travelling in medium range hotels and that is quite astonishing to me... a room with no window is actually not allowed to be inhabited under european laws. Be carefull when you book at this hotel to have what you are paying for...

title: Scarlet Singapore
desc: Hotel met or exceeded all our high expectations. Brilliant location between Chinatown and the adjacent quality bar Street....see review of Noti. All rooms had free to use mobile with all Singapore services located by Google. This was enormously helpful on our travels. Good sized and appointed rooms. Would definitely recommend and return ourselves.

title: Stunning hotel..with pros and cons
desc: Well travelling Singapore to write on attractions and accommodation I choose the Scarlet as my first stay. I booked to stay in their luxury room 'The Lavish". Described by them as "A sanctuary of exquisite extravagance, highlighted by an arresting day bed in matching red velvet, awaits to pamper, but the centrepiece of this distinguished suite has to be the much talked about Hästens bed – Asia’s first, and valued at S$38,500. With natural fillings of horsehair, flax, wool and pine all painstakingly handmade, this Swedish masterpiece is the gracious hostess’ tempting invitation to a good night’s sleep". The room is amazing and has many attractive features. however it did not help me sleep, the noise from the outside street was too loud, they did provide earplugs but they were not

title: Abit of a maze
desc: We actually got lost trying to find out room as the rooms are built in shophouses but the room was overall clean & the bed was super comfy. All the floors were carpeted and gives a warm feeling walking around the hotel. Its close to Chinatown & easy to navigate once you know the landmarks.

title: Beware of building works.
desc: I am a big fan of the Scarlet and returned for the third time recently. The big minus right now is the building work that is going on opposite the hotel which meant we had a view only of the large wooden boards opposite the hotel. Whilst i would return again, I would wait until this major work on a new metro station is finished.

title: Loved our stay
desc: This hotel has an unbeatable location and a lovely plush ambiance. Small rooms, but that's to be expected in Singapore. Excellent service and facilities. As a tall Western person, it was funny to wear a size L bathrobe that barely closed on my waist :)

title: Sexy hotel, excellent service
desc: Visited for 3nts with my husband. The reception staff are all very efficient, helpful and friendly. Our room was on the ground floor and whilst larger than average, had minimal natural light..... which was overcome with some clever lighting in the room and added to the subtle naughtiness and decadence of the place. Well located for chinatown and transport, and near some excellent hawker centres, this is the perfect base to explore singapore.

title: Good service, great location
desc: This hotel is in a great spot in town, easy access to the metro and club street and chinatown. We only stayed 2 nights but enjoyed the breakfast (which included bacon, sausage and egg) - i read another review that said it didnt include this but it does!. The rooftop bar is cool and the reception staff welcoming. They also looked after our bags for 7 hours on checkout and we were able to have a shower as well at no extra charge. Then supplying a phone in the room that you can take with you during your stay and use for data and calls was a really nice touch. The only downside is no window in the room, we did pock the lower price room, which is decorated nicely and good tv channels (HBO etc) but i did miss the window, however we didn't spend lots of time in the room so not a huge

title: comfortable and good location
desc: the staff was friendly and the location of the hotel is very convenient. Quiet rooms suitable for honeymooners. Worth the money. Ideal for young couples. The rooms are very cosy to have a deep sleep for all.

title: Nice 3 Star Hotel with good location
desc: The low rice hotel is typically decorated in a kitschy Chinese style. Some may call it Boutique style. Its okay for a few nights in Singapore. For a longer stay, I did, a week I would not recommend this hotel as the breakfast is extremely boring. 1 type of cheese, only white toast, 2 types of jam, 1 type of Yogurth. My room #236 was on the extreme end of a dark narrow corridor. I counted 100 steps, All in dark pink with yellow light. The room was average and nice and as well the bathroom. It has been sold to me as a 4 star hotel which it does not live up to. 3 Stars is a fair categorization.

title: Great Location! Excellent staff with an exception that almost cost them a star for me....
desc: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days so this review is not an "in and out" stay type of perspective. The location can not be beat. You are around the corner from Club Street which has great restaurants, entertainment, etc. You can walk to Maxwell Market which is a wonderful Hawker Center that offers cheap eats and the famous Chicken Rice that Anthony Bourdain boosted about. The standard rooms, however, are very small for an extended stay so make sure you ask for a larger room if you will be there beyond a few nights. The complimentary water is very nice as Singapore is always hot so be aware of that as well when packing. There is a 7-11 at the end of the street to purchase water or you can walk over to Maxwell and stock up. The staff is very friendly and accommodating for the

title: Classy little gem!
desc: The location was ideal for our visit. Decor smart and chic and stylish. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was spotlessly clean. We would definitely return to the Scarlett hotel we enjoyed our stay

title: Great location with amazing staff
desc: My stay at Scarlett was amazing, from the moment you walk into the hotel you are greeted by the most friendly staff. The staff were helpful with directing you around the city and any other questions you may have. The hotel smelled amazing, the rooms were kind of small but very well kept. I was nervous staying in a hotel without windows, however my stay was wonderful.

title: hotel with nice ambience
desc: a great place for staycation in SG! clean facilities and excellent customer service! worth spending your couple time and family time here in Scarlet Hotel. most importantly, there're nice cafes and restaurants around the hotel.

title: Hidden Gem
desc: Front desk are very friendly, will even ask you how's your day and give you a cold water to beat the heat outside. Our room is the one with balcony, spacious. They even gave us some sweets in our room. Hotel smell is very nice and the design is elegant. We stayed one night. They provide phone that you can use when you go outside, especially for tourist. They have 10mins complementary massage. Alot of food around the area, Ann siang hill, Maxwell. Good location. Very relaxing hotel and worth the money.

title: Quaint boutique hotel in China Town
desc: All walls are scarlet, place looks a bit like a movie set. Rooms are small but adequate. Service is ok but nothing spectacular. Breakfast was definitely not up to standards for a place marketing itself as a luxury hotel. It was included in my room but just had a coffee, as most of the food looked like it had been there for quite some time. I would never book a room here with breakfast, you are much better off having some in the area

title: Scarlet Hotel - great hotel and great location
desc: Stayed at the Scarlet Hotel for 3 days on a December business trip - location close to Chinatown and the financial offices I needed to visit. Hotel is quite unique with exotic fixtures and furnishings - comfortable room and excellent service staff with a simple breakfast to start the day. Hotel is located very conveniently to many restarants and market areas - highly recommended.

title: "Cosy" rooms.
desc: We stayed here for just 1 night pre-cruise having chosen Chinatown for its proximity to the Marina Bay Cruise Centre (just a $10 cab ride away). The location was convenient to the MRT, food & shopping. The hotel was quirky as promised and the rooms comfortable if somewhat pokey (as mentioned by other reviewers). Will probably stay at the nearby Furama next time.

title: Style without substance
desc: The hotel got the lavish decor in which I found it quite fun. The location is quite nice though it's not in the city centre but I think it's a nice area. The room is quite tiny but the decor and details look expensive. What I really don't like about this hotel is the service which is terrible. I requested for a cup of cappuccino in my room and it took like 40 mins. The overall experience was ok but I don't think I'll go back there.

title: Small boutique hotel next to china town
desc: I visit singapore very often for business and this time since my hotel was fully booked i checked that one which is in the same area. After a 2 days stay i can easily say now that i will not return again. Arrived late nite and the people at the reception desk having a lot of fun and laughing with no reason at all. My room was small and dark and two lamps were off. The room was on second floor just by the street which was always busy. A lot of noise from the cars and people passing by and could not even open the dark black shades. Next to my bed i found a welcome note and a set of complimentary earplugs. Now i know why...

title: Beautiful Boutique
desc: Love everything about this hotel except for the tiny room. Amenities are top notch and the location is central. It's literally down the street from Maxwell Food Center, Chinatown Complex, and Buddha Tooth Temple. It's also walkable to Clarke Quay and a short Uber ride to Gardens by the Bay.

title: Boutique jewel in Chinatown!
desc: We loved our two night stay at The Scarlet. The location is absolutely perfect - it is a hop to Chinatown, skip to Club St, and jump to wider Singapore. The hotel offers all the amenities that you need; put aside time to use the roof top jaccuzzi, have a glass of wine at Aria on the roof top, and wonder the shops just outside. We stayed in an executive room with balcony, and whilst the room was small (as is common in Asia) it fit us perfectly. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, the balcony was large with a fan so we could enjoy the evenings, and the bathroom was all you needed for a two night stay.

title: A change of scenery for me - great location
desc: We are normally expected to stay out in Balestier whilst in Singapore. But the Scarlet was cheaper, so I booked it myself. Hard to get dropped off and picked up by taxi as there is no parking there, but once inside it's lovely. Basically, it's the entire first floor of the shop-houses below... It was well located - breakfast in Maxwell hawker centre, and a short walk into Chinatown. Great stuff. I'll be back to here when I return - though I may wait until the work on the hawker centre is complete, as the work started very early...

title: Great boutique hotel - perfect location
desc: Had a day trip to Singapore and needed to unexpectedly spend the night. Had a meeting in the Telok Ayer area and wanted a hotel in the vicinity. The Scarlet was in walking distance. I usually stay at mainstream branded venues, however since this had good reviews and I could walk to the hotel, I picked it. Quaint, friendly and well presented hotel. Looks like a small place from the entrance, but plenty of rooms. the building is old and historic, however well maintained and the decor is warm and somewhat seductive. Staff are great and check in was a breeze, considering I made the booking 10 minutes before I showed up. Room was on the small size but absolutely perfect for my stay, clean, space to work, comfortable bed, clean bathroom and all the amenities needed. I would have

title: Great boutique hotel
desc: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Chinatown and very close and convenient to MRT stations, shopping and Maxwell hawker center. We practically ate breakfast there everyday. The room was spacious enough for us (2 adults and 1 toddler). We got upgraded to a king size bed which was wonderful. The staff was very polite and helpful. Would definitely recommend this place.

title: Boutique has a brand new definition in Singapore!
desc: Let me start with a confession - I am not a big fan of boutique hotels. But Scarlet Singapore is definitely a welcome departure from my usual pattern of staying at 'name brand' hotels. I booked a reservation for the entire month of October 2016, on a whim. I was a true 'walk-in' booking. I am big believer that any hotel can get a good review for a short-stay. It is only when one stays for an extended period of time, that one gets to see the 'true nature' of a hotel's quality and service. I had the utmost pleasure of staying at the Scarlet Singapore for the entire month of October and it was a great experience. My first impressions of this hotel was made with the interaction of 2 lovely front-office ladies - Nomin & Chuluun. They spent almost 90 minutes to work through the

title: Perfect place to stay for a couple of days. Somehow expensive but overall okay
desc: The rooms are a bit small but cozy. Amenities are complete and are being replenished everyday, clean and fresh towels too! I love the pillows, wish I could take them home :) Staff are polite and friendly, very conversational and always willing to help. Location is perfect, near chinatown and maxwell center. Bus stops and train stations are also near. Although it's a bit expensive compare to other hotels nearby that provides breakfast and has swimming pools. They also don't provide car service or shuttle from airport.

title: Can't beat the location.
desc: Before going to Singapore everyone warned me about how dear it is, but if you stay in Chinatown, it is not expensive at all. The hotel is quirky and sort of like out of fairytale. I was disappointed in the service here, but would stay again. We got to the hotel early, and I knew the room wouldn't be available until 2pm, but had to wait until around 2.20 to check in with no apology. There are 2 lifts, and the receptionist directed us to the wrong lift. The luggage beat us to our room it took us that long to find it, Overall a good stay.

title: Out side the Square.
desc: The Scarlet Singapore is A-Mazing!!! Funky, funky decor, excellent attention to detail and very friendly staff make this a fantastic boutique hotel. Right around the corner from the Maxwell Rd Hawkers Market (Best food in Singapore) and minutes from Chinatown. The rooftop bar is a perfect place to unwind late. Cool beer and signature cocktails. Say G'day to JR, he's a legend.

title: Great place to stay
desc: Great place to stay; really friendly and helpful staff, rooms clean and air conditioned, and if you happen to be a David Lynch fan, the corridors have a nice Twin Peaks vibe to them. Staff were only too happy to book taxis/airport shuttles when required and gave helpful directions for places I wanted to find. Also, I discovered on the last day that there's a small 'leisure centre' on 3rd floor - little outdoor hot tub that would have been very welcome in downtime moments if it had been advertised.

title: great service and a liitle out of the ordinary
desc: My 91 year old mother and I arrived late at night to be welcomed and offered a drink of water whilst we checked in which came in a bottle my mother said I need a glass which didn't faze them they quickly went upstairs and produced a glass. As she is quite disabled I made sure the rooms had walk in showers which were disabled friendly which it they were and for Singapore quite luxurious, space wise.There is a great food market across the road if you need to eat cheaply . you are right in the middle of china town .As we were only staying one night as we were taking a cruise the next day it is perfect although we stayed at the Fullerton on our return from the cruise and I think we enjoyed the scarlet maybe more only let down was breakfast but hey you cant have everything

title: First stay at a Boutique in Singapore
desc: We have stayed in Singapore quite a few times and usually go for the 5 star with club lounge great pool and excellent buffet breakfast . This time we were without the kids so wanted something a bit more romantic . Loved this hotel . Totally different experience . Amazing decor . Friendly staff . We chose a room with a balcony as recommended by other TA people . Not sure that we really needed it . It looked out onto a carpark across the road and was a bit too humid to sit outside , Might depend what time of year you go . The hotel is close to club street for food but also close to Maxwell food court . We used this for breakfast as cheap and huge range of local food. Rooms were clean and comfortable

title: The right Boutique choice.
desc: I stay in this hotel quite regularly. It is a 1 minute walk from club street, where there are cool bars and quality restaurants. Also a short walk to Duxton Hill, which is no doubt now a great spot for eating and drinking. Room quality is excellent and good value for money. The roof top bar probably needs a little more attention to gain a larger crowd yet, a good place to finish up for the evening. I love the mobile phone in room that they have adopted, saves mega dollars on roaming and works well. Suits are excellent size and worth the extra if you can upgrade. I would only criticise one thing and that is breakfast. This need to lift sharply, its dull and of mediocre, such an easy fix so get it right please. I would suggest a made to order option rather than the buffet would

title: Really good choice!!
desc: We stayed here in January 2016. Having never stayed in a boutique hotel before, I was curious how our stay would turn out, but it turned out much better than expected. It's narrow corridors gave me flutters in my heart every time we walked through them. And the entrance lobby was so different from the likes of 7 star and 5 star hotels..! It was totally worth it. We never ate there as we were always out exploring but the room was so cozy. and really really neat. It is a definite stay if you want a clean and spot on accommodation and you do not plan on staying in your room all day long..! The places around this hotel are also worth having a stroll around during the night.. We stayed here for 5 days and would definitely choose this place if we were to travel to Singapore again..!

title: Out of the ordinary!
desc: Unconventional, idiosyncratic, off the wall! Certainly unique by all accounts from its facade to it's interior to the unusual guest rooms. Notwithstanding the personnel are helpful and amiable and the bedchambers are chic, well maintained and comfortable!

title: Excellent
desc: Quiet and staff very friendly. Cafe and restaurant on site is wonderful for breakfast and dinner plus aquiet relaxing drink. .Rght on the heart of Chinatown and easy walking to a food court across the road if you want local cuisine . Otherwise stay in and eat Italian.

title: Very good option for a few days in Singapore
desc: Very classy boutique hotel in a great location near Chinatown. The rooms are very small but beautifully appointed. Reasonably priced and in a fantastic location. Front desk service was good and the room and hotel had everything we wanted.

title: A quint little hotel. A little pricey
desc: Located near the central of Singapore. Has many amenities in the area. Love the homely restaurant that was located just next to the hotel. But the room i was assigned to was kinda disappointing. It was plain compared to what I saw online.

title: Love the bed
