desc: I was there to spend the last night in Singapore. The hotel located so close to China town and also Buddha tooth relic temple. The bed was great but I still feel it is a lil bit pricey. Overall I was happy with the hotel, the staffs was nice and friendly compared to the previous hotel we have been to.

title: A quirky, good hotel in a really good location
desc: Shop houses converted and strung together as an Hotel, with a rooftop bar that is very nice. Some rooms do not have windows, and are small, so choose carefully if that is an issue. Good Hotel, excellent spot, right in the heart of Chinatown, and a stones throw to the Maxwell Rd. Foot Court, where the chicken rice is famous.

title: A Stunning Jewel in Chinatown
desc: My Singapore home away from home. As always an attentive staff that remembers everything about you and your requirements from a hotel, so a level of service not usually encountered. There's continuity of the managerial staff, so a tremendous comfort level. AND the staff was not put out by my erratic changes to my car/taxi requirements. Extra special welcome touches in the room for a VERY weary traveler arriving at 1:30AM from the nasty late flight from HK. And this time I was treated to a brilliant room with French doors and balcony - if only I was not there for business but could have enjoyed more of the hotel and Chinatown. Excellent location for business and the restaurant is conducive to business chats. A mate of mine is staying there now and she is loving every moment of it

title: Excellent Location
desc: I really liked my stay at the Scarlet Hotel. Positives: nice decor, rooftop pool, the rooftop restaurant, the Italian restaurant, friendly staff. Negatives: the room was small without a window. Confirm at the time of booking.

title: great position in chinatown
desc: our room was an executive balcony room.it was quite small,but the balcony was great,very 1920s.with its potted palms.the staff were good and had our room ready early,as we arrived at 8-30am.there is a Jacuzzi on the 2nd.floor,which is clean and well maintained.there are heaps of restaurants and also a 7eleven close by.this is a quirky hotel with its red and black décor.keeping with the theme of days gone by!

title: Great place!
desc: We stayed here for a one night staycation for my boyfriend's birthday and were really impressed by the hotel! Got one of those really good deals from the HotelQuickly app so our room was just a deluxe with no windows, and a skylight but we found it pretty cool nonetheless. The room is spacious, beautifully decorated and has a really comfy bed and pillows. The plus point of not having windows is we were not bothered by any noise from the street at all and the skylight was quite a bit away from the bed so we weren't bothered by light pouring in come morning. The staff was lovely and the amenities sufficient. Walking down the hallway is an experience; you're basically traversing through old shophouses down a windy path and with the boudoir-ish decor you feel transported away from

title: Lovely little hotel - maybe a bit tired?
desc: It's the second time we've stayed here, which says something. The hotel is small and quirky and if you are expecting a Hilton/Sheraton you'll be disappointed. The staff were again friendly and very helpful and "rushed" a room for us when we turned up early for our booking (8 hours early). This time round our room was a bit small and the air conditioning is definitely due an upgrade. Other than that the location is very convenient for Club Street, Chinatown, Maxwell food court and only a short walk from Clarke Quay. Towels and bedding were of good quality and comfortable. We were missing an iron/ironing board and it was delivered within 5mins of placing the call. Speaking of Club Street, this time we stayed we were in a room not directly adjoining that street, which can get a bit

title: Great find
desc: Lovely little boutique hotel just off Chinatown. Great location, clean and unique. Friendly staff. All you would want if you wanted a short visit. Right next to the Maxwell Rd hawker centre for good cheap food. Bars very convenient and a nice rooftop bar . Prices in Chinatown aren't cheap so be prepared , but there are more expensive place too. A great little find if you don't mind small rooms

title: quirky property, good hotel
desc: Located in the nicer part of Chinatown, just opposite Maxwell Food Centre's huge choice of authentic local food, this is the right place for a tourist trip, and not impossibly far - a short walk on a cool day - from the main CBD. It's a conversion of a row of shophouses, so the layout is architecturally interesting, shoehorned into the exoskeleton of a dozen buildings; inside it's very deliberately "tart's boudoir" - lots of rich colours, deep pile carpets... Check in and check out was efficient and friendly. The room was comfortable, if not very big, with a good shower/toilet room and all the amenities (including good free wifi). I've stayed in, or seen, several rooms, and although all have some sort of natural light, not all have an outward view (some have just a

title: Great place to stay central to everything
desc: Situated in Chinatown the Scarlet is central to everything. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. There are restaurants, pool, bar and a beauty spa attached. The staff are very helpful and friendly

title: My favorite boutique hotel
desc: Love this quaint refurbished establishment. Walking distance from Club street/Ann Siang Hill/Duxton with lotsa wine & dine options. There's a rooftop bar is less popular with locals so it's a nice escape if u prefer quieter places. Disclaimer: Pay more for a 2nd floor room with balcony n bathtub. The rooms on the first floor are small n have no windows so if u were claustrophobic, u could hyperventilate/suffocate.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
desc: While this hotel may feel a bit away from the touristy hot spots, it is adjacent to Chinatowns "Food street" and the hawker centre, meaning it is close to lots of good food. It is a 10 minute walk to an MRT station. The hotel staff was helpful and accommodating, and the rooms are nicely appointed and playful.

title: Disappointed
desc: There's no windows in room, not well ventilated. For the price that they are charging, there's a lot more hotels in Singapore that much more better! This is the first and last time that I'm going to the hotel.

title: Extremely Disappointed :(
desc: I came to the Scarlett with high expectations but I'm very disappointed. Firstly I had to pay a deposit of 100 Singapore dollars (in addition to what I paid for the room). I was completely blindsided. Granted, the deposit is refundable, however, after seven days. This is very inconvenient and precisely the reason why I avoid car rentals. I don't understand why they don't do what other hotels do and just do a room check before a guest leaves. Secondly, the bath robes are too small for me and when I requested a robe that fits, my request was met with deafening silence. They offer tea but without milk. I was advised that milk is available at an additional fee. What's the point of offering tea without milk? I don't get it. The walls are also very thin and I can hear other guests.

title: Cosy and Convenient
desc: Most hotel rooms in Singapore are small - its just a fact of life. These rooms are also small so we opted for the Executive Balcony room. It had a little french window that opened onto a small balcony (with a view of the carpark across the road), but it was nice to have that spot and extra room to eat breakfast or have an afternoon drink as there really is no space in the room. However it did have everything we needed - a large bed, good bathroom facilities etc. Mind you it had the smallest minibar fridge I have ever seen! The small outdoor spa area was actually a nice spot for a dip after a long day of sightseeing and no one else seemed to be using it - we just trotted down the spiral fire escape stairs right to it. The reception was spotless - had some crazy artisan

title: Cosy
desc: The Scarlet is a hop, skip and jump from China Town. It's staff are very helpful and friendly and it's safe to walk around at night there as a female. It is a small basic boutique hotel. The rooms are very small, we booked an executive with a balcony. It is tastefully decorated but very basic. Ideal if you don't plan to be in your hotel room often and just need a place to sleep. Fabulous hard bed. Everything is tiny. They offer a 'left luggage ' service for when your flight leaves later and allow you to shower in the pool area. That is kind. I didn't use the pool. It is also small. It looks like a hot tub or spa. They have a gym but if you do as much walking as we did exploring Singapore, you may not need the gym! Breakfast in Singapore is not like a Western breakfast,

title: Awesome service!
desc: I had a staycation there awhile ago. The ambience of the hotel was fantastic. Once you arrived the hotel staff was already there to welcome you. At the counter I was greeted by a wonderful person, Ms Ebel Teo. She informed us about the hotel facilities and had given me a complimentary upgrade! After our wonderful conversation, I found out she was the Front office Manager! To see someone from the management team offering good service im pretty sure the rest of the team will follow suit her leadership qualities and standard of service. Well done Scarlett! Thank you Ebel!

title: A High Quality Boutique Hotel
desc: I've stayed here several time. It has improved over the year for the most part. My room was more than adequate and well maintained. . The staff was helpful. The location was good and only a short walk from the hotel to the nearest MTR station.The breakfasts were not as good as in the past, but acceptable.

title: Unique Boutique Hotel
desc: First time staying at this boutique hotel. Great location, situated in the middle historical heartland. With a convenience store 1 min away and plenty of local food nearby, we were spoilt with choices. The hotel looked rather small and confined (shophouses) from the outside but we were greeted with a pleasant surprise to a cosy and comfortable room! Even though it was close to the bustling city, there was barely any noise pollution and we slept through the night like a baby. It was an awesome weekend stay we are looking forward to come back! Thanks to Ms Ebel Teo for the excellent customer service and great hotel experience!

title: No Integrity
desc: Let me start off by saying that I have not visited the hotel. With that disclaimer, please continue to read my review and situation. I booked this hotel for 5 nights through Agoda for my Honeymoon which was planned in Singapore from Sept 6th - Sept 10th 2016. I sent them a note about it and was very excited to take my wife to SG since she has never been there. My wife is also 5 months pregnant and taking our Honeymoon in the city would have been convenient. A week prior to our honeymoon, there was a reported case of Zika. A week later, 250 cases which is considered an outbreak. Our doctor did not clear her medical status to travel to Singapore. I called Agoda customer service and they contacted the hotel numerous times and each time, the same answer was given...no

title: Premium room 123
desc: Booked a premium room at The Scarlet and was hoping to receive intimate and cozy room. Room looks elegant but comes without window hence feeling a little claustrophobic. Negative experience as we had fruit flies in the room and bathroom. Requested to change a room with windows but was told that all rooms are fully occupied,it was 2.30pm. This will be Our first and our last visit.

title: Good at the right price
desc: This is a hotel primarily targeted at coupes. It is well located in Chinatown and reasonably close to Downtown. Some of the rooms don't have windows - obviously the rooms which you may get at a bargain price. This is not necessarily a problem as long as you are aware of it. The bathrooms are clean. My shower head connection was leaking water to the side though. The hotel is quite fine if you know its shortcomings and if you get it at the right price.

title: Lovely botique hotel
desc: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were small but was manageable and we had a lovely balcony which overlooked the quaint shops. We had no problems with staff and they were very helpful. Gt location to china town and maxwell hawker centre . For locality and price we will definitely go back

title: Disappointing experience but great location
desc: having lived in singapore and I was back in town for a visit and didn't want to stay in one of the big fancy places. We decided on the scarlet hotel after a few recommendations but to say we were disappointed was an understatement. The lure of individually designed rooms doesn't apply to all and we had a very basic room that was quite small and certainly wasn't value for money. The location is amazing and did make up for the disappointing experience, however stay in one of the suites if you really want a different experience as you will get better value for money elsewhere

title: Tediously lacklustre
desc: First of all, The Scarlet Singapore is a hotel probably designed for couples and lovers to stay in, as evidenced from the strongly suggestive adult themes on display, from the rather sexily fashioned hotel lobby to the gym (suspended towel holders presented in the format of leather strap-ons) and the rooms themselves (full-sized mirror installed right beside the bed). Even the "do not disturb" door sign has captions printed along the lines: shush, we are being naughty right now. The check-in process was uninspiring to say the least. While the staff who attended to us was reasonably efficient, her unsmiling demeanor and outrageous mangling of the spoken English language made us half wondered if we just landed on Mars. Not to mention our ears hurt quite a bit after that from all

title: Nice hotel.
desc: Very nice boutique hotel within walking distance of Chinatown and metro. A series of shop houses has been turned into a hotel. Great service and reasonable price. Rooms are small and some only with small windows in ceiling. Roof garden and small pool.

title: Wonderful Boutique Hotel, Great Food Nearby...
desc: One nt, July 25. Let hotel know I'd be arriving ~08:00 and they responded quickly and kindly via e-mail that they'd do their best to accommodate my early arrival. At check-in was informed my accommodation would be ready at 10:00. Asked if I could upgrade to an available accommodation and agreed to pay SG$30 (about US$23). My room, 117, was quite literally 'down' the hall of interconnected former shophouses, mimicking the slope of the street, Erskine Road, Id just walked up! Room was lovely and though it had only indirect lighting from a skylight or two, I found it comforting rather than confining. Amenities all of high grade, plentiful tv channels in English and a rain shower head that should guiltily please anyone except a resource conservationist. Best of all are Maxwell

title: Very nice small boutique hotel in Chinese district
desc: First time to stay there. We arrived very early on a saturday morning (before 6am) so we got a temporary room against extra charge. The room was without window but we just wanted to sleep so no problem. We moved later to our balcony room. Very nicely decorated, the street is quiet and nice. Good balcony with small table and chairs. The only disadvantage is that the room was quite small so hard to fit our 2 large suitcases. Outdoor jacuzzi available on 1st floor. Night shift receptionist was not very quick. Except this, I definitely would go back. Quite some restaurants, street food and bars very close by (both local and Western). 15 min by car max to Marina Bay Sands complex.

title: Perfect staycay!
desc: I got the passion suite which was the perfect room for us! Their hospitality and service is great, breakfast was small but good quality and the jacuzzi was amazing. I couldnt think of a better place to spend my staycay in other than the scarlet!

title: Don't plan on any sleep
desc: It is 1.30 am in the morning and I still can't get to sleep because of all the shouting noise, I have registered my disappointment with the staff to no avail so I have my fingers crossed that the drunks surrender to the alcohol soon. I am not sure if the noise was emanating from the roof bar or not as I was on the ground floor in Room 111. It is fair to say I have rarely ever made any real disparaging reviews on any of the hotels I have visited and it is a shame because it is a magnificent little hidden gem of a hotel with absolutely brilliant staff who are only too willing to attend your needs which was evident this afternoon with last minute business from Australia which the desk helped me to successfully deliver. The room I booked was comfortable if not very small with lovely

title: Amazing!
desc: Location is great being next to Chinatown and food is plentiful. 2 metro stations within 5 minute walk. We can't praise the Scarlet Hotel enough. From check in Jenny was so accommodating allowing us a late check out. We booked the deluxe room. The room was small but sufficient for our stay. The bed was very comfortable and pillows were perfect. Our check out day we had issues with our airline and the staff at Scarlet were incredible. Allowing us to call Australia to try sort out the issue. Ronnie the door man was quick on the bags and after our dinner in town Eugene was once again there to help out. Scarlet Hotel looked after our bags all day and we could even shower after our day of adventure before our flight. I will be recommending Scarlet to everyone and we will definitely

title: Great Hotel, truly boutique
desc: Loved my stay at The Scarlet. Really well decorated, beds so comfortable and friendliest staff. So helpful-can't say enough for them. Neighbourhood was so handy to MRT and the choice of so many restaurants and bustle of Chinatown-I'm coming back!

title: Disgusted- my worst experience in Asia
desc: When you are charged top dollar to stay in a boutique hotel you expect a great experience. What I got for my $784.26 is anything but. I booked the Passion Suite for an anniversary surprise, being drawn by the outside space and hot tub on the balcony. What we hadn't been advised of was the major construction overlooking the balcony, which is not the fault of the hotel, but we should have been told about it. Instead there was a note next to the bed containing two sets of ear plugs. This should have set alarm bells off. First impressions were good, I was checking in with Jenny and was impressed by the decor and ambiance of the place. After finding the room, (with warps and tears in the much vaulted wallpaper) we headed to club street for lunch. So far so good. We came back to

title: Decent sized rooms and comfortable
desc: I visited here for business in late July/ early August 2016. I booked an executive room which was large and spacious. I enjoyed the stay- it is centrally located next to Chinatown and near a local food market and within easy walking distance to the financial district. Did not eat there but it has a roof top bar and restaurant next door. Would recommend you book a room with a window and not a skylight or with a balcony. I asked for a room with a window but they had no more available when I arrived, although my booking was last minute. Would stay again.

title: Scarlet boutique
desc: We stayed here for 2 nights and had a executive room with balcony and it was beautifully decorated.The staff were very helpful with information on local attractions ie hawker centre just around the corner and Chinatown only 5 minutes walk up the street. The MRT is only 10 minutes walk and that gets you everywhere in the city, we found the hotel ideally situated and loved the quirky decor in the reception and hallways and not your average city skyscraper. We didn't use the pool or the rooftop bar but they looked very inviting but Singapore has lots of wonderful sights and 2 days wasn't really long enogh to see everything. If we return to Singapore i would love to stay here again.

title: Zero Hospitality
desc: We stayed in Scarlet Hotel from 06th August - 10th August 2016 for 4 nights. Well, the hotel itself is a quite lovely place in a nice location. However, the service level is far behind other SLH properties. Positive points: 1) The design of the hotel is very charming. 2) Location of the hotel is perfect. Walking distance to China Town and subway station. 3) Excellent HK service, the room has been always nicely made when we return back to the room in the afternoon. 4) Public shower facilities and luggage storage service. Negative points: 1) Very badly trained reception staffs. No daily greetings from any of the hotel staffs through out the stay. Even when we first entered the hotel , the reception staff didn't even say welcome. No smiles can be seen from any of the

title: Lovely friendly and great service!
desc: On booking the hotel we did get a good deal at the time last minute on trip advisor but the hotel was wonderful, greeted in the hot weather with cool towels and fresh water, shown to our lovely clean room, and given maps and information on how to get around the area, fantastic! The hotel has its own little pool which we never saw another soul at and its a peaceful place in a busy city. Definitely recommend!

title: Great location, cute hotel
desc: Not much more to say about it, just a block away from a hawker stand and a few blocks further to public transportation. The staff were friendly, happy to hold onto our bags for a few hours, and always there if we had questions. We didn't take advantage of the roof bar because we were only there for a couple days, but it seemed cool.

title: A Boutique Delight
desc: Built into the shell of 1868 Shop Houses and a 1924 Art Deco corner-house, the Scarlet offers the jaded guest a quiet, serene, elegant refuge on entering the front door. Nothing is a problem to the staff at Reception. We stayed in a Executive Room with Balcony; a large room (for Singapore boutique hotels) with ensuite and balcony. All the basic requirements were met, including free Wi-Fi and a roof-top jacuzzi, and the large balcony, although its outlook was urban (a street and a multi-level car park) proved pleasant for evening sitting to enjoy the feel, sounds and aromas of the Tropics. ( The Casa Tartofu, their breakfast / dining room I have reviewed separately).

title: Charming hotel with great location
desc: The hotel is beautiful. The room is spacious that I was expected. We love staying in this hotel. Unique design and funny sign on your door. We were allowed to take their red back scratcher without additional cost - we asked first, of course. Thank you! The location is walking distance to China Town and as well to the metro subway stops. There are plenty of good restaurants and bars in the neighbourhood. We will certainly stay here again when visiting Singapore.

title: Great location, close to local delicacies
desc: Stayed here for a night during a short trip to Singapore. Hotel is well positioned close to Chinatown and Tanjong Pagar business district. Maxwell food court is also 2-mins walk and so is the HK noodle which recently won a michelin star in Chinatown (about 5-mins walk from hotel). Room is definitely on the small side. Our room #308 was located the furthest away in the hotel building and getting there took forever, plus the staircase. I wished they had given me a room closer to reception. Check in process was not the fastest but we got there. Overall, stay here for the location. Will i be back? Not sure.

title: elegance with style
desc: Scarlet Hotel is a beautiful hotel with attention paid to details with the use of bold colors in structures; that make the entire place stylish and appeals visually. Prime location with many restaurants nearby too!

title: Good location, bad mini-bar, inflexible
desc: I booked directly with the hotel versus saving $30/night by booking via Trip Advisor’s partner, thanks to a persuasive sales agent while confirming my reservation. I have enjoyed similar perks in Hanoi, but this hotel’s mini-bar was bare (pictured). I assumed it had simply not been restocked until I found the “menu". If you ate and drank everything it would run $21. I felt duped and gullible, and certainly won’t return. One friend called this the “mini-bar scam”, so I’m obviously naive. The mini-fridge was not even cold, barely “cool”, with no ability to adjust the temperature for chilled drinks. Also, I was forced to arrive a day late due to an aircraft failure in San Francisco, and contacted the hotel immediately. For a boutique hotel I was surprised at the inflexibility to

title: Amazing little hotel in Chinatown
desc: Small quaint hotel in a great location - near the bars on Club Street and Ann Siang Hill, and about 10 minutes walk into the CBD. The room was small but very comfortable and luxurious. Pity no bathtub though. Will stay here again for sure!

title: Good Hotel just rooms a little Small
desc: Location is a 7 to 8 minute walk from 3 different subway lines giving access to most of Singapore. Only one street away from Club Street with lots of bars and restaurants which is popular at night yet far enough away not to cause a noise problem. A 7 Eleven on near corner and Maxwell Hawkers very close for a cheap meal including Tian Tian Chicken which always has a long queue and made famous by celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain. Scarlett staff are friendly and helpful greeting you each time you come home or walk past in the aisle. The hotel is in a set of restored buildings and makes an interesting place to stay. The decor is also over the top eye catching in a fun way. I would happily stay again for a short stay no more than 3 nights unless they had a larger room. Staff makes

title: Quaint, Historic, and Trendy
desc: From the website, the persona of this hotel is a seductress. The playful marketing caught my partner I guess, so she chose a staycay for my birthday at The Scarlet. A lovingly restored grand old dame, the building has been carefully restored, and turned into a decadent boutique hotel. I have walked past this hotel many times, dined at the Case De Truffe once or twice, but this was my first time staying. Old world charm, with playful twists becoming of a boutique hotel greet you. The staff are friendly, and wear interesting velvety robed uniforms. The lobby isn’t grand, it’s intimate. Gilded ornaments, marble floors, and luxurious furniture. The rooms are comfortable and modern, but can be quite small, as old buildings will have it. One of two downsides to room 308 is that

title: Fantastic Location - perfect boutique hotel
desc: Converted old chinese house in super central location. Rooms are very small but well decorated. Excellent service. Guest showers located for guest with late flights to Europe and hotel was very accommodating with a late checkout for a minimal charge. Would gladly stay here again as a stopover hotel when next in Singapore

title: Fabulous boutique hotel
desc: Loved my stay at The Scarlett. Fabulous hotel with a funky ambience. Great location near Chinatown and next door to the Maxwell markets. Enjoyed the rooftop bar, Aria. All Staff were pleasant and helpful. My bed and pillows were super comfy. Loved the decor of this hotel. Will definitely stay again.

title: Quite satisfying experience
desc: Booked through SLH which was giving you quite a few benefits in this hotel. The location is good and I can even work to the CBD i.e. Asia Square , Capita Green and etc.The room was alright compared to the room rate you were paying and staff were generally friendly. Overall not too bad. The downsides about this hotel are : 1) Breakfast is just too simple 2) GYM is too small 3) Housekeeping is not great

title: Was discounted 50%, I can see why
desc: Booked for a business trip as it was cheaper than where I normally stay, I thought this place was for couples etc. If I had taken my wife there and paid full price I would have been terribly disappointed. On check-in I was told with great fanfare I had been upgraded to a premium room and that everything in the mini-bar was free. On entry to the room the mini-bar had two cans of coke and two orange juices in it. The room was fairly plain, the bath wasn't big enough for one person let alone a couple! The shower head was hanging off the wall and the bed sheets were thread bare on one side with a view directly to the mattress. Its in a great location and quiet, but not at all what I was expecting. If paying full prie its certainly well overpriced

title: Great location but room could use improvement
desc: The Scarlet is in a great location with lots of interesting places within easy walking distance. However, the room I was in had no window. The hotel did not mention this to me and it was an unpleasant surprise. I believe there are rooms with windows so be careful if you book and ask for second floor or above. Luckily I kept claustrophobia at bay by being out a lot. The room was clean but the bed was pretty uncomfortable. The staff were a mix of pleasant and strangely opinionated. When I left the hotel I had luggage and it was raining. The concierge questioned why I needed him to call a cab for me. Not the most hospitable experience I have ever had.

title: Good location
desc: The hotel is designed really nice, the staff are friendly and helpful, my only problem was if I was staying more that a couple of nights, I would have wanted a window as our room didn't have one. As I was only stopping a night this wasn't a problem.

title: Nice hotel
desc: The location is perfect , very centrally located in Singapore , out , but just across chinatown Rooms small like all hotels in Singapore , but all needed is there Very friendly and helpfull staff Did not try out breakfast , but 50meters a perfect streetfood market available

title: Great location, tiny rooms
desc: Great location, but room very average. We booked a deluxe room which turned out to have no window (resembling a prison cell) and was extremely small. We asked to move and were told this would be an additional $200 to upgrade which we were going to pay until we were shown another room only marginally bigger which smelt of vomit. Disappointing as we expected much higher standards given other reviews. Terrible service. Even though restaurant not busy, no tables being cleared at breakfast and we had to find cutlery etc from other tables.

title: Cute boutique hotel with small (ish) rooms in a great location
desc: The location of this hotel could not have been better for me. Right in the middle of Chinatown, literally right next to the Maxwell Hawker Center and a few minutes walk from Smith street or the Tube. The deluxe rooms are a little small, but very nicely appointed. The rest of the hotel is very boutique and quite charming, and the staff could not have been more helpful. The only negative is that the trucks delivering supplies to the food center in the morning make quite a bit of noise, which the hotel acknowledges and supplies you with ear plugs. With that being said, I would definitely stay there again!

title: Great room, beautiful hotel, service needs to go from good to great.
desc: I've stayed with Scarlet several times before. As usual I love the style, boutique nature and charm of the hotel. Of course, rooms and facilities are as high quality as any of the larger chain hotels. Having stayed a few times, though I've no complaint with the service, both front of house and in particular the restaurant [I only had breakfast] are missing that top notch personal feel to the service which makes all the difference and is so much easier to achieve in a smaller boutique over the large chain hotels.

title: Couple's Hotel
desc: Arrived at Singapore for an early business meeting and checked-in this hotel after (recommended by a friend) to spend the rest of the day and stay overnight. It is situated in a quiet area near Chinatown. By the name alone you can sense this place is unique and it is. Since we are traveling as a couple, we became excited upon arrival. Check-in was a breeze and we were even given a room upgrade. The ambiance of the lobby gave a sexy atmosphere. It heightened when we came into the room. The Scarlet is ideal for a couple's stay. The feeling of a honeymoon again. The size of the room is adequate complete with the amenities. The mirror on the wall beside the bed is tops! Nice bathroom, office desk at the corner, the bed & pillows as well as the lighting. Chinatown is a near

title: Very nice and quaint
desc: I highly recommend this hotel specially to couples or people by themselves staying for a short time, is in a awesome area in Chinatown right next door to one of the most famous hawker centres in Singapore. The MRT station is a 5 minute walk which will get you anywhere you need to go but taxis are cheap over there anyway. I can guarantee you won't be disappointed for the price you pay every single member of staff I met were very kind and welcoming. The only thing that is probably a negative is the rooms are quite small(I stayed in the cheapest room which might explain it) but there is so much to do in Singapore you will only be in your room to sleep and shower. I will definitely stay here again when I go back.

title: Great hotel & great people
desc: I had a wonderful time at the Scarlet, no complaints. Great costumer service, and a nice hotel room. Small hotel, which I like, and it felt very comfortable. Didn't do much other than stay in the room while at the hotel , so not sure how breakfast is, but I imagine it to be good. It's location was perfect, walking distance to Maxwell food court and China Town.

title: Boudoir chic!
desc: Room: The room itself was clean and comfortable, though not very spacious. The overall decor was appealing and the scarlet colour scheme stood out against the backdrop of the colonial-style building. Location: Within walking distance to nearby restaurants and shops. It was conveniently located in Chinatown, which meant frequent trips to delicious noodle soup shacks! Amenities: Included all your basics, i.e. soap, shampoo, etc.

title: Very thoughtful staff
desc: We are addicted to the pampering. Warm friendly smiles from the moment you arrive at the hotel to the moment you leave. Certainly our fondest memory in Singapore. Thank you so much Jenny.Smooth check-in process at the front desk makes me wish every hotel I go to was just as expedient. Our stay was superb! Not only did the staff gave us a room upgrade to a Executive Balcony, but they also gave us a Wedding Anniversary Card! Two sweets with anniversary greetings on it. It really touched our hearts. Once again, thank you jenny.

title: very cool
desc: The Scarlett was recommended to us by friends and it was fantastic, located in the middle of chinatown, the rooms are small but who goes to Singapore for the rooms? The staff were great and very proud of what the hotel use to be and what it has been transformed into

title: 72 hours in Singapore
desc: What a find! So lucky that we booked to stay at the Scarlett. Arrived very early and they got us into our room early. Very helpful and friendly staff great location next to China Town and the shophouses. Our room had a balcony which was absolutely lovely to sit out on after a walk or a night out. Very clean and safe. Great stay. Big thank you to all that work there.

title: What a fabulous hotel
desc: We stayed at fabulous The Scarlet Hotel in Erskine Road Singapore recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. This hotel used to be a row of single story shops going up Erskine Road and when you walk along the corridor you walk down or up the incline of the road from or to the fabulous lobby. Our room was stunning. The interiors are decorated with an Art Deco feel and use very sexy colours & textures. The reception and conceits staff were amazing too. Just wish the rooftop bar was open to enjoy the night lights.

title: Average hotel but good location
desc: The highlight of this hotel is the location because its in the middle of chinatown, very close to the metro. The hotel is nice, quite eccentrinc but interesting. The rooms are very small, but for the price I think its Ok, and something normal in Singapore. It was clean and had a nice balcony, the bathroom was of a decent size if we take into account how small the room was. Service was correct, the girls in the front desk were quite nice. Not sure if I would stay again, for a little bit more money you can stay in a place like Parkroyal, but I know some people prefer boutique hotels over the big ones.

title: cozy hotel in Chinatown
desc: This hotel isn't big but very cozy to stay. As I like to spend time in a historical building, this hotel suited my preference. My room was clean, comfortable, had a terrace. Staffs were very helpful.

title: Great stay in a very unique hotel!
desc: We stayed for one night at the Scarlet hotel and we enjoyed our stay very much: - great welcoming experience at check-in - the hotel looks fantastic and is far from the cold "corporate" hotels we see too much. The hotel has personality and character! - great looking room and ours came with the added bonus of a terrace with a view on the tooth relic temple.

title: Fantastic
desc: We stayed for 4 nights on a Singapore stopover in one of the suites on a package deal which involved pickup from the airport, breakfast, wifi etc etc. Pricey but what inn Singapore isn't? The room was fantastic ("quirky kitch chic" I would describe it as), perfect location in Chinatown - walking distance to a wide range of entertainment, food and drink options in all price ranges. Staff very helpful and every part of our stay was seamless. Really enjoyed the hotel, and would stay again, no questions. Avoid the big chains - stay here :)

title: Excellent service great location
desc: This hotel is right in the heart of China town near to the tooth relic temple. Fantastic location close to the metro, this was a very reasonably priced hotel compared to other in Singapore. A really cool boutique hotel. I highly recommend!!!

title: A little cute and chic hotel.
desc: Booked 2 rooms at this hotel. Upon check in the receptionist were very friendly and made us feel welcome. They handed us some cold towel and it was quite refreshing after coming from a hot day out. Me and my husband had one room and my mother in law were a few doors down. When you first walk in, you will this hotel a little 1920s and with a bit of a feminine touch. As we walked down the hallway to our rooms, it was quite dark and pink. We only stayed one night. There were a few things that I find it adorable at the Scarlett Hotel is that the bathrobes really fits me. It's not one of those long, heavy oversize towel like bathrobes. I really like that they had a complimentary bottle of Aranciata Rossa which is perfect for a really hot day in Singapore. The only weird thing was

title: Great location, friendly staff and good facilities
desc: We recommended a stay at The Scarlet and we're so glad we stayed there. A really funky boutique hotel, the design is fantastic from the big chairs in reception to the rooms themselves. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and let us check in early and cooled us down with towels and water when we arrived rather hot and sweaty. Make sure you visit the hawker food court which is over the road from the hotel and Chinatown which is only a 5 minute walk. The location is great and we loved walking around the nearby roads including Club Street (also great for a meal). We stayed in a standard room, which was a little on the small side, but perfectly fine for us as a couple. The rooms are exceptionally clean, quiet (we didn't hear a peep out of anyone else) with good

title: Excellent staff,location and other amenities
desc: On arrival we were greeted with warm smiles,cool towels and cold water and told to relax while Jenny went about upgrading us!! We were pampered for the full 5 days of our stay and were a bit reluctant to leave and continue our trip to Oz. We' ll be back!!

title: Fun, funky, eclectic property with fantastic staff
desc: We stayed with our adult sons for their first Singapore visit, hoping to give them an authentic experience. The concept, location, service and value the Scarlet provides is excellent. The rooms are small, but the common areas are spacious and the location means you spend a great deal of time out and about. Perfect for those looking for something different and fun. The staff are extremely helpful and welcoming. We absolutely loved everything about it.

title: A 1 night stand...
desc: Firstly the location is great. Club street is just around the corner, which is great. The staff are really courteous and helpful. But... it's not a hotel I'd go back to again. Rooms are very cramped and feel dingy/dark. There wasn't sufficient place to put a carry on suitcase and an ironing board. Literally! You have nice fancy curtains which open up to a wall. Yes wall. NO WINDOWS! And there is no room service (or rather only until a particular time). I wasn't very impressed with the hotel. Could get better hotels for the same budget. Sadly it is the one night stand that you wake up to saying what am I doing here!

title: Business stay in scarlet
desc: Nice hotel in China town. It's not a 5 star so comparison to the high end of town is unfair. The rates reflect a good value stay. I was on business so wifi was more important than a pool-it doesn't have one. It's clean, comfortable and safe. Staff are lovely and try hard. Close to club street and China town. I would stay again at that price. Thanks

title: Funky decor
desc: Great decor and wonderful staff. We knew the rooms were going to be small but had trouble fitting our luggage in our balcony room (we stayed 2 nights and then were cruising back to Perth). At check out, an employee advised us we should have mentioned we had extra luggage and they would have moved us to a bigger room (even though they took our luggage up at check in!). One of the main reasons we picked this hotel was for the roof top bar; unfortunately it was closed and they were renovating it. The construction noise started early and ended late into the night! There was also a bit of street noise from the odd drunken person returning from the bars further up. We are heading back to Singapore shortly for another trip but will probably stay elsewhere which is a pity as this

title: Excellent hotel Great position Friendly staff
desc: Came in late at night after hotel I had booked did not have my booking. Staff attended to me very quickly and attentively. By this time arrived I was a bit grumpy. had travelled all day hotel cancelled and got in after 1 am. Staff made me welcome and gave me a fantastic room.

title: Small rooms -big noise
desc: Stayed here for a couple of nights on way to NZ. The room was very cramped and hardly any space left after our luggage deposited. We were low down the hill and the noise from the building works and the refuse moving at 5.00am was very loud. Strange glass door to bathroom and frosted glass therein meant early light into the room. Breakfast was very basic and poorly laid out in the non too cosy evening restaurant. Rooftop bar is OK with nice seating but not very inspiring views. Chinatown is close by which is a plus but in hindsight we should have chosen somewhere closer to the river. Staff were very pleasant and friendly but overall disappointing. .

title: Worst Hotel I've visited.
desc: From the moment as check in this hotel dropped points. Served by Jenny who quite possibly had the biggest chip on her shoulder! We arrived early so was not able to check in till 2pm. We wondered off for lunch. Came back 15 mins before 2pm was advised again was not able to check in. I asked for the Wifi password so we could browse the net for the 15mins, was told I could not have it as I was not checked in yet!! The room was clean and tidy- very small. we were given a room opposite a nightclub- worst 2 nights sleep. Asked if the hotel was full, it wasn't why were we given this room to start with then!?!? The breakfast was terrible- wasn't sure if it was porridge or scrambled egg, choice was poor. It ruined the last part of our honeymoon, would not recommend.

title: Good Layover Stay in Singapore
desc: I chose the Scarlet Singapore because I wanted be near Chinatown, and it's around the bend from Maxwell hawkers market. And my flight from the US lands at midnight, I figured that'd be the area where I can find some eateries that are still open for sure. The hotel is consists of a series of row houses that had been restored, it's interesting layout because I entered the hotel at one end of the street, yet my room was at the opposite end, so there was a long long walk each time I was in and out of the hotel. The reception was pleasant, breakfast was ok. The room is small but neat and clean. My room had a window near the ceiling, so it's really not a real window. If that's not your cup of tea, don't stay there. I would stay here again because I like the location.

title: 1 Month Business Trip Stay
desc: I stayed at the Scarlet hotel for five weeks on a business trip. My overall stay was very good. The hotel staff was amazing. Location was the best. Food was decent. Hotel Staff: The hotel staff was amazing. Their service was top quality. I have not had a bad experience with a single staff member during my 5 week stay. They will provide you with everything you need- from area information, transportation, and additional amenities. Their front desk staff is available 24/7. I've dealt with Gobi (front desk manager) many times and he's been exceptional. Location: This boutique hotel is located right across the street from the famous Maxwell Food Centre; where Tian Tian Haiwanese Chicken is located. It is about a 7 minute walk to Chinatown and about 9 minutes to the Chinatown MRT

title: Really? A "luxury" hotel with rooms that have no windows?
desc: Man, I am so disappointed and I was warned by my colleagues who have stayed at this hotel! They told me the hotel is great location (true); wonderful staff (very true); charming (somewhat), small rooms (no exaggeration) AND there are a lot of very, very bad rooms and to avoid at all cost. So what did I do? I booked a Deluxe (second highest category) room and specifically contacted the hotel beforehand that I would not get stuck in an 'interior' room - shocking that these would even be offered. I was assured I'd get a good room and I looked forward to my stay especially as the rate was good. Check in around 1500 was chaotic. People sitting all over the lobby waiting for something. Staff were a bit flustered but I got a room within 10 minutes on the first floor. I go to the

title: A fine Treat
desc: This hotel is centrally placed with easy access to chinatown /foodtown/Club St etc The hotel staff are EXCELLENT,nothing was ever too much trouble...//.My daughter & I stayed on the 2nd floor in a double balconey room,which whilst not large was fine for our 7 night visit,hotel itself has character with a bar and restaurant on 1st floor & roof top bar..decore is interesting, goes with the Heritage bldg,and fun to boot...ticks all the boxes...Thankyou

title: Quality boutique hotel
desc: A really good choice if you're looking for something quality and a little different. The quirky decor is cool, the room faculties are excellent and the staff are really friendly and helpful. The reception staff let us shower after having checked out and returned to collect bags en route to the airport. The outdoor spa pool isn't great (distinct lack of bubbles) but the upstairs bar is chilled with good views (if very expensive, but then that's alcohol in Singapore).

title: Great for a short stop over
desc: Lovely place that suited well for 2 night stop over. Staff helpful and sorted out showers before and after check in. Convenient for China town and transport to all areas. Nice roof terrace. Maxwell Rd hawkers market good for breakfast rather than at hotel.

title: Beautiful decorated hotel in Chinatown
desc: This was our first time in Singapore and we stayed in the scarlet for 3 nights. The hotel looks really small from the outside but its bigger than it looks. Our room was small but cosy, the bed was small for a queen size but that didn't damper my thoughts on the room itself. There's not much light in the room as there is a small window above the room which you can't open. There is a wooden bed frame which occasionally knocked legs and knee on which was great and quite dangerous. Other than that everything else was great, bathroom was a decent size where bathrobes, slippers and bath accessories were provided. There is a safety deposit box which is great to put any important documents, money etc. There is free water provided daily when your room is cleaned. The hotel is in a great

title: Great Location
desc: We stayed at the Scarlet for two nights. Beds are comfortable as are the pillows, rooms are small but if you have decided to stay here you would already be aware of this. The fact that you have a set of earplugs on the bedside table stapled to a greeting card made us chuckle. Bathroom amenities good, cleaning of the room was top notch. Noise factor wasn't too bad and we stayed on a Thursday, Friday and the street was closed off for party night on Friday and it was also Labour Day long weekend. We did ask to move rooms after the first night as the lantern across the road shone into the room disturbing sleep. This was done promptly and we moved up a floor. We enjoyed our stay, do your research if you want something different in a good location try the Scarlet. If you want no

title: Elegant room but erratic front desk service
desc: Very conveniently located in the middle of Chinatown, the Scarlet is a beautifully refurbished traditional building. The room was chic and elegant , with a partition that separated the writing desk/ mini bar from the sleeping area, creating more space. The one downside was that the only window in the room did not open. The rooftop bar is worth visiting for the sweeping view of Chinatown and the glittering skyline nearby . There are numerous trendy bars and restaurants in the neighborhood as well as reasonably priced local eateries. This hotel did not score perfectly on my rating due to the seemingly indifferent reception encountered upon check in and a subsequent inquiry. The experience at check out was extremely courteous and professional, but unfortunately first impressions

title: Fantastic boutique hotel in heart of Chinatown.
desc: Beautiful stylish boutique hotel. Boasts great location in Chinatown next door to Hawkers market and day, night market. Room was spacious and light despite no windows. Fantastic staff, complimentary mini bar in our room. lots of little extras including bathrobes, slippers, bath accessories and gift on checking out. This hotel is true luxury and definitely a more memorable stay than those afforded by the big name chains.

title: My toddler had a great time here...
desc: Stayed over with my child on the skylight room...it was the most amazing experience...the incoming light definitely brightened the room. The room was what I expected thanks to other reviews in this site. This boutique hotel is a convenient location. I could just walk & bring my active toddler the the Hindu & Chinese temples nearby... The staff were simply amazing & could entertain my restless son..this is one of the hotels I'll definitely come back to. Thanks guys :)

title: Well located boutique hotel
desc: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here and have made the decision to base ourselves from the area in future when visiting. Close to nightlife, hawker markets and the MRT you can't really beat the location. The room was pretty cute and from reading past reviews we were prepared for the no window situation - it is a slightly odd feeling to stay in a room with no windows. It did make the room very quiet which is always a plus. The breakfast looked as though it needs a bit of a revamp, we thought about staying in one morning and checking it out but after looking at the buffet didn't think it warranted the $26++ price tag. I would have loved to see some interesting a la carte options. Overall a good value for money hotel that delivers something a bit different to the

title: Professionalism
desc: We wish to thank you for your kindness...even though we find everybody kind and helpful, we wish to thank Jenny from the reception David maître d'hotel Arun and Ryan from the restaurant You made our stay very pleasant and perfect Isabelle & Christian

title: great location for foodies
desc: Windowless rooms are not for the claustrophobic - but the location and pleasant staff make up for this. A boutique hotel made up of a number of neighbouring shops creates a rabbit warren of rooms - the only daylight in our room provided by a shared skylight. Hotel is some distance from train, with unwieldy luggage a challenge. A new station is being built within a stone throw which will make this hotel very accessible. Hawker food everywhere - Chinatown next door.

title: Don't be Fooled by the Faux Moulin Rouge Look - this is excellent!
desc: I use the Scarlet every time I have to travel on business to Singapore, and the location in Chinatown is v. convenient for the business area. Plus, one has the benefit of brilliant historical ambience plus outdoor dining and some brilliant cafes and art galleries (if one has the time). Frankly, I stash my stuck up arrogant (American) clients in the Fullerton and flee to the Scarlet to enjoy the outdoor dining at Breeze and the brilliant Italian cuisine below, not to mention all the Malaysian, Singaporean and Indonesian cafeteria style shops in the neighborhood. The rooms are not large but they do have very thoughtful touches. The service is polished and more importantly, the staff remembers you - an amazing feat given the turnover in the industry in general. Recommended for

title: Always nice
desc: Nice hotel to stay in close to China town. Cozy and excellent hotel service. The restaurant is amazing. Try it..... Close your eyes and you feel in europe!! Beware that taxis don't really know where it is. Just say Ann Singh Hill Love the red theme in the reception area of the hotel Those lobby chairs are mine !!!

title: Great location excellent service
desc: Just spent 5 nights at the scarlet and loved it. The room was great didn't have a window which would have been good but still cozy and decent sized. The staff was very attentive and helpful in getting cabs. There are tons of bars, restaurants, and rooftops within walking distance. On Friday and Saturdays Ann Siang Hill St and club street one street over from the hotel are closed down and filled with tons of outdoor seating for the bars and restaurants which made for a really fun atmosphere. Only a few feet from maxwell hawker center and everything in Chinatown. Nice touch was having plenty of free bottles of water for guests which is great In the heat. Only complaint was breakfast over priced and not that great.

title: small , noisy, unhelpful
desc: small hotel , with incredible small rooms for really high prices, advertising as a queen size bed, the bed is hardly double , room is by the busy street, wifi need to be re log each time you go out, charging $50 per day deposit, spoken with receptionist about my concerns, bed , noise , wifi, he was less than helpful, regretting spending my money here, I should read reviews about the hotel

title: Outstanding!
desc: I was a bit reluctant to book this hotel based on some of the reviews - small, no windows, twin beds, etc. However I took a chance and loved it. The decor was very hip and cool while the staff was so friendly and helpful. Ronnie at the door was especially great with my bags and advice. I arrived on an overnight flight and they allowed me to check into my room at 9:30am. This allowed me to shower before hitting the city for sightseeing. The room was very nice and clean although a bit snug. I had a window with a decent view and a large queen bed. The location is just a block from the Tooth Relic Temple and Chinatown while a block from Club Street for great food and drinks. Overall an excellent choice for a weekend in Singapore.

title: Cosy Romantic Hotel!
desc: Very cosy and homely boutique hotel! Love the concept and all the furniture in the hotel. Everything in the hotel looks grand and posh, and we felt like we're royals in it. Also, the rooms and slightly dimmed corridors make it so homely and cosy. It really felt like we're at home once we step into the hotel.

title: Excellent!
desc: We arrived at the hotel at 7 in the morning and were warmly greeted by reception staff who had no hesitation in allowing us to check in so early. We had a "windowless" room, but it was so spacious it didn't matter. Delicious food served in the rooftop restaurant. The staff were friendly, polite and extremely helpful. We highly recommend the Scarlet Hotel.

title: Sweet boutique hotel
desc: Nice boutique hotel located in Chinatown in Singapore. Simple but cozy. Friendly personnel. Great location in the middle of Chinatown, surrounded by restaurants and bars. Walking area in some streets during the weekend.

title: Colourful Friendly Hotel
desc: The name of the hotel reveals its design style with vivid pinks & reds dominating in the décor. It was a bit over powering at first but does fit in with the hotel style. There is a long corridor to get to your room as the hotel is the first floor of the building with shops all along the ground floor. The room was a bit cramped with no much room around the bed. It was comfortable with a good sized bed and a reasonable bathroom. Beware of the bed legs though as these are made of very solid hardwood which is unforgiving on feet. The hotel is well placed for the centre of the city with its location near to Chinatown. There was considerable building work nearby however so going in some directions involved taking detours. There is a pleasant Italian based restaurant on site called

title: good location
desc: The hotel was very clean, and well situated. It is close to Chinatown, the Maxwell food centre, Singapore city gallery- Urban redevelopement authority(free admission 2nd floor), and within walking distance of the business district.

title: Try the truffle chips - they certainly are different!
desc: We stayed in an executive room for one night on the way to Auckland. The beds were comfy and everything was very clean. We ate in the restaurant (Cafe Tortufa) and were impressed by the truffle chips - tasty and very different! The atmosphere was good and very relaxed. Being on the edge of Chinatown the hotel is good for sightseeing, although it is easy to get lost in the mass of streets, with their building works, especially when you try to venture a bit further. The local hop-on, hop-off tourist bus is only a few minutes walk away and well worth it, especially if you are only in Singapore for a short time. Only one little niggle - our bathroom, with its frosted glass door was directly opposite the bed and, with the toilet positioned right by the door, offered only limited

title: Boutique hotel with charming, smallish rooms but overlooking a dirty alley
desc: Service and staff were excellent, very responsive and efficient. Rooms were small but charming. Location is in Chinatown, close to restaurants. Only downside is that they rooms without windows or upon request, will upgrade you to their rooms facing the a dirty back alley. Carpeting could use a refresh, looks worn out after ten years of service.

title: Cozy and nearby chinatown
desc: We were her for 3 nights. Very nice and clean hotel. Our room was very small, but it doesn't matter, because its so lovely and very cozy !! The staff is so friendly and helpful !! One day we had dinner at our room, very nice meal and it came very quickly 😊. We will be back again !!

title: Relaxed boutique hotel
desc: This charming hotel is located in a quite part of town, but with easy access to the financial district and all main attractions. Close by you can also places to have a drink or grab a bite. Staff is friendly.

title: Nice
desc: Very nice petit hotel. Good location. There are manny bars and retaurants nearby for young people to enjoy! It has a rooftop bar and the food of the restaurant is pretty good. We had breakfast included. The price of the hotel is very cheap compared to what it offers. Definitely a good choice.

title: Nice getaway at a great location
desc: Location is really great if you'd like to be in Chinatown and have club street literally around the corner! The hotel itself is nice, friendly staff and good rooms. I loved having a small balcony and the decoration of the rooms is very interesting!

title: Not for you if you like natural light
desc: Word of caution: none of the standard rooms and apparently the "Deluxe" room the pleasant receptionist told me they had upgraded me into, have windows. There is a single 18"x30" frosted glass skylight. No sky visible - feels a bit like a posh renovated basement suite.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel
desc: The Hotel looks very nice and is located in a small hill from where you can get to Chinatown or Club Street just by walking a few minutes. Rooms are basic, but include everything you need, are spacious enough and confortable. I was initially a little bit annoyed by the fact I didn't have a window but just a roof panel for daylight to enter, after a couple of nights I got used to it without issues. The breakfast is basic, it is served in the Hotel's restaurant which at nights is a very nice Italian restaurant.

title: Wonderful staycation
desc: Check in was fuss free, and reception staffs were polite and pleasant. We had received a complimentary upgrade to Executive from Deluxe for our anniversary. A signed greeting card and 2 bottles of Stickys candies was given to us too. It was very thoughtful of the hotel. It was a long walk through the entire red walkway of rooms to lift B where it led to our room at 239. The doors were in a jade green color, and I thought they were a good blend with the scarlet hallway. Exudes a kind of British english style. It was a little confusing, there were two lift lobbies (A & B), we ventured around but couldn't find the jacuzzi pool and had to ask the reception. I thought it will be easier for the guests if you could plainly indicate jacuzzi pool on the signage boards instead of another

title: Very good mid-range hotel option.
desc: Great value and location. Good service, fast wifi, good breakfast. The rooms are very small but for a business traveler this is a great lower cost option. Quiet and comfortable (bed are firm, Asian style). Was easy to get an Uber or taxi to/from. Overall a nice boutique option.

title: Quirky hotel
desc: Stylish reception area but slightly unhelpful receptionist when we arrived. Strange smell to GF corridors was rather off-putting. Our room was classified as Deluxe but was rather small, especially when trying to find room for 2 large cases. Luckily the interior design is good, as the view from our window was not. 2 bottles of complimentary water was nice and there was a kettle with tea and coffee. No milk though. The en-suite needed some maintenance. Breakfast was a little disappointing as the cereal was stale but there was yoghurt and melons; cold meats and cheese; tepid bacon, scrambled egg and tomatoes. Smoked salmon occasionally. Lovely rooftop bar. Good position for Chinatown or the buzzing Club Street bars and cafes. Close to MRT and buses. 10 min walk to the marina. All

title: Very enjoyable
desc: We had a deluxe room. It was small but big enough. The location of the hotel is great- nice and close to restaurants and Chinatown. We used the MRT daily and that is a 5 minute walk to the station. Our room was clean and neat. Our only complaint was that the bed was hard as a rock. We had a room rate which initially included breakfast, but we opted out of this. It was a savings of $52 per night. We tried the hotel's breakfast one morning. It was cold and very underwhelming and not worth $26 per person. You can go into Chinatown and have breakfast for about $10 per person. It won't be a buffet, but it will be warm.

title: Nice hotel
desc: The hotel is good and you can spend there without any troubles. The staff is smiling and friendly. Be careful with the food from the near restaurants and better visit the hotel outlets only. Good for families,

title: Great services good hotel
desc: I book a 1-night stay at The Scarlet hotel on 5th-6th of march as a surprise staycation for my girlfriend. As it is to celebrate her birthday i had special request to have the bed with rose petals. One of the front desk staff Fareena was kind enough to help me with the request. She even went well above her duties by coming early to work the day i was supposed to check in to help decorate the room. At night she send up complimentary wine for me and my girlfriend to enjoy the night. Scarlet hotel is very fortunate to have such a wonderful staff that would go above and beyond to make sure the customer enjoyed the stay there. At the very least i certainly did. Thank you Fareena and job well done. Other scarlet staffs were also very warm and friendly. I really enjoyed my stay there.

title: Great Experience
desc: For my business trip did not want an ordinary business class hotel and settled with a reservation at the Scarlet. Very glad with my extraordinary experience, Loved the houses and whole street. Great breakfast, well you get what you pay for.. As not being after a free drop of milk I was extremely pleased with the staff and service in general. Thanks guys!

title: Wonderful hotel
desc: Six of us stayed in this hotel during Chinese New Year. It used to be a row of historic shop houses & is right beside Chinatown &'the Maxwell Hawker food center. We loved it. The staff is so polite, welcoming and accommodating. As it was very hot they gave us cold water when we went out & were so polite & helpful from the desk people to the bellboys. The room was clean & had such comfortable beds & new fresh linens. I loved the decor in the lobby & adjoining sitting area. It is unique & different from the usual hotels we stay in. Also,it is so close to other places. We walked to the boat quay although it was quite hot to do such a long walk. Really glad we chose this place for our Singapore stay & would certainly stay again!

title: Nice hotel, shame about the decor
desc: Personally I hated the dingy red corridors, but then taste is personal. Really helpful staff, except when I was told if I wanted a drop of milk to make tea I would be charged! If you want to please British guests don't expect them to make tea with Coffeemate! Breakfast ain't too hot (literally) But very well placed for Chinatown, buses, taxis etc. If you want to be out from the hustle give it a try. Rooms ok. We had 2 in 2 different stays on stopovers. One was tiny but both well serviced and clean.

title: Slightly naughty boutique hotel near Chinatown
desc: Boutique hotel a stone's throw from Chinatown and one the big hawker centres, and yet in a quiet location. Slightly naughty feel to the place, with all the plush red decor and suggestive Do Not Disturb signs. Comfortable rooms, no road noise (we were facing the rear of the hotel. We didn't get to use it, but there's an open air hot tub, with shower and changing room which you can also use if you have a late flight out of Singapore. The rooftop bar is almost mediterranean with chill out music, good menu, nibbles, cocktails etc. A couple of streets behind, Club Street is full of restaurants and bars, including a nice Italian and a French bistro for those hankering after European food. Metro is maybe 10 minutes away, the other side of Chinatown, or there are buses on the adjoining

title: Good base to explore
desc: In the centre of Chinatown with access to the MRT and taxi hire. Stayed over Chinese New Year so obvious choice but easy to explore the attractions and taxi fares were cheap so Singapore Zoo for example was half an hour trip but only 20 Singapore dollars. Hotel was boutique and pleasant, good staff and friendly service. You will have to upgrade to get a view or even a window but the rooms are clean, plush and comfortable.

title: Needs work!
desc: Charming hotel, helpful staff, clean and comfortable, but there's a big problem. The building is located in the Chinatown district, known for its quaint old buildings. This is one. The traffic noise in the rooms is horrendous. We complained and we were moved to a larger, nicer room, but the noise was the same. Being an old building, possibly protected, I don't know, the windows are wooden, not particularly well fitting, and are single glazed. Not only were we disturbed by traffic all night, at 3:30am the refuse collectors started banging and crashing large metal bins from the food court in the next block. Sorry Scarlet, I won't be back.

title: Stylish hotel in Chinatown
desc: We stayed in an executive room which was smartly decorated but quite small (not much room for cases if you are stopping over on the way to a long holiday as we were). Very good large shower room. The breakfast buffet is fine and there is a spectacular rooftop bar. Good location in heart of Chinatown. Concierge very helpful with advice and booked taxis for us which are very reasonable and easiest way of getting to Botanic Gardens and the zoo.

title: A quirky, eclectic hotel
desc: We had a two-night stay here in January to break up our journey to Bali. Location wise it was great for what we had in mind, which was a bit of sightseeing on the one full day we had. We were greeted warmly on arrival, helped with our suitcases and given a cold towel while registering. Our room was 112 on the ground floor at the rear and it wasn't until the next morning we realised it only had two or three very small windows set high on the rear wall and these were opaque so you couldn't see outside. The only time it was an issue was the first morning when I had to get dressed and wander out to Reception to check the weather before we set out for the day. I thought I mind find the lack of natural light claustrophobic but as we didn't spend a lot of time in the room

title: Beautiful and Nostalgic Boutique Hotel
desc: One of the beautiful boutique Hotel being developed in local shop house which design was nostalgia and practicable. Also feeling free and comfortable with balcony on low rise building, witnessing passengers and cars passing by in own comfort at the balcony's seat. The room's layout is nice but not 100% sound proof. There's small gym and a shared jacuzzi pool. Interestingly, an old fashioned spiral metal staircase from low to high floors.Specially mentioned and applauded Service Staff; Ms Ferrena and David who were friendly, accommodating and served with passion and smiles.Breakfast was optional and price was on high side which were provided by 3rd party restaurant in the hotel.

title: Stop over
desc: Stayed here for 3 nights encounter to NZ. Very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was a decent size with a small balcony and was quiet during night time hours. Rooftop bar was a pleasant place to relax with a breeze to keep you cool. Only disappointment was our breakfast on the final morning with the selection of hot items at best luke warm. The hotel is situated close to Chinatown and the Maxwell Food Court. There are plenty of bars and restaurants close by offering a range of food including French and Italian. It was ideal for our stay and a 30 minute walk from Raffles Hotel. hotel organised our Taxi to the airport which was 27$.

title: Ideal Hotel For Us
desc: It was our stop over hotel from Sydney to London. 25 Singapore dollars by taxi from Changi. Great location, short stroll to Club Street or Amoy street full of bars and restaurants. We really liked our room, high specification, very good bed and bathroom, nicely decorated and super quiet. We would definitely book this hotel again.

title: Bit of a mixed bag
desc: The location is good if you want to be near Chinatown and it's opposite the Maxwell, one of the best food courts in Singapore. The building is lovely - a run of converted shophouses with superb lobby area, evoking earlier times. There's no pool but there is an outdoor hot tub which accommodates 4 although they'd need to be pretty good friends. Rooms however are very claustrophobic - tiny and dark. We got one with a balcony but it looked out onto a multi storey car park and there was no screening from the next door balcony. Cleaning was erratic at best and all the accommodation seemed a little shabby and worn out. Our bathroom window which opened out onto the pool patio deck would not even shut properly, never mind lock so it was difficult to sleep soundly. The

title: Very friendly and helpful.
desc: The staff were very helpful with recommendations of places to visit and with making phone call enquiries for us. They helped my disabled companion with taxi bookings and loading our gear into the car. The room was large, luxurious and comfortable and we were in a perfect location for Chinese New Year in Chinatown. The only difficulty was that the toilet and shower did not have hand rails for those needing support. Then again, we did not request such facilities!

title: Perfect refuge in the heat of town
desc: Loved every minute at this hotel. Staff are so friendly, rooms are neat and tidy with fun little touches. Perfect place to stay in the Chinatown area. Very quiet at all times and yet just a stone throw away from the hustle and bustle of Chinatown day and night.

title: Great location in an historic street
desc: A collection of shop houses well converted into a boutique hotel. Nice decor although rooms are small and there are disadvantages in converting old houses with niggling maintenance issues Free wifi(not very fast though), small breakfast room. Its location is however superb with the Maxwell Road Food Centre and Chinatown close by and lots of nice restaurants and bars in Club Street just behind the hotel.

title: Love The Scarlet
desc: My first trip to Singapore was made even more special with a stay at The Scarlett. I wanted to stay in a smaller boutique hotel and wasn't disappointed. Wonderful warm reception from staff after flight from Sydney. Loved all the quirky details and the fact that it was originally a heritage shophouse converted to a luxurious hotel. loved cosiness, the rich jewel colours, close proximity to Chinatown. I booked a room with a balcony which was very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. As a solo traveller I felt safe and very welcome thanks to fabulous staff. Looking forward to coming back.

title: Nice hotel, in interesting location
desc: A pleasant hotel, and we arrived very early after a flight and where pleased to find out that we could check in, which was great to have a nap, before heading off to explore the area. The area is atmospheric, and the markets are a two minute walk away. And the mtr station is local too. The room was nicely furnished, shame lack of windows as a little dark, but thats part of the character of the building. There was a pleasant bathroom. Would recommend for a short stay. Staff were really pleasant too.

title: Great Start to our Honeymoon
desc: Stayed for a total of 5 nights in a premium room. Found the location to be excellent and we could often walk or catch a taxi for under $10 to anywhere we wanted to travel. Didn't try the hotel breakfast but found a local cafe only 5 mins away (Sarnies) to have excellent coffee. Room was filled with plush furniture and trimmings. We also had an all inclusive mini bar (snacks). The bed was firm and pillows soft - which wasn't to my wife's liking but very much to my liking. There was a smell from the bathroom that occurred occasionally - it dissipated quickly enough that we didn't feel the need to complain to hotel staff. Overall this is somewhere we would choose to stay again. A lovely quaint boutique hotel.

title: lovely hotel, comfortable beds.
desc: Its a wonderfully decorated hotel. The rooms are quite small but the beds are very comfortable, with a decent sized shower. close to the center of china town and only a 5 minute walk to the closest train station. great spot. the downside is its in a bust area so there can be quite a bit of street noise (but that is not the hotels fault). the staff were quire helpful with recommendations for restaurants and best yum cha restaurants in and around china town.

title: Close to Club Street, Chinatown and Maxwell
desc: The premium rooms are nice and big with a bathtub. It's very close to Chinatown and Maxwell food centre is across the road. For non Asian selection of food you can walk to club street only a few streets away. The service is generally pretty good but i do wish the concierge would smile a bit more but he is efficient. Breakfast could be better as i find the selection underwhelming and they don't have a make to order egg station. Gym is adequate for a quick workout. Would stay again, but wouldn't opt for breakfast.

title: A nice quaint boutique hotel in Chinatown
desc: A preserved pre-war shophouse in Chinatown area converted into a boutique hotel. Wonderful & elegant in its own way. The rooms are quite small & some of them have no real windows. There is a curtain on the wall that makes it appear that it will open to a large veranda but it's actually just a wall. No worries though if you're not claustrophobic. :) The interior are mostly red with contrast of white hence the name Scarlet.The employees are very courteous. The time I stayed here there was a construction going on the next street I think so it can be a little noisy at night. Walking distance to some temples in Chinatown like the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum & Sri Mariamman Temple.On the other street outside the hotel is the Singapore City Gallery & Red Dot Museum. You can also

title: Terrible communication
desc: A deposit was taken from my bank account for a room where mini bar was free. I was told I would get the money straight back when I checked out. Checked out, no communication. I called them and they have advised me that it will take 2 weeks for the money to come back to me. No effort was made to do anything about it AT ALL!

title: Construction in area made it tough
desc: The room was VERY SMALL. We had a queen bed, but there was no room to walk around. The room was very well equipped as was the bathroom. The employees were exceptionally friendly and accommodating. The location was good. The street was very noisy day and night and the room was noisy day and night. There's a good deal of construction going on directly across the street, so hopefully things will improve when the construction ends. Breakfast is available but NOT INCLUDED with the room. There's a food market right there, so no need to get breakfast at the hotel.

title: wonderful !
