desc: - we stayed in room 215 for 6 nights. first impression of the room was WOW, pleasing colors, lighting and furnishing. - location - in a pretty section of chinatown, a short leisurely walk to the metro station "chinatown", the "foodie street", and a few meters walk to ann siang road - a street lined with modern bistros and cozy wine bars. inspite of being close to some nightlife, it was very quiet throughout the day and night. - the room is comfortable and clean; the airconditioner worked well. no peculiar odors, enough closet space, and a spacious bathroom. we specially liked our little balcony where we could smoke. electric kettle, coffee and tea are replenished everyday. the mini bar was surprisingly, complimentary! non-alcoholic drinks (cola, fruit juice, branded mineral

title: Small luxury hotel
desc: Located near China town. Quiet place. Very clean hotel with a small Jacuzzi on the top floor. Staff are very friendly and helpful. After check out, we still can take shower after a long day trip to freshen up. I like the decoration of the hotel even there is no window on ground floor room. Overall it's a small luxury for my trip to Singapore.

title: Great hotel!
desc: Location is great - Chinatown is a neat part of town to explore and you're a short taxi ride away from downtown, Clarke Quay, Marina Bay Sands, etc. Room needs a little TLC, but is overall nice and spacious. AVOID the associated "spa" down the street. It's not relaxing or enjoyable in any way. Total waste of money. Breakfast is pricey, but they have a nice selection and the quality is great!

title: Lovely stay
desc: Was a great 6 days at the scarlet. Rooms we clean and spacious enough. Not sure what others were whinging about. It's not a palace. Oddly enough I was slightly underwhelmed by the 'quirk factor' was a little tame for my taste buds. Great staff. Cocktails on the roof are not worth the price. Head around the street for better bar staff. Top location though.

title: Amazing!
desc: Booked a deluxe room and it was absolutely stunning. Spacious, clean and very colourful which is a nice change from your typical all white hotel rooms. I travelled with my cousin so we requested twin beds, which they provided. We didn't have a window, but that didn't turn out to be as big of a deal as I thought, as there was a small sunroof letting some light into the rooms in the mornings Location was also fantastic. So close to Chinatown and Maxwell Food Centre. Also very close to two different MRT stops. Quiet street so not a lot of noise coming from outside. Finally, the service from the staff was impeccable! They were so polite, always smiling and very happy to help. 100% recommend this hotel to everyone!

title: A perfect way to end to our SEA holiday
desc: Every aspect of our New Year's Eve visit--from internet booking/initial emails to ensuring taxi transfer to airport--was flawless. Reservation, front desk and cleaning staff were all professional and smart. Superlatives: convenient location (across from Hawker's Market Chinatown), value (compared to brand-name hotels), and welcoming to children (at least outwardly). Low points: rooftop bar closed a bit to early, the pool is the size of a Jacuzzi, and the shower had an annoying tendency to make the floor completely wet. All minor, really. We will certainly recommend to friends given the location and price point. Perfect if you're a foodie or love the local night scene...

title: Good location, but not boutique
desc: + great location, walking distance to mrt/bus, restaurants, hawkers etc. - we didn't booked the cheapest category and the room didn't had a window (availability) the room was also moistly and stuffy - carpet in a room with no window in such a humid clima is no the best idea - check-in was very slow and complicated Why is are rooms without window and with window the same price? Lobby etc. is very nice and stylish. But the rooms are really not boutique, you expect more of a luxury boutique hotel.

title: Back in time!
desc: This 3-night stay turned out well. Very nice people working there who kept asking me every day how I felt because I was sick. The room with balcony was also ok with a nice clean bathroom. There's a very small pool you can take a dip in, but no more than that. Hotel is located in Chinatown, but getting around is easy. You can always take a cap and they are not expensive down here. Cost me about 25 us dollars from the airport to the hotel.

title: Not quirky enough to be different nor the amenities to be mainstream
desc: I've stayed in Singapore a number of times and this time we thought it would be nice to stay somewhere a little different from the mainstream large hotels. The premise of the Scarlet as converted merchant houses / shops right by Chinatown seemed really promising. The standard rooms are fairly small which was expected but have very little in the way of natural light which is indirect and thus it feels a bit like being in a bunker rather than a room. There is minimal storage for clothes in the way of drawers or even hangars (4!). The decor is nice enough but neither it nor the furniture lend you to think there is anything really different about this hotel compared to many others. The bathroom was fine with a good shower. On one evening we went up to the rooftop bar for a pre

title: Small boutique hotel
desc: Red, black with distorted hallways. If this is your kind of thing, you will like this place. Some rooms are larger and some rooms have a small balcony. Amenities are hit and miss ie: they do not have any rollaway beds or vanity mirrors but have bath salts and excellent bath products. The bed was very comfortable. Located right in the middle of China town. Lots of casual places to eat and small shops around.

title: Unique
desc: This hotel is quite different, in a good way. Great location, handy for China Town part of Singapore. Loved the furnishings. Comfy big bed with quality bed linen. Good size bathroom. Staff we met were all lovely. Were welcomed with ice cold flannels which were a great touch on a really hot day. Lot's of thoughtful touches. All in all loved it.

title: Very nice place in heart of Chinatown.
desc: A different sort of hotel to the normal run-of-the-mill places. We stayed three nights in a nice large room with breakfast. The breakfast was high quality and set us up for tramping round Singapore all day.

title: Very charming and great location
desc: The Scarlet is a very charming boutique hotel with nice and quiet rooms and a good bed. We had a 'executive room' with balcony. Perfect size. Very helpful and friendly staff. The location is perfect for exploring Singapore day as night.

title: Good Boutique Hotel
desc: 3 times repeater in this boutique hotel, they always deliver what we need, clean, maintain, service consistent and very good location.. I love the baroque design... Maybe just the room little bit small and no parking area. Will be back soon again..

title: Beautiful with Service to Match
desc: We loved this hotel. The service was unbelievable. We were treated extra special. Small but with wonderful furniture. Hard but comfortable bed. Storage a bit limited. Perhaps should consider removing case stand with chest of drawers. I found location good. But was a bit noisy. This is not the fault of the hotel. I am a quiet country person. Restaurant and bar quite expensive compared to other local eateries. Sorry Hotel management but food court across the road is a fraction of the price and better. Overall this is very good with personal service. Would definitely go back. Price wise compared with other Singapore hotels very good value. I believe an excellent review is appropriate even though I have a few criticisms.

title: Excellent location
desc: Nice little hotel ok for one or two nights as we found the rooms to be a little on the small side, but very neat and tidy. The bathroom was good and spaciouse just what you need after sight seeing all day. The staff were very helpful, polite and friendly. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel after checking out as our flight wasn't until late, they also have the facility to have a shower when you come back and collect your bags which is great.Excellent locaction for China town which is just around the corner, So in walking distance of loads of bars and restaurants or just walking through all the shops

title: Best Hotel in Chinatown
desc: A little expensive but worth every dime. Around the corner is a food court with local style food, watch out for the Tom Yum soup, it's really spicy. Also check out the Duxton Coffee Department of Caffeine, awesome waffles with bacon and egg, you should go a little earlier than lunch to catch a good chair.

title: Lovely little boutique hotel
desc: We recently stayed at this hotel on a two night stop over on the way to Australia. The room was lovely and very clean. The bathroom was great with a very large shower, which we definitely appreciated after all the walking around. The only slight downside was the lack of windows. Although we did have them, they were very small, but if I'm being honest it didn't really affect us that much. The entrance was lovely and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Check out was at 12pm and our flight wasn't until the evening, the hotel looked after our baggage whilst we had a wonder around and we were also able to use the shower facilities to refreshen up before we left for the airport, which was a real bonus. We tried out the gym on both days, it is small and basic but it was fine

title: Quick stay
desc: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times for business travel. Stayed with my wife this time. We were there for NYE event. I enjoy this boutique motel as it is quite with friendly staff. Also is is next to Chinatown which is fun to walk through. Staff has always been friendly and accommodating. Personally I like the adjacent Italian restaurant. Food has been good and staff friendly. This hotel is on my short list for trips to SIngapore.

title: Stylish boutique hotel in Chinatown close to Maxwell Road Hawker Centre
desc: Standard rooms can be quite small as hotel is converted shop-houses but they have some larger suites which are quite opulent. Position on edge of Chinatown is great with Maxwell Hawker Centre just across the way, the Tong Heng bakery with their superb custard tarts just round the corner, the bars and restaurants of Ann Siang Road close by, and Smith Street and the heart of Chinatown a few hundred metres away. They have a couple of good Italian restaurants in house (one on the roof) and serve good cocktails in the bar in Casa Tartufo. Rooftop one recently refurbished. Hotel is stylish and fun with the small outside jacuzzi not much used (when I've stayed) so one could get some fresh air and chill out when you wanted. Have been there both alone on business and as a couple and

title: Great Boutique Hotel in Chinatown!
desc: Wonderful service - they called around and found us a reservation at a nice restaurant in Chinatown for New Years Day and then called us while we were out sightseeing. Lovely hotel, small rooms but nice, great AC which makes it easier to sleep. You could walk to restaurants, Chinatown shopping and club street.

title: Liked it
desc: Cozy little hotel with great staff. Room was clean and we had a cute skylight. Would stay there again. I liked the furniture in the entrance a lot. It's a little tricky to find it. I would like to have a found a better map on the homepage. Süßes kleines Hotel in der Nähe von Chinatown. Sehr sauber und die Mitarbeiter waren alle sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Wir wann das Skylight gemütlich und das Zimmer war gut gelüftet.

title: Not told about the 50$ deposit charge per night
desc: I chose The Scarlet Hotel after reading reviews here on Tripadvisor. I can confirm other reviews that state the friendliness of the staff and that the rooms were very comfortable but on the small side. We were upgraded to a Delux Room apon arrival (dont know why) which had two very big windows both of which were sealed closed. The bathroom is very small and the water pressure wasn´t that great but sufficient. The TV channels were satisfactory too with Fox Movies and a few other english speaking channels. The hotel is very long indeed and runs along almost the whole of Erskine Road with Reception being at the end of the road from the main road. There are no other entrances or exists than from the Reception. I was allocated to a room at the opposite end from Reception which

title: A pleasant change from the big corporate hotels
desc: This is a perfect hotel for those of you who want something smaller and more personal than the big Singapore hotels. It's very close to Chinatown, so ideal for exploring and there are Bus Tour routes very nearby to get you to other locations in the city. Very helpful and friendly staff too.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in Chinatown
desc: I concur with all the previous glowing reviews. Usually stay on Orchard Road but decided on something different. I was in room 303 with balcony overlooking the car park opposite but not an issue--very quiet location, great bed and bathroom, but the room was realistically perfect for one person, two people occupying this room with luggage would need to place one luggage on the balcony. Buses just around the corner if not keen to take metro. Nice reception, lovely staff but nowhere to sit for some quiet time and have a drink. May possibly stay here again.

title: perfect
desc: this boutique hotel was perfect. the situation is creasy in chinatown near the Best restaurants bars and temples. the staff was very kind and the room was perfect. the style of the hotel is different with what we can see in Singapore

title: Great boutique hotel
desc: I stayed here with my other half for a couple of days on the way to Manila. Overall a really nice place to stay from which to explore the city. Location: You'll need to get the train from the airport to get here, or a cab if it's really late at night. It's within walking distance from the train station, which serves a couple of lines so it serves as a good place to explore the city. It's within walking distance of a string of nice bars and Chinatown, with marina bay being a longer walk. Overall, location is ace Room: Clean room, although a bit tight for an executive suite. Bathroom is spacious. Bed and furnishings are delightful; the overall ambience of the hotel is wonderful. Breakfast: None! Not a surprise in Singapore I guess, but disappointing nonetheless. Services:

title: Expensive parking, inconsistent service, overpriced rooms
desc: Had a three day stay at The Scarlet and it started off terribly. We were driving into Singapore and called the hotel right before we entered the country (as it would cost a bomb to call in Singapore due to roaming charges) to enquire about parking - only to be unhelpfully told that the hotel had no parking with some terrible suggestions: to park at a Chinese temple nearby, the prices of which the staff did not know, or to park at the URA building nearby - a whopping S$1.40 per 30 MINUTES! Before I could get another word in, she merely reiterated that the hotel had no parking and hung up. What kind of luxury hotel has staff that hangs up before the guest is finished speaking, and does not think of the welfare of its guests who drive cars? What hotel would be okay with guests

title: Well located and quirky in a good way.
desc: Walking into this converted chophouse in Chinatown in a bit like joining Alice in Wonderland. The decor is funky ,but the service is excellent. Our room was a bit small, but equipped with all mod cons and there was a balcony where we used to have our coffee in the morning. The price is very reasonable for Singapore.

title: Something different...!
desc: The Scarlet hotel is a boutique hotel near China town. I was impressed when I walked into the lobby, very cool decor. The room wasn't big but modern and a really powerful shower. Big TV with loads of channels including movies. Extremely comfortable bed and duvet. I found the room really noisy at night and think they should think about better glazing. The location was excellent, loads of bars and restaurants on the door step including club street which has loads of bars and restaurants. Staff very polite and helpful at all times.

title: Good small hotel in renovated building
desc: This small hotel in renovated prewar shophouse has beautiful bold decor and interesting furniture. The twin room I stayed in was quite small but adequate with large en-suite bathroom. Complementary minibar. The only drawback was that the room had not been cleaned when i arrived at 3pm despite requesting to have the room available at 12. The reception refused to provide the key until the room was cleaned - which would take more than half an hour.

title: Excellant experience
desc: I had a staycation in the premium room. However, i think was given the executive room with balcony. It was still nice and extremely beautiful. The room was spacious and had bathtub. there was a separate shower. Very classy service. The staff guided us to the room while explaining their facilities. Everything was clean and well mannered. Its an extremely beautiful luxury hotel. Worth the stay and price!

title: Very nice location and hotel style/decoration
desc: I loved the style and decoration of this hotel! The staff is very nice and helpful and they are in a good location close to everything for walking distance or metro. Easy to get from the airport and right next to Chinatown.. great place for eating and shopping! Would ask for a room close to the elevator cause they have very long corridors. Congratulations to the staff and design/decoration!!!

title: Singapore's Naught Hotel
desc: This is a hotel with an attitude. The bold colors and extravagant décor are not for everyone. This hotel is made for the daring and perhaps mischievous traveler. It is audacious and unapologetically so. The hotel is located in the trendy Ann Siang hill area of Singapore. At the door steps there are specialty shops, trendy restaurants and wine bars. It one of the top destinations in Singapore for in the know expats who flock to the area during the week for a pleasant meal or on the weekends for some late night fun. A block away you’ll find Singapore’s Chinatown with its maze of hawker shops, which are outdoor restaurants selling cheap and cheerful dishes, as well as market where you can get everything from household goods to fresh octopus. Nearby is also Singapore’s busting

title: Quirky and cute hotel in Chinatown
desc: Had booked a deluxe room for 5 nights during a recent business trip to Singapore. Very convenient location, just a short walk from my office and near Club street if you are looking for some after work drinks. The windows were double glazed so I heard very little street noise. Lovely bar on the top floor with a friendly bartender serving a premixed Negroni, which is one of their specials. Once I got over the fact that it was pre-mixed, I loved it. There is an Italian restaurant attached to the hotel which has received rave reviews, though I couldn't try it during my last trip. In room food selection is minimal but there are ample places around to satisfy and food cravings. The room is on the small side, but if ideal for a single business traveler and comes with a cupboard with

title: Cute hotel, great location
desc: We had two rooms on a four night stop and were impressed. The hotel is in a great spot - 2 mins walk into the heart of Chinatown and just behind Maxwell Food Centre. Its a stylish hotel and we would recommend it to anyone having a city break in Singapore. The staff were friendly and the rooms clean and comfortable. Neither room (one deluxe, one premium) had a window but that really didn't matter to us. Both were of a good size with naturally the Premium being a little larger with a sitting area furnished with a chaise longue. Chinatown MRT was also nearby as is the suburb of Duxton so lots of great eating choices close by.

title: Not Dissappointed
desc: We came across the Scarlet on the internet. The words that came into my mind of the pictures shown was lush and inviting. and we were not disappointed. The rooms were great and the staff were helpful and attentive. The position of the Scarlet is a major plus being in Chinatown with so many different eateries at your front door plus all the atmosphere of Chinatown itself. Great hotel. We will be going back there.

title: Wonderful..
desc: ...location was brilliant for Chinatown, room excellent we had a balcony overlooking the car park but it was a good price and very clean and comfortable. Reception staff were courteous and well informed about sightseeing. Good access to MRT for getting around Singapore. Breakfast was a little expensive for what it was but there was plenty of choice and you could eat as much as you wanted. Rooftop bar was great with good service and plenty of choice. Overall an excellent place, a more personal experience to the high rise hotels downtown for those travellers who like character and something different.

title: A little disappointing
desc: We love Singapore and on this visit we wanted to stay somewhere a bit different. The hotel reception is impressive and our room was very nice. We shouldn't have paid extra for a balcony though as it only had room for one chair and looked directly into a multistorey car park. We thought a hotel with no pool would be ok but we did miss this facility. The small jacuzzi was just outside our room and we spent an afternoon relaxing in it. Unfortunately we couldn't turn the jets on as the noise from the generator was too much. We were very disappointed the rooftop bar and restaurant were closed, there were no works being carried out so not sure if it will reopen. The breakfast was poor for such a good quality hotel, little choice and only push button coffee and earl grey tea. The

title: topnotch lil gem
desc: the hotel lobby was just enchanting,well decorated with elegant furnitures. Check in and check out was a breeze. The staff was friendly and attentive. They greeted me by my last name which was very impressive.The room was spacious, the toilet was well-maintained and great thing was that the minibar is inclusive in the room as we booked for premium category. The bed was cozy and the pillows are so fluffy and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again. Thumbs up, Scarlet!

title: Charming and Delightful Stay
desc: We only had one night in Singapore after a cruise and wanted a boutique hotel close to Chinatown and the Metro so we could easily see the city highlights. The Scarlet was an excellent choice and exceeded our expectations. Service was first class from the moment the doorman greeted us at the taxi. We arrived at 9am expecting to store our luggage until later check-in. To our delight they had a room available and offered to check us in with immediately. Such a warm welcome! The receptionist and bellman were extremely friendly and helpful in making recommendations for sight seeing highlights, dining, shopping and transportation. Provided a map with easy instructions to follow everywhere we went. Our room had a lovely balconey and was wonderfully equipped with all the amenities

title: Fantastic little find
desc: Amazing hotel near the central district and a 5 minutes walk from China Town, It is a charming hotel, rooms are clean, tidy and quiet with modern bathrooms, staff are extremely friendly and polite, a lift to the floors

title: Incredibly Stunning
desc: My First Visit To Scarlet. The Hotel Was Incredibly Stunning. Staff Was Helpful, Friendly And Efficient. No Words Can Describe How Much We Love The Hotel. It Reminds Me Of Alice In Wonderland. There Is Something Unique About Scarlett Hotel. You Should Stay Here To Find Out. The Room Was Beautiful Design In Different Themes. Thank-You Scarlet For The Wonderful Stay. We Will Definitely Come Back Again To Stay.

title: The Scarlet Singapore
desc: Great hotel to spend a weekend in Singapore. Very well located in Chinatown, a few minutes walk from the MRT, and located right next to the restaurant streets with lively ambiance in the night (although not noisy at all from the room). We stayed in Premium room and the room has a good size, well decorated in Baroque style. Nice bathroom too. The roof top is cute, serving original cocktails. Top notch team, very helpful and professional.

title: A brothel without a view
desc: Spent four days in Sg checking out 4 Hotels. Swisshotel, Pan Pac, St Regis all great fantastic big hotels and then for something different a boutique luxury small hotel -the Club Hotel. At the last minute the Club advised us they were "overbooked" and transferred us to the Scarlet - funny right next door! (even stranger when I later saw on expedia there WERE still rooms available at the club!!) Scarlet reception was painfully slow and even after three attempts could not get our names in the correct order. We were then given was a down a dark mould smelling corridor. The room was tiny without any window and smelt like an old cellar. It was a joke. You could never call this luxury. There is clearly a damp problem and I am sure it was unhealthy. No amount of red paint and a square

title: Great stay
desc: This was my second stay at the Scarlet Singapore. My room was an executive room with a balcony and it was only when I was booking this room that I realised I had been upgraded during my stay last year! In any case this room was quite a deal smaller than my room last year but it was still very comfortable as I was travelling alone. If I had a companion it may have been a little bit cramped. The bed was superb, nice and firm and the pillows felt like clouds. My balcony didn't have a great view and overlooked Erskine Road but I didn't find it loud with the door closed. You do get the occasional raucous laughter but it's not unbearable. The bathroom was clean and serviced regularly. I found that I had to remove the toilet paper as it was right next to the toilet and was very

title: Not fully satisfied
desc: Not bad, not good. Although the service is still good and some parts as the Tartufo bar are nice the full place looks as if refurbishment could be a recommended decision... Hanging clothes is almost impossible due to the fact they only provide a few hangers.

title: Really?? Not so hot
desc: Booked an "Executive room" #207 for 3 nights, which was first of all not at all what was represented by misleading photos on the internet. This room was small, I mean small like LaQuinta or Hampton Inn would seem like a full suite compared to these rooms. The room is sooo tiny that if you ask for separate beds verses one bed, there is only enough room for about 3 inches between the beds, so it might as well just be one bed. Next the toilet, oh the toilet... whoever installed this toilet must have been about 4ft tall, let me tell you if you are 6ft or taller you physically can not sit on this toilet as your knees would be jammed into the wall in front of you, there is only about 7 inches from the lip of the toilet to the wall in front of you, I am 6'1" and I had to sit

title: Superb in singapore
desc: Read a review in the independent and so very glad I chose this hotel. Stayed with my mum for three nights. Beautifully furnished and well equipped room with luxurious touches like fluffy dressing gowns and slippers, nice toiletries. The staff are superb, attentive and friendly and even had a gift for my mother's birthday. Head up the hill to Ann Siang for Singapore's trendy restaurants and bars. great location within waking distance of many places of interest as well as the MRT which is very cheap and easy to use. So glad opted for this place over the international hotels downtown. Will return! Five stars.

title: The closest to a dump I've ever stayed in.
desc: I booked this after reading all of the rave reviews. That is certainly not been my experience. I booked an executive suite with a balcony. To use the toilet one would have to sit side saddle. The rooms are small though clean. The balcony overlooks a service Ali which is very noisy and ear plugs are recommended if you are going to stay here. Another problem is the water drains very slowly. I did call down to the desk about that and they showed me that it would eventually drain out. The shower is spacious and every time leaks water throughout the bathroom. I don't see what the attraction is here with the colors. I would absolutely not stay here again.

title: Great location and lovely boutique hotel
desc: Unfortunately only had one night to spend at this lovely little hotel that is perfectly positioned for Chinatown & Club St. Beautiful lobby decked out in velvet. Room was well appointed and very clean. Aircon was lovely and cold. Roof top bar served nice cocktails although $$. Only criticism was that we weren't told at check in about the bar or cafe on site. We found them by accident. Great stay. We'll be back!

title: Not a modern soulless hotel
desc: A pot luck choice made prior to our visit to Singapore - and the choice was very good. Located on the edge of Chinatown, the old building is rather overshadowed by newer skyscrapers. Friendly staff at reception ensured formalities were quickly completed. The room was fairly compact, but with a large, recently upgraded bathroom. The bedroom included a fridge with complimentary beer, soft drinks, chocolate and a bottle of red wine. There was also a good sized safe and fast Wi-Fi. The air on was able to combat the Singapore heat and humidity. We didn’t eat at the hotel, but there was an on-site Italian restaurant and breakfast room.

title: Awesome Experience
desc: So I was interested to see hw this hotel would be. In a historical Building, it has a setting that reminds you of Asia in the 60's. Until you get inside, then it feels like you were transported to an Agatha Christie Novel set in the Orient. You feel the ambience as you go. Now for more practical. The rooms are nice, they are each unique. Nice comfy bed with some firmness, free refillable minibar. But what makes this place even better, is the staff, Unbelievably friendly, helpful and went way beyond to help me out when I needed a place to do some recording with a friend. Offered up suggestions and help, even when not asked, and even the regular cleaning staff were very friendly and outgoing, which is a bit unusual from most who say hi and bow their heads. I moved to

title: Great stay at the Scarlet
desc: Would highly recommend staying at the scarlet, great location in Chinatown with easy access to markets and restaurants, and very close to the MRT. Joscelyn was amazing and very accommodating to all of our needs. It was much appreciated that we were allowed to check in early and freshen up after arriving very early in the morning. The free mini bar and drinks vouchers are great perks as well!

title: Exceptional staff at The Scarlet Singapore.
desc: Very lovely and perfect location. Close to everything. Priya and Samantha the receptionists was so helpful with our booking to accommodate our needs. I fully recommend to stay at The Scarlet Singapore. Thank you for the stressless help.

title: Lovely stay at Scarlet hotel!
desc: We stayed at the Scarlet hotel for 2 nights as a stop over in Singapore before a holiday in Bali. We loved the hotel and is in perfect location next to Chinatown and only 30 minute walk to marina bay sands. We loved the roof top bar on top of hotel which we were given complimentary drink vouchers for on arrival. Mini bar in room too was completely free with snacks and refreshments. The service of the staff was the highlight of this hotel. They were very attentive and informative during our stay. We had an unfortunate panic at the airport where we realised we left a bag behind with passport in!! We phoned the hotel and they luckily found it and were amazing and organised a taxi to send this to us at the airport so we could make our flight!! Special thanks to Kenneth who got in

title: Amazing stay for culture gurus
desc: Exceptionally comfortable room in bed in the heart of Chinatown. Staff were amazing and so helpful, even lent me umbrella for the day after I checked out and stored luggage until I left for airport. Highly recommend!

title: Great characterful hotel!
desc: Comfortable bed in a well furnished room. Old style furniture and decor gives it an authentic “Old Singapore “ feel. Large bathroom, clean and modern. Executive room has windows facing a quiet alley. Very close to Maxwell Food Court for fantastic food! Overall, happy we chose this hotel, and Ayub and his reception staff made us feel very welcome. Complimentary mini bar is a great feature!! Thanks.

title: 整潔舒適典雅的復古飯店
desc: The service staff is friendly and professional, and you can easily check in without knowing English. The room is clean and comfortable, suitable for a good rest after a day of work. There are many delicious and affordable food near the hotel. The bar of the hotel has a relaxed atmosphere, which is very suitable for a drink after work. I am very satisfied This stay experience.

title: Decent location, great staff, great exp
desc: Staff could not have been more helpful, location is cool, low key in China Town, 5min cab to Clarke Quay. Check out was 12 as standard, free minibar a nice touch and a roof top terrace great. Ground floor rooms were a bit dingy, and we requested being moved to 2nd floor. Small room (as normal in Singapore) but just fine. We had a late flight from Changi and staff gave us a day room to freshen up after check out for free (thanks Freddie). V good service. Good exp.

title: Lovely stay at The Scarlet
desc: I gained a couple of kilos while staying 3 nights at The Scarlet. The room came complimentary mini bar. Soft drinks, nuts, Snickers and Kit Kat were provided and topped up everyday. There's also welcome drink at the rooftop bar. The Maxwell Food Centre is just a couple of minutes walk away while the F&B heaven of Telok Ayer area is just across the Ann Siang Park. The interior of the hotel may be daunting to some with scarlet walls and warm lighting. The corridor was like a never ending maze. My room was at the far end of the hotel. Ask for nearer rooms if you have mobility issues. The room itself was spacious and comfortable. My room had a window but they placed a piece of perspex sheet that kept out most noise emanating from the bars in the street behind.

title: Great place to stay and thanks to Freddie.
desc: The staff were very attentive, especially Freddie, who made sure any query we had was answered promptly and quickly. The Scarlet is a beautiful authentic hotel in a great location and it suited our needs well. I would highly recommend The Scarlet to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Singapore.

title: Could have been better
desc: Service on front desk was prompt helpful and had bag storage. The hotel is a but different and quirky. Room 212 we had wasn’t huge but expected that to be the case on second floor. A bonus of a window facing out the back was good and the room functional with no complaints apart for the being noisy with noise from both sides and music on rooftop till late on. Of course location was good. A free drinks voucher was offered for the upstairs bar after 5pm. We arrived at 5:30 on a Sunday night to be told we could drink and order food but would have to depart by 6pm !!! As they had a private function on. It would have been good if we had been informed of this on booking as the noise kept us awake when trying to catch up on sleep.

title: Well worth considering.
desc: Outstanding customer service, Room was pleasant and well serviced. The bar was great and the resturant was very good. It would have been nice if the spa was operating. However, we enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend The Scarlet. Thankyou for a very pleasant stay.

title: Great hotel
desc: Great location, right in Chinatown area, lots of places to shop for souvenirs. Near Buddha temple and a Himdhu temple. The room and bathroom were clean. Great shower. Comfortable bed. Only downside is no window. But we knew that. Not a big deal for one night. Friendky receptionists. Will stay there again in the future

title: Comfortable Stay at Well Located Heritage Property (with one caveat)
desc: Stayed 3 nights at The Scarlet Hotel Singapore in a Premium room. The room was located on the floor above street level and had large windows which allowed much natural light. We recommend requesting a room with windows for this room category. We checked in earlier and although the room (233) was ready we were charged an early check in fee of $S178, which we thought was excessive. Despited this initial issue we loved the overall heritage ambience of the property and were pleased to read in other reviews that there is a refurbisment planned for next year. The furnishings are a little "faded and jaded" with some stained and lifting carpets. However the hotel still maintains that heritage character and appeal. Otherwise our room was very spacious and comfortable. The bed

title: World class Staff!!
desc: Front staff especially the night and day managers handled every comfort and request with kindness and professionalism. Staff were even better. Special shout out to Sanantha and Dikjoi. Would stay here vs my usual hyatt chain

title: Cozy stay in S'pore
desc: How lucky am i to get this cozy room.Comfortable bed and pillow and location is very convenient,train is nearby and lots nice food nearby.Chinatown is just walking distance away. Highly recommended for travellers.

title: Heart of Chinatown
desc: Staying at the Scarlet was so much more interesting than a concrete and glass edifice - quirky, historic and interesting. Perhaps a little "happy chic" in places but all the facilities were excellent. Staff were really helpful - and there's an excellent medical clinic on the corner if, like me, you suddenly need a doctor!

title: 3 night stay
desc: Staff very welcoming upon arrival and throughout our stay. The bed was very spacious and comfy, our room came with a window which was a bonus. The hotel is right on China town and walking distance to the other popular areas which was great. The only thing was the hotel needed a lot of TLC and our room carpet had stains on which wasn’t nice, I didn’t want to take my shoes off. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast and it was probably the worse breakfast I had, had, I didn’t eat it and we still got charged.

title: Superb!!
desc: The best hotel experience in Singapore.. very nice people from housekeeping, bar tenders and receptionists.. all staff are very accommodating.. will be back here soon.. if there is a 6 star rating, I will give these people

title: Thank you! Freddie 10/10
desc: The room was very clean, I was surprised to have so many drinks available that were included (free) with the room, although what I liked the most was the service. When I checked out at 11 a.m., I wasn't sure where to go for my luggage and my flight was at 11 p.m., Freddie from reception asked me where I was going and I told him, I would like to visit UniversalDo you know if they have a place to leave the suitcases there?, and he clarified that they had a free luggage storage service, he gave me a ticket and told me to come back whenever I want to pick up my luggage, It was a 10/10 service, thank you very much! Freddie, thanks to you I got to know Universal Singapore without any problems.

title: Amazing First Boutique Hotel, very Family Friendly 🫶🏻
desc: The first boutique hotel in Singapore is more than just a stay in Maxwell where it lasted at the heart of Chinatown. I stayed with my sister and her son & husband and we have no complained at all. The check in was so smooth as they assisted us very friendly to our room. Although its average size of singapore hotel, you could find enough some space for luggage, wardrobe, working desk and spacious awesome bed + bathroom. My family is very sensitive toward cleanliness but they left no spot for dust at all 🙏🫶🏻 (despite many carpeted elements inside and outside the room). What my nephew loves so much is their italian restaurant Pasta Brava! From their waffel, spaghetti, pizza to chocolate lava are amazing 🫶🏻 This hotel also walk distance to maxwell MRT that has direct access to

title: Staycation and more
desc: So comfortable and convinient. With very helpful staff. Close to china town . Mrt. And maxwell food centre. Both standard and premium rooms were well appointed and clean. Daily restocked mini bar was a surprising gift

title: The scarlet Singapour
desc: Nice jewel in Singapour ! After a long research we try the Scarlet hôtel , Nice hôtel , clore to everything and with an amazing room , the staff was very nice and they guide us to know some spots at Singapore, we will be back 💪🏽💪🏽💪🏽💪🏽💪🏽💪🏽💪🏽 Do not hesitate to chose it

title: Great Hotel full of Character
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed it. The reception area is amazing - cool, smells good and extremely welcoming from the humidity outside The Staff - all over the hotel were very friendly and alway greeted you. Location wise it is excellent - across the road from Maxwell MRT - a quick walk to Pagoda Street and Chinatown. The included mini bar was a nice surprise as well Rooms were a good size and were well equipped and comfortable Overall the hotel is quaint and oozes character Would suggest it will need a soft refurbishment as far as carpets and walls but this would not stop me coming back

title: Fantastic Service
desc: I'd like to convey my warmest regards and compliments to Mr Thiru for making our stay in this hotel an absolute pleasure. He has taken care of our needs in terms of cleaning services and has maintained a stellar service throughout my entire stay. Will be returning to Scarlet for sure! 😊

title: Great short business trip
desc: Nice boutique hotel with very friendly and helpful staff that make you feel welcome. I love that the minibar is complementary and refilled daily which also includes beer. The rooms are all different in design and layout as the hotel spans along the street which has a different appeal compared to the usual hotel where all rooms are identical.

title: Scarlet Singapore
desc: The Scarlet provided a fantastic opportunity for me and my family. The team, lead by Jocelyn organised a surprise celebration of my mothers 60th in the conference room free of charge. This was just the tip of the iceberg when it came to our experience. The rooms were tidy, the staff were all amazing, and the location was fantastic (located directly near public transport). Seriously, all staff were amazing and I hope their hard work does not go unnoticed by their managers. Thank you Scarlet.

title: Sensational Scarlet
desc: The best thing about the Scarlet Singapore is it’s exceptional staff. I have travelled widely and the consideration, helpfulness and overall pleasant attitudes displayed by all the staff are to be commended. I would stay here again simply on the basis of its lovely staff. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the location is great.

title: I highly recommend
desc: I stayed at your hotel on the 7 th of June and check out at 8 th l had a very long journey and was hungry l asked your staff at the reception if they can remove the wine and drinks and give me food as l ran out of cash and they refused l ask if they can reach out to the manager of l can get any food l don't mind later on the reception girls bring apples to my room and said this is what the manager said we can do l wonder where is humanity all those food thrown in the cabage by the end of the day they feel pain to give a human being later on l was getting lost then l met a lady from house keeping Sophanna she greeted me with a smile and ask how my day was going so l told her that lm lost l can't find my room she walk me to my room and ask if l have eaten l told her l have ran

title: Excellent Service in China Town
desc: The staff was incredibly kind, helpful, and attentive, we felt welcomed immediately. It was our first visit to Singapore and they ensured that the trip got off to an excellent start. The location is ideal as well, including easy access to China Town and the Maxwell Hawker. I highly recommend the Scarlett Hotel.

title: Lovely hotel, nice location, friendly staff.
desc: Lovely two nights stay here. Complimentary mini fridge which was refilled each day. Staff were lovely, and even assisted us on getting our free drink on the roof top bar even when it was being used for an event. Very clean, cool(air con is brilliant as Singapore is so humid). Would book again if I’m Singapore.

title: Exceptional staff
desc: We stayed for 4 nights in luxury room with balcony chose balcony room to have window As some rooms only have skylight balcony was overlooking car park however outside humidity was too hot to sit outside Lovely room however very small we had large cases but just managed We had complementary mini bar filled daily which was a bonus and nice to come back to a beer or soft drink and pickies Rooftop bar plus complementary drink voucher to use which was a nice touch Very comfy bed and lovely decor The hotel was very decadent and clean with beautiful furnishings All The staff were amazing so helpful especially Eileen who was new and was on training she was a gem Bottled cold water was always on hand location was perfect 2mins from MRT 5 mins china town 2mins from Maxwell food

title: Room with a balcony, be careful of room 207
desc: I have stayed in this hotel more than once, even in their topsuites, and it has great plusses, such as friendly staff, very convenient location in Chinatown and complementary mini bar. So overall a good choice. However, if you pay the extra for a room with a balcony and breakfast, mind the following. Avoid at all cost the tienest balcony room they have, room 207 where using the toilet is a challenge. As to breakfast, it starts at 07:45. If your first business appointment is early, forget about breakfast. The hotel did call me to offer another room, but it is a pity that was done after I made a remark on the size of the room.

title: A good stay
desc: Stayed here for four nights. Room was good (executive). Staff were very pleasant. As it was my partners birthday they even left us a bottle of white wine and a card. A lovely touch. We used two or three taxis and they were quite happy to arrange. It is quite close to Chinatown and a train station. From the station it will take you direct to the gardens by the bay. Would stay here again.

title: I really wanted to give you 5 stars... but
desc: I really wanted to love this hotel more... but here are my disappointments: The bed was uncomfortable. Lumpy and just a sheet directly on the mattress; No sheet, just a doona... I want a top sheet as well as a doona. Breakfast included - expected a full buffet, but just a few poor choices a la carte. The first morning a slice of white toast with a single slice of ham and a bit of scrambled egg. Second morning a dessert glass with a tiny amount of yoghurt and cereal. Hardly enough to sustain an adult. The hotel is getting a bit tatty, broken door handles, chipped paint, and tables in the rooftop bar have peeling stickers on them. Yuk. Sand and restain them! Our room had a borded up window... But on the plus, staff were lovely, it's a great funky place. I gave you 4 stars

title: A great time in Singapore
desc: The bed is wonderful like a cloud ☁️ it was wonderful! The Personal is attentive to us for all the details, thanks to Faizz and his team to all the gesture ! In the middle of Chinatown, you can do all by foot and visit many temples. Even going to the Marina Bay. For the breakfast there is Maxelwell market at 3 min by foot if you want to explore 😌

title: Friendly Service
desc: I love this hotel. the vibes are like the john wick contonental legendary hotel, it find to place, strategic, and unique. also, i am very impressed with faizz, he is so nice, humble, yet professional. really love his hospitality😎

title: Must go
desc: fantastic service. Faizz makes you feel home. Such a warm welcome. I strongly recommend. Great rooftop with 2 free drinks. Great jazzy music (this is so unusual nowadays). Neighborhood with a temple and narrow streets woth great pubs and restaurants.

title: Fantastic stay, highly recommend.
desc: Comfortable rooms, amazing location right in the middle of the good bars and restaurants, but the standout part of our stay was the customer service we received at our stay at The Scarlet. Everyone working at the Scarlet were so friendly and helpful we we needed them. Would highly recommend.

title: ❤️ Singapore
desc: Awesome Hotel and staff very friendly and always happy to help and assist. We had a nice big room with a bath and shower and free mini bar stocked daily. Good local bars and Maxwell food court literally across the road with loads of tasty foods to try.Great location for MRT and China Town. Would highly recommend..Thank you 🙂

title: Amazing customer service
desc: The hotel is located in a very good area, right next to Maxwell Food Centre and close to Marina Bay Sands as well. The service of the hotel is amazing especially from the receptionist called Faizz. He’s very very friendly, helpful and happy. Makes the experience of staying in this hotel even better.

title: Charming hotel with great staff, good price-value
desc: I stayed at The Scarlet for 3 nights and can only recommend it to anyone! Very friendly staff, especially Mr. Faizz from the front desk, he provided me with all information I needed to make my first stay in Singapore rememberable. The hotel is located between Downtown and Chinatown, perfect to explore the city, even on foot! Cozy rooms, reasonable rates, you stay in a place with lots of history and charm. The only minus are the old windows, so you hear some noise from outside. Hopefully they change that when they do renovations later this year. Thank you very much for a wounderfull time!

title: Superb Hotel, Amazing team
desc: Excellent service from the management team to the in room service team. Always really accommodating, friendly and respectful. I have stayed at the Scarlet many times over the years, and cannot understate how much I’ve enjoyed each and every time. Location is wonderful, very close to Chinatown and only a few stops away from most attractions on the MRT. To Jos, Samantha and the chaps behind the reception desk (sorry we didn’t get all your names), thanks so much for an excellent visit to your beautiful hotel and country, see you again soon!

title: Outstanding
desc: I hardly ever write reviews but I had to for The Scarlet Hotel. The service at this hotel was outstanding. We would stay there again purely for that. We also loved being able to meet in the Opulence Room. The location was also great being close to the MRT and Chinatown. Thank you Samantha, Faizz, Nabita, Jos, Joyce, Ayub and all the staff. You guys rock 👏👏👏

title: Wonderful stay, highly recommended
desc: A wonderful and very comfortable stay. The bed and pillows gave me a very restful sleep after a long flight and the complimentary drinks and snacks were greatly appreciated. Frizz was so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble and I felt very valued in my stay. I will definitely visit again. The location so close to the vibrant Maxwell Food Centre and Chinatown makes the stay fun and convenient.

title: Always a fantastic stay.
desc: It’s been an absolute delight, once again, staying at the Scarlet. We always pick this hotel - and it never fails to impress. This time, the wonderful Faizz, greets us with an absolute smile, and impeccable service making sure we are well accommodated and relaxed throughout our stay. Five stars all the way!

title: THE MAGIC OF SINGAPORE ENHANCED BY OUR STAY AT THE SCARLET
desc: ENJOYED OUR STAY VERY MUCH. MADE TO FEEL MOST WELCOME BY FAIZZ, PRIYA, NABILA AND PRIYA. EVERYONE WAS MOST HELPFUL AND CORDIAL. SITUATION GREAT - NEAR BUSSTOP AND UNDERGROUND. WOULD READILY RECOMMEND IT. MANDJ - SOUTH AFRICA

title: Great hotel stay
desc: Great location — easy walking distance to Duxton Hill’s restaurants and bars and Chinatown. Great service too. A special thank you to Nabila who checked us in and made our room even more special for my husband’s birthday at very short notice.

title: Great Stay in the heart of Singapore
desc: Faizz and his front desk team were super friendly and efficient, they could not do enough to ensure my stay was pleasant and comfortable. The rooks are well appointed and very comfortable. Great central location. In all, a great choice of places to stay.

title: Great Service!
desc: Service was great! Had an early check in. Room was nice enough for a night trip. Was assisted by Faizz throughout my stay. From check-in to check-out. Best part was probably post check-out. I returned to the hotel from a business meeting hot and sweaty, and Faizz directed me to the Soda room upstairs to wash up at the shower with towels, soap etc before i make my way to the airport. Great service!

title: Really nice and personal hotel
desc: This is a really nice place to stay. The team is very friendly and the rooms are comfortable and well equipped. There are also lots of nice touches such as a free mini bar with a selection of drinks and snacks. The location of the hotel is also good, lots of things are easily walkable and you're just yards from the excellent tube station.

title: Overall satisfied and it was OK
desc: The check in was smooth and fast. We were allocated to a room quickly and staff were very friendly and always smiling. The Room is quite tiny. Not really enough space if you have two big pieces of luggage with you - but not big of a problem for us since we were mostly outside exploring. Unfortunately, the room is super noisy. The windows to the street have no nearly no isolation, and you can't open them to let fresh air inside. If you have someone walk past your door, you can hear them like if they were in your room. I don't know if there were guests next to our room, but if yes - we couldn't hear them. The bed is not comfy. The mattress is very hard, and we had back pain when we woke up in the morning (We're not old :D) One very big plus was that the mini bar was free!

title: Beautiful boutique hotel
desc: We stayed here for my partners 40th birthday for a weekend in Singapore and it was fantastic! The hotel is in a great spot with parking very nearby and Maxwell road and Club street very short walking distances away. We had the gorgeous lavish suite for our stay and it was comfortable and well equipped. The bed was fabulous and perks such as the minibar being restocked every day were the icing on the cake. I used the gym and although it was small, it had everything I needed. The hotel is beautiful, boutique and stylish. We absolutely would stay here again. Special mention to the fab staff who could not do enough for us whilst we stayed - they were lovely. Especially Jocelyn who checked us in and helped us carry our bags to our room and waved us off on check out - she was

title: Amazing
desc: Everything was amazing, very accommodating and helpful staff, special thank you to Samantha at the front desk for all her help. Rooms where immaculate and great value for money on all aspects of our stay.

title: Outstanding stay
desc: Exceptional service and ideal location made this a perfect stay and highly recommend it. We arrived at the hotel at 6am and welcomed by Faiz Abdul at front desk. He took client experience and raised the bar to another level. Faiz’s positive energy, patience, and passion for service was exemplary. Faiz couldn’t do enough to make our stay more memorable for which we are grateful. Friendly and approachable staff no matter what position they were in always greeting you as they passed by or willing to assist. Was great to meet Mega and Jocelyn amongst others too. Hotel is in an ideal location. Steps away from MRT, Maxwell Hawker Centre, Chinatown, Temples and so much more. Room was very clean and had everything we needed including very comfortable bed/pillows. The complimentary

title: An extremely comfortable, well-placed hotel with character
desc: This hotel is superbly sited for exploring Singapore, within walking distance of two tube stations and near to a BigBusTours stop. A food court is close by to satisfy your desire for hawker food. Nom ice cream is just down the road and 7 11 round the back. We had a room that faced back over the roofs (quite photogenic) with a little balcony and was very quiet. Well-appointed room and oh so comfortable beds but not much space. Excellent shower. We didn’t explore the bar. No charge on fridge contents. Very helpful friendly staff.

title: Comfortable accommodation in a great location
desc: The Scarlet has lots to recommend it: comfortable bed, beautifully air conditioned throughout, friendly staff and a great location only a couple of minutes’ walk to Chinatown’s eateries. Whilst it’s not the cheapest option, you do get what you pay for!

title: Perfect location
desc: We were at the hotel about 0900, after traveling 24 hrs from the US. Nabila at the front desk greeted us warmly and said our requested room wasn't ready yet, but a "cozier" room on the first floor without a window was. I was a little leery of a small room and no window, but it was absolutely perfect for sleeping soundly, and trying to get over jet lag. Also, a shower after flying all day was heavenly! Everything was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. Nabila was always so friendly and helpful, offering tips on sightseeing, where the local hawkers market was (just across the street!), and where the Metro station was (just down the block. We explored Gardens by the Bay, and since we only had one full day to explore, that had to suffice for now, besides wandering in

title: Scarlet, The Best
desc: This was the best hotel I have stayed at. Nadir and joscelyn were very helpful and made us feel special. We loved the pasta restaurant and the rooftop bar was relaxing. We arrived early and the looked after our luggage and after checkout, the also looked after it until we needed to go to the airport.

title: Great location, friendly staff!
desc: Great location in Chinatown. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. But most importantly is right next to the MRT station. Rooms were clean and super comfortable. Staff was also very friendly and helpful!

title: Amazing!
desc: Amazing service and very accommodating. We asked for an extra bed and they staff helped us out. When we called for room service, the staff was at our door instantly. We definitely recommend this location.

title: Excellent service!
desc: Excellent hotel! The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful. Check in was seamless process and the property was beautiful. Great location if you are trying to visit Maxwell food market or China town.

title: Exemplary service at Scarlet Hotel
desc: Very good accommodation and excellent service! Nice room and clean. There is a welcome red wine, drinks and snacks for us! We were also upgraded to a better room upon arrival! Kudos to your team! We will definitely come back again!

title: I'll be back.
desc: Great experience from the time I walked through the door. Joscelyn and Samantha made sure all my needs were met. Their knowledge of the area made it so much easier for me to see the sites of Singapore. I would definitely stay at the Scarlet again.

title: Couldn’t fault my stay, staff are wonderful and the decor is cute. Can’t wait to come back and stay here again. 5 stars.
desc: Staff are wonderful, I had such a lovely stay and would love to come back. Loved the decor. The food hall located nearby has amazing food choices and it is easy to get around with several stations close by.

title: A lovely stay with a warm welcome
desc: We arrived at the hotel late at night and were greeted at the door with a very warm and friendly welcome from the Guest Relations Manager, Faiz Abdul. He helped us with a couple of issues during our stay and he is highly professional but so caring, he even liaised with airport information staff on our return home when my husband discovered he had lost his phone and he arranged its safe return to us before our flight. We are very grateful and highly impressed by his kindness and helpfulness. The hotel itself is very comfortable and beautifully decorated. It's central to Chinatown with a huge number of shops, bars and restaurants nearby. The beds are very comfortable and the complimentary snacks and drinks in the minibar are a nice added bonus. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at

title: Great Hotel in the heart of China town
desc: We really enjoyed our experience at the Scarlet hotel and our host Nabila could not have been more accommodating. We stayed in suite 101, a spacious room with king bed, free mini bar, smart TV and large bathroom. The hotel is boutique in nature with a classic timeless style. Situated in the heart of China town you are minutes from countless street food vendors, markets, bars and restaurants. The MRT is located less than 100m from the hotel and its only 3 stops to gardens by the bay. There is a lovely roof top bar situated in the hotel and also an Italian restaurant. We stayed for 2 nights and our only regret is that we didn't stay longer!

title: Excellent Location - 2 mins from Tube and a plethora of restaurants - Great Room - Amazing attentive Staff
desc: Great location, Excellent attentive staff, excellent value. Lovely room with balcony - well equipped. Fabulous roof top bar Really good location just a few minutes walk from some amazing restaurants- couldn’t ask for a better location - 2 mins from the underground. Really warm and attentive welcome, receptionist showed us to our room, explained that the mini bar would be replenished each day free of charge and bottle of wine was free - also complementary drinks at the roof top bar. Will return -

title: A classy oasis of calm in Singapore
desc: Perfect location for a great stay if you prefer something a little out of the ordinary . Beige hotel room don’t exist here - and that makes a refreshing change ! As the name suggest - think bold , sexy , luxurious . The hotel is in a converted historical building . Its charm oozes but your comfort is still guaranteed . Very comfortable beds and powerful air con . We asked for a window as I didn’t like the idea of not having natural light . Free mini bar is a pleasant surprise . Location is 2 minutes walk from the famous Maxwell Food Centre ( awesome - and yes the Hainanese chicken is worth queuing for !!). Beside hotel is a gelato shop , bakery , upmarket pizza to go and barber . Across the street is Chinatown . Perfect location but you feel cocooned in your own peaceful

title: Very nice boutique hotel
desc: Great boutique hotel in a excellent location. We had a late flight an ended up checking it at 1:30 am. Ayub Ismail was working the front desk and checked us in. He was the best. Helped us with our bags when we got out of the taxi, checked us in really fast then helped us with our bags to our room. Great guy and very professional. Hotel is very nice. Rooms our small but extremely clean and quaint. Hope this review helps. LB

title: Nabila outstanding personalized service!
desc: We can highly recommend the Scarlet Hotel. We are welcomed by Nabila and her warm welcome and outstanding service we will never forget! She made it her mission to make our stay the best ever. After one day she memorized all our names (group of 14). She was able to get all our questions and needs covered. Thank you so much Nabila! We wish you all the best, till next time!

title: Very well situated boutique hotel.
desc: We picked this hotel because of the location which was fine. The hotel itself was a bonus. Our room was generous, comfortable and clean. With a late evening flight departure we were especially pleased with the changing rooms and shower after we had checked out and been sight seeing. A chance to freshen up before the journey. All the staff were helpful, it happened that we saw more of Nabila on the desk. She was wonderful.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in excellent location
desc: Hotel occupies a lovely historic building. We had executive rooms, which were very comfortable. Attractive decor throughout. We’ll appointed bathroom. Comfortable bed. Complementary wine and mini bar. Efficient and helpful staff. The location is excellent for restaurants, bars, China Town shops and public transport links. Overall highly recommended.

title: Nice and Cousy. Very well located.
desc: Nice and cosy. Bed is extremely comfortable. Special thank you to Joscelyn in reception for such a kind and nice service, she is so friendly and helpful. Hotel is very well located. Nice Cafes around.

title: Great Hotel - beautiful staff and great location.
desc: The hotel is spectacular. It's in a great location to access Chinatown and the local food markets. The staff are friendly and very helpful. We got there early from a cruise and they let us check in at 10am and also provided a 2pm checkout for our late flight. Current deal includes a free mini bar with drinks and a couple of beers. 10 out of 10

title: Great hotel near China Town
desc: Super friendly & helpful staff, free mini bar was exceptional, great location next to Maxwell MRT & Hawker center. Only a few minutes walk to China Town, Marina Gardens & Clarke Quay 2 stops so perfect location. Good size room and comfy bed, what's not to like! Breakfast, not good at all. This is provided by third party within the same building, personally I bought some pastries from a brilliant artisan baker just next door or you could go to Maxwell Hawker center but if you want a big international buffet breakfast you will be disappointed.

title: Charming hotel, charming staff
desc: A charming, clean and quiet hotel in a great area of Singapore, it's a bit quirky as the building is curved and on a hill so walking the halls is odd as they are sloped (we were on 2A and there was a 2B) and not all rooms have a window but a skylight instead, which didn't bother us. The front desk staff especially Nabila were great and very helpful, they graciously gave us cold water everytime we came back from an outing looking hot and tired. The area is walkable and lots to see and do nearby and within a 2 minute walk of the subway. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, we very much enjoyed our stay here.

title: A wonderful stay!
desc: I had a lovely stay at the Scarlet. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. I enjoyed the selection in the complimentary mini bar. I particularly enjoyed the professionalism of the staff who were very friendly and helpful. Joscelyn was a stand out for me. She helped me take photos in the lobby and offered me help with laundry, taxis and even an umbrella! The location of the hotel was also really convenient for exploring China town and very close to the MRT. I hope to return.

title: Quaint ,great location.
desc: Quaint boutique hotel, comfy,convienent and close to much much more. We walked to many sites, and was real close to the train to other parts of the city. lots of food choices around.A lot of construction was the only down fall ,for noise.

title: 2 Exceptional Nights in Singapore
desc: Perfectly located to get to everything that makes Singapore so great, The Scartlet is a charming hotel with well appointed rooms and an Excellent staff. Nabila was especially thoughtful and professional as she helped us navigate the neighborhood and anticipated our needs ably. There are literally dozens of shops, restaurants and bars within 10 minutes walk and are even right around the corner from one of the best hawker centres in the city. They even offer a shower/change station for your use well after checkout if you have a late flight out (we checked out at 1 but came back at 7:30 to change and freshen up before our 11:30 departure). Would recommend unreservedly to both business and leisure travellers.

title: Superb hotel in a prime location
desc: The hotel has really a cool vibe, very clean and well maintained. The location is fantastic, it's a 5 minute walk to the Maxwell Food Centre (hawker stands), Chinatown and/or the subway. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the complimentary mini bar/snacks were refilled daily. Our room only had a skylight so I was worried I would feel claustrophobic but it never felt dark in there at all. The room had a wardrobe, (bolted down) safe, TV, minibar, snacks and the bathroom has toiletries and good lighting. The staff are the real key here, simply fantastic and a special shout out to Nabila at the Front Desk who helped us navigate transit options and was always smiling. I would highly recommend and definitely stay here again if in Singapore.

title: Stylish boutique hotel close to Chinatown
desc: As a mature solo woman traveller I found the Scarlet Singapore a stylish boutique hotel with great service and friendly, helpful staff. I stayed there as a stopover and return on my travels to Europe. The location is fabulous - close to Chinatown. Within walking distance to a wonderful Buddhist temple, great eateries and shopping. I would definitely stay here again. Staff always willing to help. A big thank you to Jocelyn who made my stay comfortable. Very helpful around all my questions and needs around the surrounding area and transfer to the airport.. Thank you.

title: Great location. The perfect boutique stay in Singapore!!
desc: Just completed my stay at The Scarlet in Singapore and I absolutely loved everything about this hotel. The quirky design, the location, the service. Everything was spot on. It’s right by China town so there’s plenty of restaurants and bars within a minutes walk so the location was perfect!! The MRT is really local which helps getting around the city. The hotel itself and the rooms have a great design and the service was fantastic. Staff were very welcoming on the front desk! The sheets were really soft and clean! The bathroom is beautiful! A perfect Boutique stay! I would definitely recommend to stay here and I look forward to staying again on my next visit!

title: Super Clean and conveniently located - 100% would recommend.
desc: This is the best hotel I have visited in Singapore with super clean sheets and bathroom. The reception, Feizz helped switched our Executive room from a double bed to a room with twin beds, which ended up being more spacious and would check in on us whenever he saw us. The wifi is strong and air conditioning remains on when you leave the room. The service is impeccable and location wise is right across the street from Maxwell Center and Maxwell train stop. Would 100% recommend.

title: A pleasant enough, comfortable but different' hotel in a great location
desc: The hotel is in an excellent location in Chinatown and within walking distance of Marina Bay etc. although the MRT is very close by if needed. You also have the 'famous' Maxwell Hawker Centre at the end of the road for authentic cheap eats. We'd checked in very early one Sunday and, despite notifying the hotel of our arrival time, it was a while before anyone, other than cleaners, were available to check us in. Not the friendliest of check-in staff, we were, eventually, offered a room that we could take immediately and the early check-in cost was waivered for which we were very grateful. It's such an unusual hotel in that the bedrooms are above the terrace of retail outlets that go down the hill (to the hawker centre) from the reception at the top. Not surprisingly, the décor

title: Amazing amazing amazing.
desc: Faizz is so amazing. Stellar service and amazing attention to detail. We are having an amazing anniversary. Gave me a new found love for boutique hotels. I’ve never had someone so passionate and happy to work - definitely one of the scarlet hotels greatest assets

title: Excellent Service and Professional Staff!
desc: Wonderful stay at Scarlet Singapore! The receptionist that handled me, Ayub, made me feel very welcome. Also kudos to the staff for helping to decorate the room for my girlfriend's bday. The hotel was nice and clean, the room we got was spacious with a high elevated ceiling and the bed was very comfortable. Will definitely consider coming back again ¨̮

title: Highly recommend
desc: Hotel was great. Love the decor, very romantic and moody. Very clean and service was great. Very attentive to customers and customers was a very lovely and fun stay. Very close walking distance to all the cafes and pubs and restaurants in China town.

title: A Nice Stay
desc: Just had a 4 night stay at The Scarlet and found it to be the perfect location to explore China Town and its surrounds. Walking distance to a multitude of restaurants etc plus the MRT is close by. Our room was smallish but was not an issue as we spent little time there other than sleeping in the very comfortable bed. Staff were all extremely friendly and obliging. We'll be returning.

title: Great stay in this lovely boutique hotel.
desc: We all very impressed with the Scarlet, all our rooms were lovely and each one a little quirky. We had very minor problem with the alocation of the two rooms we had booked through an agent where we had booked two twin bed rooms because my wife and her daughter would be in one and myself and her father in the other. This was dealt with very quickly by the manager Mr Ayub Ismail by upgrading my room to a twin. There was a complimentory mini bar stocked each day and a bottle of wine in each room. The Hotel is situation in Chinatown and now 500 mtrs from a new MTR station called Maxwell. If en route south we would definitely stay in the Scarlet again.

title: Great all rounder hotel
desc: We booked last minute for the Scarlett hotel and we were very impressed. Nice comfortable hotel and the staff were very friendly. Close to the major sights to see and in the heart of Chinatown. Highly recommend 👌

title: Now we’d never stay anywhere else!
desc: What weary travelled doesn’t want to be checked in with a bottle of chilled water, a smiling face and the words “complementary mini bar”? Our spacious room was cool and comfortable and the bathroom well equipped with toiletries. This lovely authentic hotel in Chinatown is so handy for public transport and restaurants. A fantastic food court is just minutes away and the rooftop bar well worth a visit. We were so well looked after we would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Would definitely stay here again.
desc: Arrived at the hotel tired and sweaty and walking in through the front door was like a cool breeze from the super strong aircon, it was fantastic. From the super helpful front desk staff who helped me with everything including arranging a last minute covid test for onward flights to the way they agreed to give me more towels because the robes are too small for anyone but those who are ummm of "asian sizing" ... I could barely fit the robes onto my arms let alone cover my shoudlers! All in all the hotel room, amenities and stay was fantastic with the miniature robes being the only tiny if at all niggling issue which if you think about it is quite funny. Also the location is amazing, just behind Maxwell food centre a great hawker centre and also next to Chinatown, you can't ask

title: Superb staff in a stunning old Singapore hotel
desc: Such an interesting place to stay, in a great location. Staff were so helpful and bent over backwards to help whenever possible. Unfortunately the jacuzzi did not have water in it, but that did not taint our stay. If you are looking for a more traditional place to stay in Singapore, look no further!

title: Good experience, as advertised
desc: Overall, my wife and I were quite happy with our stay here. The rooms/accommodations are just about as advertised -- a bit on the smaller side, but with relatively modern finishings, good air conditioning/temp control, etc. The staff was quite friendly and really helpful. The location in Chinatown was great, really close to the train station, a number of hawker centres, some really great bars, and more.

title: Responsive customer service
desc: Very good customer service from Ayub on reception after an initial disappointment with our room. The executive room we were allocated did not match expectations from descriptions and photos on Booking.com. Ayub swiftly changed our room with minimal fuss to our satisfaction. Thank you.

title: Very nice, authentic hotel in an excellent location in Singapore
desc: Very nice and authentic hotel in Singapore Chinatown. We arrived from Bali for a three day stopover and chose this hotel because of its perfect location for visiting the city of Singapore. Faizz welcomed us with a very warm and friendly checkin and explained everything of the hotel and the surrounding area. The hotel has a very beautiful and authentic décor and a rooftop bar with a magnificent view, especially in the evening. We would book the Scarlett again immediately and without hesitation!

title: The Best Location in Singapore
desc: This was our 3rd visit to Singapore and the Scarlet Hotel became our top pick for walking and exploring – just minutes by foot to a Hop On, Hop Off stop, a hawker food court, the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple, Chinatown and its street market and ATMs, Ann Sang Hill Park and literally hundreds of unique restaurants. The staff was cordial and sincerely wanting to please, especially Duty Manager, Puvan and the Guest Relations Manager, Ayub. The hotel has a quirky layout having been converted from early row stores, but that’s what makes it charming. And our executive level room gave us all sorts of amenities like a complimentary bottle of wine and daily restocked minibar, slippers, robes, an umbrella, even two tooth brushes with tooth paste and more. I would give this boutique hotel a

title: Great hotel in great location
desc: Great boutique hotel near Chinatown and Maxwell MRT. Various levels of rooms. We where in ground floor with room sans window which didn’t worry us as not spending any time in hotel room. Rooftop bar in hotel which was unfortunately reserved for private function Very comfortable beds. Taxi to airport cost $33.70 which appeared to be set price as meter not running. Reception at hotel told us taxi would cost $15 to $20.

title: Wonderful guest experience
desc: Such a great place to stay for a quick trip to Singapore! Excellent location right next to MRT station and Maxwell Food Centre Faizz at the front desk was such a gem, gave us amazing recommendations and so friendly. The room was nice and dark to help with the jet lag !

title: Great stay
desc: Really enjoyed our stay at the uniquely styled Scarlet Hotel, excellent comfortable room with free mini bar. Great location, close to Chinatown, Maxwell MRT and Maxwell Food Market. There is lovely French Style Patisserie La Grigne adjacent to The Scarlet

title: Scarlett Hotel is A1
desc: Whilst the decor might be a little dates the hotel exceeded all my expectations. The bed was comfortable the room was clean. The free mini bar was appreciated. The staff were all extremely polite and welcoming. If you like hawker food the fact that the Maxwell centre is next door is a bonus. Shirt walk into chine town or an MRT station 20 mtrs away.

title: Nice and tiny boutique hotel.
desc: Excellent hotel. Very good location close to Chinatown and MRT. Very friendly personnel. If you are looking for a specious room you might be wrong, but we knew it when we booked it. Has become our preferred hotel when in Singapore.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in great location
