desc: Location great Access great Well recognised by cab drivers People great Cleanness great Drainage no-problem Room size decent Satisfying overall but lighting in no-window rooms could be improved. Except that, definitely a hotel worth coming back.

title: Fantastic location
desc: The best point about this hotel is it’s location. It is surrounded by great bars, restaurants and easy walking to many attractions - Maxwell hawker centre, Chinatown, Marina bay, shopping malls and more. Unfortunately the hotel was a let down in a few areas. 1. Room size, we were upgraded which was lovely. Unfortunately the executive room we were given was tiny. Too small for two people. As we were traveling for three weeks we had two cases and carry bags. There was just no room to store things. I completely get that the hotel is converted from shops and the size comes from this. With that in mind I would recommend to single travellers. 2. Avoid breakfast. We had it included in our booking. There is not a good selection. Both times we had breakfast it was only us and one

title: Top choice in Singapore
desc: We booked the Scarlet due to its very good TripAdvisor reviews and we weren’t disappointed. Singapore is an expensive city but I thought it was very reasonably priced. The rooms are comfortable and well finished and the staff are extremely friendly. Location is good in the heart of busy Chinatown with Maxwell Road hawker market literally right opposite the hotel. It’s about 20/25 minute (easy) walk to the Marina Bay and there is an MRT station less than 5 mins away (Chinatown). There is a small gym which we used a couple of times. Our flight was very late and when we went back to collect our bags we were given the opportunity to shower and freshen up which was really appreciated. One of the other really helpful extras was a device called a Handy. Basically a mobile phone with

title: Nice hotel
desc: Nice hotel in a good location. Beautiful lobby, very good customer service, cool rooftop bar. Rooms are extremely small! Not comfortable for two people. Had issues with hair dryer in the room. They tried their best to be helpful. Overall, disappointing for a Small Luxury Hotel, as we have stayed in others (Nice and Antwerp) that were spectacular!

title: Great location with style
desc: I stayed here on a stopover with many other options to hand , I chose here. It is a great building and has so much character and in built style . The rooms are very clean and minimal. I had a ground or below ground floor so no window but it’s fine for helping you sleep. It’s one of the best value hotels in Singapore and I would stay there again. Close to transport and walking distance to most of the cultural spots of the city it’s a no brainer

title: China Town option
desc: Great location and something different if used to larger properties, disappointed that although I booked and paid for 4 premier rooms, I was advised at check-in that mini bar was not included in rate. It also seems that we all didn't get the premier rooms we booked and were downgraded without explanation or refund. We were grateful of the early check-in though of most of our rooms.

title: Very unhappy
desc: Worst bed I’ve ever slept on. My wife and I suffered severe back pain and spasms on our first night. When checking out the next day, the attempts to fix this issue included being upgraded to a room with a coffee machine, or having a duvet put on the bed. Not acceptable. Also, the level of noise from nearby traffic at night was very loud. Finally, even though the room was booked directly with the hotel, they would not assist with any form of refund so we lost $2000 when we had to leave and book another hotel. Very disappointing.

title: Excellent service, immaculate hotel
desc: Excellent service, immaculate hotel. Rooms are small but tastefully decorated. Staff were exceptional. Super helpful staff. Great location near china town. Lots of bars and restaurants within very short walk. 15 min walk to MRT. Two stops to financial business distract

title: Location and charm
desc: Love this place. Fantastic location in the heart of Chinatown. Friendly people at the hotel but mostly it is just full of charm and cheeky character. I am not sure what the building used to be but it now has a quite fun and cheeky feel to it... like a range of Boudoirs (all done very tastefully). I thought it was reasonably priced. We arrived very early around 9 pm but they were very accomodating and allowed us access to our room straight away which made a massive difference to our day. Would certainly stay here again.

title: Luxury
desc: I stayed at SWANK. Not big but very cozy. Maybe too small for a family though. The staffs were very professional and supportive. Unfortunately I could not try the bar on top because it was occupied by a private party.

title: Great location, comfortable enough
desc: The location is really well situated in a food and nightlife hub, with both 'Food Street' and the Maxwell Food Hall barely one or two blocks away, as well as a bar street with rooftop bars. It's perfect if you want to have a night exploring the great pubs, bars, restaurants, and street food in Singapore. The hotel itself is alright... lots of character, comfy bed, big room, good free wifi, mini fridge, clean, and big bathroom. Lovely greeting with a glass of guava juice, and staff were lovely. However we had a few issues. Firstly, the room was quite dungeon-like as it only had a few small windows up high near the ceiling. We hadn't known we were paying for a semi-underground room. Secondly, the room was FREEZING (they'd blasted the aircon as cold as it'd go) and even when we

title: Near to FOOD PLACES!
desc: This is a boutique hotel. It is located across Maxwell Hawker Centre. Can grab really delicious hawker food there. Must try the iconic chicken rice. You won't miss it there is always a line. This hotel is also near Chinatown where you can eat authentic Singaporean food, even chili crab!!! Behind Scarlet are the night out places of Singapore. There are many clubs and nice restaurants there. The location is superb if you love to eat!

title: Luxury for all
desc: This hotel is so decadent and beautiful you will never want to leave! We stayed for 3 nights as we were flying from London to Bali but wanted to experience Singapore and the Scarlet was amazing. The decor is stunning, loads of rich colours like deep red and smooth dark purple, it felt very luxurious and plush! We stayed in a double deluxe room and it was perfect, massive bed with a big bathroom and plenty of room for our luggage. There is also a rooftop jacuzzi which has a beautiful view of the city! The breakfast was nice but didn’t have much choice for vegans unfortunately, but plenty of food for vegetarians and meat eaters. The hotel is situated directly opposite Maxwell Hawker centre which is a huge food arcade with all kinds of Singaporean delights. So this is brilliant

title: Sumptuous Scarlet Stay
desc: We arrived very early Sunday morning, although we were unable to check-in the helpful staff took our luggage and directed us to a shower we could use until our room was ready. This was at the back of the hotel, so we didn't hear any construction noises. It was very comfortable, with good air conditioning and a nice big shower in the bathroom. The lounge areas were lavishly decorated and comfortable too. A fabulous location, near Chinatown, for fabulous street food, with three different metro stations to choose from. A lovely start to our trip!

title: Lovely stay for our wedding anniversary
desc: I came here before but this is the first time staying and I just love the decor.. Makes the hotel really lush! Still very well maintained and the staff is very friendly too. I stayed in a suite called Splendor and it was really nice although its a little odd shaped but you need to remember this is a shop house structure! The bathroom was huge with a jacuzzi function bathtub and a separate rain shower. As this is a boutique hotel, I enjoyed the room with complimentary minibar of chips and drinks as well and some traditional biscuits for my wedding anniversary! The location is great as it is near alot of restaurants and bars and even a food centre! Overall, nice place to stay although there is the construction of the MRT line just opposite.. They even provide ear plugs which was

title: Awful
desc: There is construction work directly opposite the hotel that goes on throughout the night. The management did NOT inform me of this when booking. I cannot sleep. Sound insulation is zero. YOU NEED TO INFORM PEOPLE IN ADVANCE THAT IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO SLEEP. My actual room is disappointingly small. Staff are very nice but nothing can make up for putting guests in a room with the full knowledge that sleep will be impossible. Look at the photos. The time is clear and it’s unacceptable.

title: Fantastic hotel!!
desc: I have stayed at several boutique hotels in Singapore and this one was by far the best. It is located right next to Chinatown, Maxwell Food Court, and Club Street so there are lots of sightseeing and food choices. I was working in the CBD and it was a very quick 10 minute door-to-door walk to work. The hotel itself was very charming and the rooms were very well appointed--clean, large, open, and tasteful. The bed was very comfortable as well. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating and took care of all my needs immediately. I stayed there two weeks and was sorry to leave. Anyone coming to Sg should check this place out as you can't beat it!!

title: Great Boutique Hotel
desc: Great location, very close to China town and extremely close to Maxwell hawker food centre where you can find amazing chicken rice (just expect lines at the Anthony Bourdain visited Tian Tian chicken rice stall). Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Calling a taxi usually only takes 2-5 minutes. A bit of a walk away from the MRT train station; so recommend a taxi if you have large luggage. Very cool they converted old store fronts into hotel rooms. Some disagreed with this, but I liked it. AC works amazing! and fridge in room actually works! unlike other hotels we've been to in Singapore at budget prices. Our room was quite spacious and especially the bathroom; lots of counter space! 2 twin bed room on main floor with a tiny basement like window for some natural light. Will

title: Nice and personal hotel, well located to explore the city
desc: Nice and personal hotel, well located to explore the city: China town is a minute away, even the Fullerton Bay is in walking distance, as we walked to Little India as well. The hotel stuff always is very friendly and helpful. Especially the smartphone for internet access, guiding, and travel assistance, which is available at every room is a great idea.

title: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic city
desc: Take tour time to visit Chinatown The scarlet hotel is the best choise. Italian restaurant is very good. Hotel personnel very kind. Clean and quite. City Tours available at the right price at hotel reception

title: Visit to Singapore for 50th Birthday
desc: Hi , check in hotel ,we explained it was my partners 50th and they gave us upgrade on our room free of charge, rooms were styled beautifully , with attention to detail for everything , great location in China town , used the Jacuzzi at the end of day , also you can use this area on your last day once you have checked out to get showered and changed before going to airport

title: Passion Suite
desc: I saw this boutique hotel being highly recommended on Trip Advisor. So I decided to try it with my bf for a 1 night stay. The hotel seems very sophisticated, with beautiful furnitures. Upon closer look, it is not very well maintained. Patches of paint touch up was clearly evident. The room has quite abit of things to repair/maintain as shown in the pictures below. The jacuzzi is the only highlight of the room. But the jacuzzi is outdoors and on the right side there is some construction works going on for 24/7. Lucky the yard glass door is sound proof so it doesn't affect our sleep. Overall, I would give it a 3.5/5. I won't come back again as this amount of money I can stay at MBS room or other higher end hotel.

title: 5 Star Service
desc: The service was 5 stars. Great and Cozy Room. TV needs the upgrade. The location is in the center of everything especially China town Hipster Bars just around the coner Thank you to Jenny and Russell for red carpet service during the stayed Dan Poung

title: Great position
desc: Whilst not the cheapest place to stay its position is excellent - 5mins from China town and with very helpful staff We stayed in a premier room on the ground floor - very spacious but only one window too high to see through Robes and slippers provided Large bathroom too with full range of toiletries Would go back

title: Great location, price and service
desc: Clean and well positioned room, excellent price for location and amenities. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Room was air-conditioned and wifi was useful. Only thing is that there were no windows in our room which may impact the stay for some. We loved it as we could sleep and rest.

title: Great little hotel with great location in Chinatown
desc: We had a room with no windows but that was probably a good thing as it was very quiet. Check in was good, room was very nicely decorated like the rest of the hotel - all very scarlet! Bed and pillows very comfy The only negative thing was that the room was very cold even without the air conditioning but with extra quilt it was perfect Lots of eating around, with Maxwell Road food centre next door. Good hotel

title: A fantastic hotel with very central location
desc: A very lovely boutique hotel which is close to Chinatown and the bar area. High recommended as it is very good value for money for what it is. If you are less mobile, do let the hotel know in advance as not all the rooms are close to the lift and it could be a long walk

title: 유쾌하고 맛있는 경험!
desc: Actually I was so tired cuz of lots of walks but this place made me happy. Foods are delicious and the shapes of cocktails are gorgeous. Indeed my wife loved here. I got a luckily discount and left me good memories 맛있게 잘먹었습니다 힘들엇는데 덕분에 좋은 경험 남기고가요 칵테일 너무맛있고 예뻤습니다 별다섯개드립니다 행복하세요

title: Great location, good value for Singapore
desc: The location is simply the best- a short walk to the MRT, a lovely street that's not too noisy and all the character of Chinatown. Right opposite the back entrance to the Maxwell Hawker centre where we had breakfast each morning for a quarter the cost of breakfast in the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well. Helpful reception staff and a charming heritage building in a street full of similar buildings. We expected the room to be small but it was big enough for our needs. We had asked for a balcony room so at least we had windows but it was usually too hot to want to be outside. The bathroom was ok but the door had opaque glass and so the light shone directly onto the head of the bed when turned on. As I lay in bed I could see the outline of my husband on the

title: Great staff, good location, small rooms
desc: On arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful (as they were the whole time), the lobby looked exactly like the photos online and we received a nice welcome drink.When we reached our room I was surprised by how small it was, although our previous room on the same trip was a suite so I guess that didn’t help.We’d upgraded to an Executive room with a balcony, so no idea what the standard rooms are like. There is just about space to make a cup of tea.The bathroom was basic, cleaning not bad but a bit rough round the edges, which may be more a case of needing a refresh. The worst thing was the bathroom door, as majority of it is a frosted panel that offers no privacy, particularly as the toilet is directly opposite the door and the door is just a couple of feet from the

title: Boutique hotel with friendly and professional staff
desc: Great location close to many attractions. The rooms are small but clean. If you need anything, the staff is friendly and eager to assist. Nana met us at check in and was very professional as with others. Quick in response to your hotel needs. Have stayed there before and other hotels in Singapore. This is my favorite hotel. We look forward to our next stay here.

title: A great location, and unique beautiful rooms
desc: This is a great place to stay, with quirky interesting room decor, each one unique. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the location is great - pretty much anything you need in easy walking distance.

title: Good location in a smaller hotel
desc: The hotel was in an ideal situation near to Chinatown. Walkable to all sights. Pleanty of restaurants near by. The rooms are small so would recommend paying to have a balcony. Can be noisy but this was due to new station being built. The hotel told us in advance and provided ear plugs. We did not find it a problem. They provided a smart phone to enable maps etc when walking around the city, very good extra.

title: Great value for the location
desc: The Scarlet is the perfect place to stay for a night or two while you are exploring Singapore. The value for the quality of the room as well as the location is hard to beat. I'd definitely suggest getting a room other than the basic so you have some natural light coming into your room through either a skylight and/or window. The hotel is well equipped with a rooftop bar, gym access and really everything you need in a hotel room. The location is close to multiple hawker centres and is a quick walk to the Chinatown Metro Station which can really get you anywhere in the city pretty quickly. The staff is helpful and will help make your stay as comfortable as they can. Definitely recommend if you're looking to not pay too much for accommodation but still get a good hotel.

title: Very nice hotel
desc: Really nice decor and bed was very comfortable. Location was good with lots of choices around. Will recommend to others. Offered late check out due to later check in as room was not ready. Small hotel but a comfortable size bathroom and bed

title: GREAT SERVICE and Location
desc: We were greeted by Nana, nite desk professional, with open arms, a cold towel and easy check in after 24 hours of travel. Room, bed, bath and amenities were lovely. Enjoyed location near Chinatown and great food stands. On quiet street. Entire staff was warm, friendly, helpful and professional. We received near Ritz service with this team. We will return to the Scarlet.

title: Sadly not quite what it used to be
desc: I used to stay at the Scarlet back in 2005 and it was a glorious experience, staff were all very well trained and obviously proud of the place, the bedding and design were over-specced for the price, it was just a wonderful, bold experience for guests. Right now it feels a bit lost, there has clearly been refurbishment and yet there seems to have been slightly less attention to design and detail and even in the way the windows have been haphazardly nailed shut in the room I stayed in...not quite the same Scarlet as I loved in my previous visits. The hotel is in need of better maintenance...things like the shower door not closing, the wall holder for the shower head not being the right size, the grouting around the sink being uneven and dirty looking and even the wallpaper

title: Birthday Staycation
desc: I've booked the Passion Suite for a birthday surprise for my dad, and the Scarlet team did a wonderful job of decorating the room. I am so impressed. Good job Scarlet team. They also gave a birthday cheer when my dad came to the frontdesk. I would like to thank Jenny, Idah, Russell. That made my Dad smiled with embarassement!!

title: Romantic rooms recommended for couples
desc: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Opulent Suite for a night and we were very pleased with our stay. The interior is spacious and grand. There was even an outdoor balcony. Additionally, there is also a jacuzzi in the hotel which we didn’t had the time to use. Would definitely come back here again and would highly recommend this place for couples who are looking for a romantic stay. For tourists, the hotel is of walking distance to attractions in Chinatown and many eateries. It is also of walking distance to nearby nightlife at Club Street and Ann Siang Hill.

title: Good things comes in small packages
desc: Location is just perfect for a family holiday, within walking distance to the The Chinatown, bus stops, and other major tourist hotspot, rooms are fairly small, but very clean and boutique, Suitable for individuals and families staying over in Singapore Overall Rating 9/10

title: Friendly Staff and Cosy Stay
desc: Booked the Passion Suite for a staycation with my girlfriend to celebrate a special occasion. The Service We requested for early check in but reached the hotel even earlier, during the wait the staff served us welcome drink and politely apologized for letting us wait while they inspect and clean the room even though it wasn't really their fault when we were the one reaching there too early. The staff also helped us on how to use some of the controls in the room eg for curtains, lights and Jacuzzi. The Room The room was clean and spacious as seen in the picture, there wasn't much noise from the area which was quite surprising considering its surrounded by pubs and opposite chinatown. Conclusion Would definitely introduce my friends and family for the friendly service,

title: Wonderful staycation stay
desc: A warmest welcome at reception, were served with welcome drink while waiting for our room (obviously, we are early). It caught my first impression that the interior looks much pretty than was expected after seeing exterior (building). Booked Passion room, come with its own jacuzzi. Room was big enough, feel so cosy and comfortable. It come with complimentary snacks and drinks. The hotel was not far from chinatown point, short walking distance. Very convenient and easy access to places we want to go. Overall,had a great staycation stay with my boyfriend. Both of us enjoyed ourselves.

title: Charming hotel with excellent staff
desc: We had a small with just a roolight, but who cares when you spend so little time in it anyway. It was very comfortable and had all the necessary facilities. Staff were very helpful and answered all our questions and queries and provided good advice too. Hotel is very convenient for Chinatown and for walking around in Singapore, great location. Didn't get yo use the rooftop bar as there were private functions the first two nights and then it rained on our last night - something to go back and visit, along with lots of other things, next time. Definitely would stay again.

title: Very Friendly Staffs!
desc: 27-Oct-18 "First time checking in to The Scarlet SG, it was close to Halloween, the whole place looks very classy with the red carpets that happens to fit the theme. Greeted with a warm welcome by the staffs~ We booked a Deluxe Room, the interior was small, but very clean. It is close to the Maxwell market as well as the 7-11, so you can look for food just close by. MRT is just a walking distance from the hotel. They provide bathrobes and it feels really comfortable in it due to the thickness of the materials." 6-Dec "I was trying my luck, sending a message to the hotel asking if it is possible to purchase their water bottle cause my dad accidentally threw it away. And it holds a sentimental value to me. Anna J, assisted me with the replies and she was really nice n patient

title: Excellent location for a comfortable and carefree stay
desc: Warm welcome on arrival, then tips and advice on how to get around Singapore. The room was small for two person but who cares if you meet their staff. They are so attentive, treated all the guests very well. As the lounge was occupied, I shared the table with other guests which totally fine with us. We did not personally thanked Jenny whom who used her personal card just to book us a ticket. Excellent service, well trained and authentically helpful, nice and welcoming.

title: Pros and cons
desc: I came to this 4* hotel with my wife and stayed 6 nights in room #308. I would like to start with the cons: Firstly, this has been the smallest room I’ve ever been. And the smallest means less than 12 m2. It was really challenging to move around the room without hitting your knee with any corner of the bed or the furniture. If the room were twice as big, it would be perfect. Also the price... a little bit out of range. Think about this: by the price that you are 6 nights here (breakfast included), you could afford 3 or 4 nights in the luxurious Marina Bay Hotel. Now the pros: This boutique-style hotel is very nicely decorated with carpets and coaches with very vivid colors in the lobby. The location is also a strong point of the hotel. It is located next to one of the most

title: Stunning, absolutely stunning!!!
desc: Superbly located on the edge of Chinatown, with easy access to 2 MRT stations, this boutique hotel is visually stunning with very individual rooms and great decor. They let us shower and change before our room was available and were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Breakfast was excellent, room was well equipped, and I would highly recommend the Scarlett to anyone visiting Singapore.

title: All in!
desc: I had the Chance of staying in the Scarlet for 6 nights and I loved it. The location is perfect if you want to explore Singapore on your own. The building, converted old chinese townhouses, is beautful, the inside design is an eyecatcher and the staff very helpful. That is an advantage of a smaller hotel that they know you faster. But now to the most important topic: the room! I loved mine. A executive one on the third level. Beautiful interieur, absolutely clean, great bed, quite a large bathroom with a shower, water for free, some snacks on the house and a great lightning concept. If you a lot of luggage, the storage might be a problem. Will I be back? Absolutely YES PS: yes, the have rooms without windowns. I have Not Seen them, so I can not say anything about them. But

title: Good Hotel and Location
desc: Excellent boutique hotel in the heart of Chinatown . Superb friend staff , clean tidy rooms superb value for money Thank you Joel for the arrangement for check in and attention. And thank you Po for walking to the room.

title: Perfect!!!
desc: Beautiful hotel with great location and friendly staff. Room was very nice and clean. Bed was big and comfortable. Our departure flight was at midnight, so they provided us a luggage room and shower with all necessities (towels, shower gel). Also, they were very kind to print our boardingpass. I recommend!

title: A colorful hotel, very special building in China Town with ideal location for cheap shopping and chinese dining.
desc: There are countless beautiful and interesting places in Singapore where you can stay. Many choices of Hotels from one star to 5 stars. I have chosen this time for the Scarlet Hotel because of so many things that you can do without spending lots of time for travelling by bus, MRT, taxi and walking. My wife and I live in the Netherlands and love shopping in China Town and Peoples Park. Visitting so many food stalls, including Maxwell street foodstall. Also many restaurants in the streets near the Scarlet Hotel. I have visitted some taylors also in the neighbourhood and for a good price they have made for me silk shirts. We have bought a 3rd suitcase for all the souvenirs we have to take to the Netherlands. The Scarlet Hotel staff are very friendlyand the rooms are clean.On Friday

title: Nice boutique hotel
desc: The hotel is built from a long row of original colonial houses, with friendly staff and a lovely location for exploring Chinatown plus not too far from the other main Singapore attractions. Rooms perhaps a little small but well equipped.

title: Favorite hotel in Singapore!
desc: We love this hotel. We have stayed here twice and its just such a fun place. The rooms are very clean and well appointed and because the hotel is pretty small you never see or hear too many other people. The restaurant attached to the hotel is great, its sort of a homey Italian kitchen. They have great simple breakfasts in the morning and decent drinks in the evening. The hotel is positioned well in the city well being very close to a local Hawker Market and also so many good bars and restaurants. We will be staying here again.

title: Great with a little disappointment
desc: I've stayed here twice before and had very good experiences but this time it just seemed a little lacking. I love boutique hotels and Scarlet is very centrally located and close to a lot of things (MRT, Chinatown, shops, hawker centres). I noticed a lot of details that made me feel the room was a bit tired and needed renovating. Places where the grout had been repaired - badly, mould on the ceiling and a strip of wallpaper to patch up a hole on the wall that was done very badly. Other thing that bothered me which is more architectural was the sky light. There's no way to block out the light and if you are wanting to have a bit of a sleep in, the sky light doesn't help. Overall though it was a good stay however I'm undecided that I will stay here again for a fourth time.

title: Excellent Service Bumped this to 5 stars
desc: I had a red-eye flight from Beijing to Singapore and got to the hotel early morning around 7 or 8 AM. Obviously our room for that night wasn't ready yet, but we let the front desk know it would be greatly appreciated if they would let us know if our room was ready earlier. They saw that my co-worker and I were very tired, so they showed us to a quieter area on the second floor where we could take a nap. One of the managers even came up just to give me the Wifi password, and asked me if I needed anything else. Around 12:30pm our room was ready, and they came to the second floor to let us know immediately and helped us to our room. The staff was always very professional, and friendly and helpful to the extreme. It was a pleasure interacting with them, and I personally really

title: Amazing hotel
desc: The most amazing hotel there is, the service is excellent! The rooms are clean, the location is great! We arrived at the hotel after a long flight and mistakenly forgot a bag in a taxi, the reception girl called nana did everything to help us find the bag, her help was amazing! The best service we have ever received

title: One of a kind gem
desc: I've stayed at the Scarlet a few times when visiting Singapore. As soon as you enter the hotel, it's obvious the Scarlet is a one of a kind gem. Lush boutique vibes, that are reminiscent of an exclusive speak easy. Since it's a historic building, the rooms are quaint and unique. It can get a little noisy on the weekend because the hotel is located around the corner from Club Street. That saying, the best part of the hotel is the location. My favorite areas in Singapore are China Town and Club Street and they are both in walking distance. No taxi needed to go sightseeing and tons of restaurants nearby. Highly recommend!!

title: Best Location
desc: Located behind "Club Street" (know for its restaurants and bars) with little to no "party" noise usually associated with a hotel located so close to all the action. Rooms are somewhat small but the location is well worth it.

title: Special experience
desc: This hotel is unique since it is an historic property repurposed as a hotel. We loved our cozy little room with only a skylight. It was quiet and cleverly designed for smooth efficiency. Special touches like umbrella and a local phone to borrow came in handy. The staff could not have been more helpful. We opted out of breakfast and took a short walk to Chinatown instead. The Chinatown MRT is an easy walk. The street above has interesting restaurants and a local food market is across the street for local food. We will (and have) return.

title: A nightmare
desc: I do not think I've ever been treated as badly as in this hotel. I am aware that sometimes customer requests can not be met but KINDNESS IS FREE, and you should teach to your receptionist (I won't say the name of the 2 ladies because I am not as a sad person as them) that is possible to say no with a smile, and that an Hotel of 4 stars should mantain a Standard and not work on quantity instead of Quality. We have been treated in a mediocre way, nobody has even tried to help us, and every time we get to the reception to ask if finally our room was ready they look at us like beggars and said NO! I will NEVER come back to this Hotel and will NEVER reccomend to nobody. The only lovely Person was the man who hekped us with our luggages, I don't know the Name but he wore eyeglasses,

title: Quirky, unexpected, mystique - excellent service
desc: I loved this boutique hotel ambiance - excellent plush lush colouring, superb subdued music in the background, lemongrass smell. Feature holidays decorations and staff acting according to the holiday theme (it was Halloween). Staff very accommodating, service fast and efficient. I was very impressed with the late night check in efficiency, I was very tired from my flight and staff were prepared and waiting for me. Special thanks to the night shift!

title: Great location, friendly staff
desc: Location: I came looking to try out the hawker markets so the proximity to the Maxwell Road and Chinatown markets was perfect. The hotel is also close to Chinatown nightlife bars and restaurants. I took an early morning walk around the marina and ended up at the Gardens by the Bay. Nothing seems to be very far in Singapore. Room: Small but neat. Nicely furnished. The bed was firm and comfortable. Bathroom won’t be on a postcard but is way better than some places I’ve stayed in. Staff: Exttemely helpful. Tips: Management provide earplugs in the rooms as the hotel is in the vicinity of the under-construction Maxwell MRT station (ready 2021). My room was on the Ann Siang side so I did not hear any construction. One of the nights was a Saturday and there was some noise outside

title: Great location for staying in singapore near at the market and china town near mrt station!
desc: my staycation is superb l! very good accomodation totally clean the staff is kind and polite well trained! i love staying in this hotel hope to get back here soon! ilove the front office staff specialy ms jenny from philippines i wan exhausted because my booking has been cancelled to another hotel, she accomodate me and upgrade to executive room! ilove her and the housekeeping staff as well! the place is so peaceful

title: Extremely Dissapponted
desc: Read glowing reviews before booking here, staff friendly, decor over the top and therefore a little outdated, nowhere did it state that contrary to the pictures, the only natural light would be a frosted pane a foot square. It would be very well worth ensuring you get a room with a window when you book

title: Love love love this hotel
desc: I fell in love with this hotel the moment I walked in the door. Loved the decor, the fact they got into the Halloween spirit and how wonderfully accommodating the staff are. Located near China Town and Bar Road there is lots to do and you don’t need to walk far. The breakfast provided has a great variety and is of an excellent standard. You simply must stay here is you come to Singapore.

title: Great place to stay
desc: Excellent customer service, very friendly, nice and helpful staff specially Jennifer Yakala. The hotel is really beautiful neat and tidy with good atmosphere, very comfortable mattress, pillows and blanket. Highly recommended by Gus and Vangie

title: A lovely romantic exotic hotel
desc: Really enjoyed our stay. After a long haul flight the hotel was welcoming and felt luxurious, but it was reasonably priced. Good access to local sights (Buddha Tooth Relic Temple) and easy to get to from the airport. I had spent a fair amount of time slecting a hotel and was pleased with the results..

title: 31st wedding anniversary in Singapore
desc: The hotel is within the Chinatown area. Maxwell food center and other nice and affordable Chinese restaurants are within walking distance. The hotel personnel are very accommodating. We arrived early but our room was ready before the official check in time. We were given anniversary gifts by Jenny Ribo when I mentioned that we are in Singapore for our wedding anniversary. The staff readily booked taxi for us everytime we go out. Resorts World and Marina Bay Sands are about 10-15 mins away by taxi. My husband and I were very satisfied with our hotel accommodation.

title: Amazing staff & great location
desc: The location is great, lots of bars and restaurants just minutes away. I keep coming back because of the super nice hotel staff. Rooms are big enough and very classy. An excellent choice for business or vacation trip to Singapore.

title: Simply excellent
desc: We stayed at The Scarlet a couple of weeks ago, and found it to be just wonderful. Our room, an Executive with balcony was certainly smallish, but hey have you been to Paris or Venice? And we had a balcony, for we would never go anywhere in the tropics without one: you do need to be outside. The location is excellent, away from the hustle of uptown Singapore, a few steps from the hawker market and the delights of Ann Siang Road. We walked miles from one end of Singapore to the other, knowing that we could come back to our great room in such a great location. The bed, despite soon initial misgivings, was very comfortable, the staff were very good and helpful and, most surprising of all, it was very quiet through the night. We are captivated by shophouse architecture and loathe

title: Very friendly
desc: Great front desk staff made us feel welcome as soon as we walked in. Nothing too much trouble. Nice rooms and decor. A little noisy at times but no more than any other central city location. Close to amazing local food spots, can walk to anywhere. Chinatown only 2 minutes walk away. Loved our stay here.

title: Beautiful hotel in a perfect location for our special occasion
desc: We stayed in the Scarlet for four days over the Grand Prix weekend and loved the experience . It was my husbands 60th birthday and the staff really made a fuss of us and made us feel very special . It is in a perfect location because it’s right on the edge of Chinatown so you have the best and cheapest food and shopping in Singapore on your doorstep. It’s only a five minute walk to the nearest train station or bus stop but we chose to walk everywhere as we were so close to the city centre and the Grand Prix . The hotel itself is lovely , from the moment we walked in we were bowled over by the style and elegance and the friendliness of the staff who were also very helpful. Our room was beautifully decorated and lovely and quiet with a nice comfy bed . We paid extra for a

title: Really Bad experience twice and never again
desc: First visit, TV internet wasn't working as the USB point or whatever explained by the Technician was missing, was quite a hassle and had to change rooms, and second room the mini bar was empty. Very noisy surroundings. Quite a walk to the room as well. This trip room was at the end of the floor and I requested for a room closer to elevators, and I was told by the check-in staff, a gentlemen who very politely told me that all other rooms were blocked for guests checking in later who are staying for a period linger than mine!!!!!! How does this answer my request and make me feel as a guest????? I know that check-in staffs name and if the hotel wants to know, contact me. Both times, I was told that I have to pay for the rooms, when in actual fact, my company settled my room and

title: Great location
desc: Located across the road to China town and mrt stations. Can walk to Marina Bay within 20 mins. Although the rooms are small but all that you require is provided. Well equipped gym good wifi. 2 buffet breakfast at $61 a bit over the top.

title: Brilliant
desc: Myself, wife and son aged 13 stayed at the hotel for 4 days. I can only commend the polit, friendly and efficient staff. The room was all we needed and the breakfast was fantastic. We cannot wait for our next visit.

title: Great location, Comfortable and great staff
desc: The staff were lovely and polite. The room had amazing airconditioning, as well as comfy beds and pillows. It is within walking distance to China town, the museum and restaurants/cafes. I would recommend.

title: Almost. But not all the way
desc: This small hotel luxury hotel is lovely. Inaide and out. Lobby is nice . It has a roof top bar. And its sits on the border to Chinatown in singapore. Habe 80 room.. I have kingsize beed in a small room. Tv is small for a hotel with its 32 inch mounted on the wall. Bed is large and firm. Duve and pillow are soft and nice. I do not understand the wallpaper repair they have done on one wall...make it look old and worn. Also its not as clean as i would like it to be...that is on the same wall so ill guess that is a general issue with that wall and that i was unlucky with my room Service was nice and polite....release of looked funds on credittcard could take month!...that is to long in all context for us road warriors that stay in hotel 2 weeks and more pr month

title: Interesting hotel, worth a stay.
desc: On a recent stopover in Singapore we chose The Scarlet for somewhere different. We're glad we chose this place. Reservation online was easy as the website is good. The hotel has street appeal as it is a converted row of tenement houses. Because of the nature of these houses the rooms are small although the hotel gives a clear description of this on their website. So not much more than a bed, wardrobe and a small desk. The bathroom however is more than adequate. One of the features of the hotel is the scarlet theme and this is very tastefully done with interesting furnishings and decor. One highlight of the hotel though is the staff. Service could not be faulted. Breakfast in the restaurant was also very good. We'd be more than happy to stay at The Scarlet again next time we

title: Beautiful Hotel
desc: Beautiful hotel. Different room have different looks, when I went to my colleague’s room. Very different from other hotels. Would be better if there are windows, must remember to ask for one, or pay a bit more. I think some layout cannot fit a window. No complaint. Very helpful and friendly staff. We didn’t touristy things, but all the staff was willing to give us suggestions and direction. Drinking and eating places very nearby. Feel very welcomed. Staff Joey and Russell was always smiling and look ready to help. Will come again next time.

title: Friendly and helpful staffs
desc: This is my first time oversea trip with my younger sister. At first, I’m so worried how this trip will turn out since I haven’t done any plans before and especially there is not much review about this hotel from travellers in my country. But as soon as I arrived to the hotel, I suddenly know that I made a right decision :) The staffs at the front counter is very kind and friendly. Although English is not my first language, they try to understand and help me as much as they can. For example, they helped me booking for ‘Hai Di Lao’ restaurant so I can just walk-in and enjoyed my dinner. The room is also nice and clean. I left note and request for a new shower gel, the staff had completed my request and reply me back with compliment for my handwriting Lol How sweet they are! Now we

title: Disappointed
desc: Fortunately we were only booked in for one night. The room we were given only had a high level window, you would have to be 8ft plus to to see out of it. The patched wallpaper damp patches on the skirting boards and general unkempt appearance left much to be desired.we asked for another room and were offered one on the 1st floor. No problem with this room. Breakfast 5 out of 10 Reception staff friendly and helpful. Hotel located in Chinatown.

title: Old world class and elegance
desc: In spite of our room with balcony being very tiny, it was extremely comfortable with quality fittings and linen. The bathroom was large, the plumbing was good and the shower was perfect. Our balcony looked across at a parking station so in hindsight, we would not choose to have a balcony again. Thanks very much for the use of the Handy mobile phone which was great!

title: Very nice hotel
desc: We stayed at the scarlet for 3 nights. It is located in Chinatown literally round the corner from Ang Sian Rd which is buzzing on a fri & sat night. Great location to see all the sights. Our room was in the basement, it was very dark and very quiet do we slept well. Staff were very friendly

title: Unique, boutique hotel with great stafff
desc: We stayed here for a 3 day stopover on the way to Europe and again on our return three weeks later. While the hotel is quirky and in a great location close to Chinatown and an MRT station, the best feature is the staff, they were amazing. We had a stuff up with one of our onward flights and the staff were very accommodating and helpful. On our return a couple of weeks later we were given an upgrade without asking, most welcome since we were both exhausted. Each room comes with a phone enabled with data for guests to use, helpful for getting around when you are out and about. We will stay here again.

title: Great hotel and location, boutique feel
desc: We stayed for 2 nights while transiting to Indonesia. The Scarlet feels like a quirky, homely place. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed, but not all that spacious. Staff were VERY friendly and helpful, even helping us avoid small details like uplifts on taxi bookings. We would stay here again for sure. There was MRT work going on while we stayed, but we heard nothing noise-wise.

title: Great stay at this hotel, wonderful, very helpful staff.
desc: Lovely quirky hotel, not the biggest of rooms but very clean and had everything you require on a room only basis. Staff very helpful over our upcoming cruise query inviting us to contact the cruise company in the United States to resolve the issues. Russell the gentleman on reception was so professional with a friendly manner, nothing was a problem. Great location for China town were you get great food. Only downside, the roof top restaurant did not live up to its name, and was rather lacking in comforts and decoration quality. However this did not detract from our stay.

title: A great stay at the Scarlet
desc: The Scarlet Hotel Singapore was the perfect choice for my brief stopover. In town for only one night, I wanted to stay somewhere close to good food and wine and literally taste a bit of the city. The Scarlett was a great choice for food and wine adventures. The hotel is located in Chinatown and is also within walking distance to Duxton Rd, boasting a botique selection of eateries and wine bars. Club St is also close by for a late night cocktail and snack. One minute away from the hotel is the famous Maxwell Hawker Centre. Try the Hainanese chicken and rice. Location aside, the hotel was is stylishly furnished and very comfortable. Rich and warm furnishings decorate the lobby. The staff were friendly, polite and attentive too, only to happy assist with queries.

title: Great boutique hotel
desc: There were three couples staying at the Scarlett. Friendly staff who were very accommodating. Location was perfect, so close to China town, bars and restaurants just around the corner where you can eat outside on the streets, great atmosphere. Rooms in the hotel very clean and lovely crisp linen. The rooms are small but for the price who can complain. Still very comfortable.
